loans.name: Khanbala

texts.en: Khanbala S. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children. He has been breeding cattle since his youth, owing to his father who was a farmer with a rich experience in cattle breeding. He is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Khanbala keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife, who all help him with caring for the animals. Now Khanbala needs a loan to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka N. is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her two children. Maleyka works diligently caring for cows at a facility at her home, and then her husband sells them at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, the cattle have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en: Matanat is a mother of 2 children. She lives in city of Baku. She started this business five years ago. She was born in 1965. Now she needs a loan to buy foodstuffs to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara lives in small village of the Saatli region, Azerbaijan. She is single and lives with her parents, who she also cares for. Living a hard and poor life, Elnara decided to start her own business ito earn some money and improve the life of her parents who are on a pension now. She purchases cattle and raises them, feeds them, and then her father takes them for selling to the local livestock bazaar. Also her father pastures calves while Elnara takes care of her mother. As she is officially "unemployed" she is looking for alternatives. Elnara is currently requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more calves, and she hopes to expand her business in order to continue to support her family.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Dilber

texts.en: Dilber Q. is 42 years old, she is single, and she is the only one who cares for her parents. Since her youth Dilber has been breeding calves. She learned it from her parents who are farmers but now are very old and need care. Dilber's dream is to become the owner of a big farm. Now Dilber wants to expand her business, and as her parents are getting older, she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle and provide for her parents better. She is requesting 1200 dollars for the term of 15 months in order to purchase more cattle. Dilber expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan pn time.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: David

texts.es: David cuenta con 24 años de edad, convive hace 8 años con la madre de sus 2 hijos, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de sus suegros, hasta que puedan ahorrar y construir su casa. Hace varios años atrás estuvo trabajando como chofer de motocarro y automóvil, haciendo servicio de transporte interurbano en la ciudad, pero exactamente hace 2 años se compró su motocarro para realizar servicio a domicilio, este trabajo le es muy rentable, ya que al día, descontando todos los gastos, gana entre 40 a 50 soles diarios. David inicia su labor a las 6:00am hasta las 8:00pm. En esta época, debido a que los alumnos están de vacaciones, no le es muy rentable trabajar con su moto, entonces cree que mejor será alquilar su motocarro hasta que mejore la plaza, mientras tanto trabajará como guardián de una cochera de unos familiares, los cuales le darán un sueldo fijo, y más el alquiler de la moto tendrá lo suficiente para cubrir sus gastos. David cree que si no trabaja su motocarro las piezas se vayan a malograr, por ello ha visto por conveniente alquilarla mientras mejore la demanda, y retome su trabajo. Cuando David solicitó su primer préstamo con MFP se comprometió a pagar todas su cuotas, y así lo vino realizando hasta ahora que es su sexto crédito. El dinero solicitado servirá para pagar la tarjeta de circulación de su moto a la municipalidad, con el resto comprará llantas para su vehículo.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and has lived with the mother of his 2 children for the past 8 years. Currently he is living in his in-laws home, until he can save enough money to build his own house. A few years back he worked as a motorcycle taxi and car chauffer providing intercity transport. Exactly 2 years go he purchased his own motorcycle taxi to provide a delivery service; this job is very profitable for David, given that daily, after discounting costs, he earns between 40 and 50 soles. David begins his workday at 6:00am and ends at 8:00pm. During this time of year, due to the fact that students are on vacation, it is not very profitable for him to work with his motorcycle, which leads him to believe that it would be better to rent out his motorcycle taxi until the main square improves. In the meantime he will work as a security guard at the garage of some relatives who will provide him a fixed salary. This salary and the money he will earn from renting out his motorcycle will provide him with enough to cover his expenses. David believes that if he does not work on his motor taxi the parts will breakdown, for which he sees most convenient to rent out his motor taxi until demand improves and he takes up his job again. When David requested his first loan with the Microfinanzas PRISMA bank he committed himself to pay all his quotas, and he has done so up to date when he is his sixth loan. The money David has requested will serve to purchase a taxi operation permit from the municipality, and with the rest he will purchase tires for his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a taxi operation permit and tires for his motor taxi.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José, de 39 años es padre de dos hijos, convive hace aproximadamente 13 años con la madre de sus hijos, tiempo en el cual pudo construir su casa en una zona alta cercana a sus campos de cultivo. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a labrar la tierra, siembra frutos cítricos y plátanos, pero no solo se ocupa en su chacra, sino que también trabaja para los vecinos que requieran de sus servicios para abrir trochas, dependiendo el tamaño cobra entre 200 a 300 soles, de acuerdo a los arbustos que estén en la tierra, según la dificultad varía el precio. Cuando llega el momento de la cosecha de sus frutos prepara la carga para llevarla al mercado, esto lo realiza cada quincena o fines de mes. El resto de los días recoge la cosecha desde las 4.00am, ya que tiene que preparar con tranquilidad la carga y horas más tarde el calor intenso y no le deja trabajar cómodamente. Cuando hay compradores en el campo vende por arrobas, que consiste en 12 kilos de plátano, todos estos preparativos los realiza para los meses de abril y mayo, donde cuesta mejor el plátano; mientras que los cítricos, su buena temporada es en los meses de enero a marzo. José prefiere pagar el transporte de sus frutas a la ciudad y venderlas él mismo, porque así le es más rentable que vendiendo a los compradores que van a las chacras y pagan un precio menor. Es la primera vez que pide préstamo con MFP, y tiene la predisposición de pagar con puntualidad, ya que no quiere fallarles a los demás socios de su banco comunal que ya están en el sexto préstamo, pues él acaba de ingresar. Con el dinero solicitado podrá mantener su chacra con el abonado correspondiente, y considera que es lo suficiente por el momento.
texts.en:
José is 39 and the father of two children. He has been living with the mother of his children for roughly 13 years, during which she has been able to build a house in the highlands near his farmland. He has been working the land since he was very young, sowing citrus fruit and bananas. In addition to tending his farm, he works for his neighbours who need his services to create trails for which he charges between 200 and 300 soles depending on the size of the trail, the size of the shrubs to be removed, and the difficulty of the particular job. At harvest time, he prepares loads of fruit to take to market, usually every two weeks or at month-end. At other times, he harvests from 4:00 in the morning as he must take his time to prepare the loads correctly and later in the day it is intensely hot and uncomfortable to work in. When there are buyers in the area he sells in bulk: bananas are sold in 12 kilogram loads. He makes these preparations in April and May, when the price of bananas is better. Citrus fruit, however, are at their peak from January to March. José prefers to pay to have his fruit transported to the city and sell it himself because he makes more money this way than by selling to the buyers who come to the farms and pay a lower price. This is the first loan he is asking for from MFP and he is able to pay on time as he does not want to let down the other members of his community bank who are on their sixth loan, as he is a new member. He will use the loan to fertilize his farm, and he feels this is enough for now.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farms.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Muraho (hello) from Jean Bosco M. in Nyarugenge District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean Bosco is 31 years old, and married with 2 children and one orphan.

Jean Bosco runs a small paper store where he sells different office equipment like papers, rulers, pens, files, staples, staple machines, different notebooks, and he also makes invitation cards.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: A. Chantal s’est mariée avec MIDOHOUNFO Martin. Elle est née a 1979 et elle a un enfant de 15 ans. Elle gère ses activités depuis 20 ans quand elle a commencé sa vente des liqueurs et des vivres. Le crédit lui a permis de s’approvisionner en gros et d’ajouter les vêtements. Elle aimerait acheter les divers en gros dans le futur.
texts.en:
Ms. Chantal A. is married to Mr. Martin MIDOHOUNFO. She was born in 1979 and has a 15-year-old child. She started working twenty years ago selling liqueurs and staple goods. This loan will enable her to get supplies in bulk and to include the sale of clothing. She would love to buy various items wholesale in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple goods

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 39 años, convive por 15 años con su pareja, tiempo que le ha permitido construir su casa y darles comodidad a sus hijos. Hace 5 años estuvo dedicada a la venta de pollos y en horas de la tarde vendía de productos de la marca Unión, la cual produce panes y variedades de queques y pasteles, pero exactamente hace dos años se propuso a dedicarse solo a la venta de estos productos, porque todo este tiempo le ha servido para hacer clientela y por ello han aumentado sus pedidos. Olga empieza a visitar a sus clientes a partir de las 7.00am, y así continúa hasta 10.00am, luego regresa a casa para cocinar los alimentos para su esposo e hijos, y luego, nuevamente a las 3.00 de la tarde empieza con las cobranzas hasta las 8.00pm. A Olga le agrada conversar con sus clientes acerca de las bondades de su producto, y de paso les va dando una orientación acerca de nutrición y alimentación, ella está muy contenta de vender estos productos, ya que le es muy rentable, además tiene plazos para que pueda pagar su cuenta a la promotora que le proporciona la mercadería. Olga viene trabajando con su banco comunal durante casi 3 años, este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y al momento de solicitar dicho crédito ha renovado su promesa de pagar todas sus cuotas. Con este dinero comprará panteones, postre tradicional que vende por navidad e inicios de año, el resto de meses ofrece panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, has lived for 15 years with her partner, allowing her to build her house and make her children comfortable. She had sold chickens for the last 5 years, and in the afternoon she sold Unión brand products, such as breads, cakes, and pastries. Exactly two years ago she decided to exclusively sell these products, because in all that time she had built up her clientele and increased her orders. Olga starts visiting her clients at 7:00am until 10:00am, then she returns to her house to cook food for her husband and children, and then again at 3:00pm she works on collections until 8:00pm. Olga enjoys talking with her clients about the benefits of her product, along the way giving them information about nutrition and healthy foods. She is so happy to be selling these products, it is very profitable for her, as well as that she is able to pay her bill to the merchandise distributor in installments. Olga has been working with her communal bank for almost 3 years, and this will be her sixth loan through MFP. At the time she requested this loan, she renewed her commitment to pay every payment. With this money she will buy "panteones", a traditional dessert sold at Christmastime and New Years, and the breads and pastries she sells the rest of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise she has to sell

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 27 años, hace 5 años que vive con su pareja, y ya es madre de una hija, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de su madre. En época escolar se dedica a vender golosinas en el cafetín del colegio nocturno ubicado al costado de su casa, esta actividad la viene desarrollando por tres años, de lunes a viernes, de 5.00pm hasta las 10.00pm, para tener surtido el cafetín ha visto por conveniente preparar comida. Su venta diaria en este negocio es de 100 soles, asimismo, por las mañana vende productos de panadería en la puerta de su casa, y por estos productos, cada fin de mes hace una inversión de 350 soles, y cuando cobra obtiene una ganancia entre 150 y 200 soles al mes. Erika es una mujer muy activa, está muy contenta con la actividad que desarrolla, sobre todo porque le es muy rentable y le permite cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el cafetín, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades, ya que todo lo que prepara lo vende, pero en los productos de panadería, a veces tiene que bajar los precios para poder terminar su stock y recuperar su capital, pero no sucede constantemente. Este es su sexto préstamo consecutivo con  MFP, y todo este tiempo ha pagado con responsabilidad sus cuotas y quiere seguir trabajando en su banco comunal y con la institución, a la cual le tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero solicitado lo usará en el pago de sus pedidos de productos de panadería, específicamente los panteones, por época de navidad.
texts.en:
Erika, 27, has lived with her partner for 5 years and is the mother of one daughter. For now they are living in her mother's house. During the school year she sells candies in the night school located next to her house. For three years, from Monday to Friday, from 5:00pm to 10:00pm, she has been keeping the cafeteria stocked, and it has been convenient to prepare meals as well. Her daily sales from this business have been about 100 soles. In the morning she also sells bread products at the door of her house, every month investing 350 soles, and after paying for the products, she makes a profit of between 150 and 200 soles per month. Erika is a very active woman who is happy with the work she does, above all because it is profitable and allows her to cover the household expenses. In the cafeteria, up to the present she has had no problems, since she sells everything she prepares, but in the bread products, at times she has to lower the prices in order to clear out her stock and cover her investment, but she is not always successful. This is her sixth consecutive loan through MFP, and in all this time she has repaid her installments responsibly. She wants to continue working with her communal bank and with this institution, to which she is very grateful. The money she is requesting will be used to pay for her bread orders, especially for "panteones", a special product for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her Christmas orders

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia, de 25 años convive hace 8 años con su pareja, es madre de tres hijos, y hace unos meses atrás acaba de construir su propia casa. Es una ama de casa muy dedicada, cada día prepara el almuerzo de su esposo y eso de las 11.00am lo envía en el transporte de la empresa minera donde labora su esposo, hace como un año atrás incursionó en la venta de productos de belleza y le está yendo muy bien, cada vez aumenta su clientela. El deseo de Leticia es crecer en su negocio para contar con su propio capital de reserva, ya que a veces cuando sus clientes no le han pagado a tiempo, tiene que recurrir al dinero que le deja su esposo para luego reponerlo, pero ella prefiere tener sus propios recursos, por lo que se está esforzando mucho. Además, está muy contenta de dedicarse solo a las labores domésticas, sino que también se considera una mujer útil, ya que de sus ganancias con la venta de cosméticos puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos, también está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible su obtención del crédito. Con el dinero que solicita pagará los pedidos de la caja de cosméticos mensual, de ese modo podrá empezar a juntar su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Leticia, 25, has lived with her partner for 8 years, is the mother of three children, and several months ago completed the construction of her own house. She is a dedicated homemaker, preparing lunch every day for her husband to send at 11:00am on the mining transport to where her husband works. About a year ago she started selling beauty products, which is going well for her, with a steadily increasing clientele. Leticia's desire is to grow her business so she can have her own cash reserves, since sometimes when her clients don't pay her on time, she has to use the money given to her by her husband and later to replace it--she would prefer to have her own reserves, which she is working hard towards. She is very content to spend her time in her own household, but she also considers herself to be a practical woman, since her earnings from the cosmetic sales cover her children's expenses. This is her sixth loan through MFP, and during this time she has shown herself to be very responsible in her payments. She is very grateful to the persons who make it possible for her to obtain her loans. With the money she is requesting, she will pay her monthly bill for her box of cosmetics, and will be able to begin accumulating her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her last cosmetics invoice

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Greetings from Gorette M. in Nyarugenge district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Gorette is 35 years old and the mother of 5 kids.

In 2005, Gorette started her business selling shoes for kids and adults. This entrepreneur buys shoes from neighboring countries (Uganda and Kenya) in bulk and sells them in the local markets. Her capital has accumulated to over $1150 over the past four years. She employs two people and makes about $95 every month. The loan she has requested will help her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: A. Béatrice est née le 18 janvier 1970 et elle s’est mariée avec BOUSSOUDAHO Hubert. Elle a arrete ses études au secondaire. Elle a 6 enfants âgés de 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, et 3. Il y a 6 ans elle a commencé son activité de vente de vivres et le charbon. Il y a 3 mois elle a commencé la poissonnerie. Dans le futur, elle voudrait developper sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Ms. Béatrice A. was born on January 18, 1970 and is married to Mr. Hubert BOUSSOUDAHO. She ended her studies in middle school. She has six children, ages 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3. Six years ago, she began working, selling staple goods and charcoal. Three months ago, she started selling fish. In the future, she would like to develop her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Umwaka mushya muhire (Happy new year) from Saidi N. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Saidi is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children. 

This entrepreneur has been a motorbike driver for eight years, but what is amazing is that he was able to buy his own motorbike and as a result of this business he also bought a house for his family. This man gets up early, around 5:00 am, every day to start transporting people to their workplaces. Saidi is requesting a loan to help him buy another motorbike. His goal is to send all his siblings to school.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur was born in 1981, is married, and lives in the city of Baku. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now, he needs a loan to buy the necessary things to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Primo A.

texts.es:
Primo trabaja de chofer asalariado de servicio publico, la esposa es comerciante de golosinas y masitas en la puerta de un colegio; tienen dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad, comparten una casa con su hermano. La casa fue un regalo de sus padres y está ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción para hacer la división de la casa, pues vivir en un solo patio con su hermano le ocasiona diferencias familiares. De esta forma podrá vivir tranquilo con su familia.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Primo works as a salaried public transit driver, and his wife sells sweets and "masitas" at the entrance to a college. They have two children 10 and 6 years old, and share a house with his brother. The house was a gift from their parents and is located in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This loan is destined to buy construction materials to split the house, because to live in a single common area with his brother causes family problems. In this way he will be able to live peacefully with his family. This is his first loan through Impro, his completed evaluation qualifies him for the amount he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks and cement to put up a dividing wall in his house.

loans.name: Berthe

texts.fr: S. Berthe est née le 5 juillet 1970. Elle s’est mariée avec ASSOGBA Noel. Ils ont 3 enfants, Jacques, 10 ans ; Carole, 8 ans ; Marthe, 1 an. Les deux enfants sont scolarisés et l’autre n’est pas encore en âge. Elle exerce son commerce dans la vente de divers depuis 3 ans. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter les savons de lessive et les boites de conserve. Elle achète ses produits a Dantokpa. Le crédit lui a permis de faire l’approvisionnement et de porter d’aide a son mari. Elle voudrait développer son activité dans le futur avec la vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Berthe S. was born on July 15, 1970. She is married to Mr. Noel ASSOGBA, and they have three children, Jacques, age 10 ; Carole, age 8; and Marthe, age 1. Two are in school and the third is not yet of age. Ms. S. has been doing commerce in various items for three years. With this loan, she is going to buy laundry soaps and canned food. She buys her goods in Dantokpa. The loan will enable her to stock up and to bring help to her husband. She would like to develop her business in the future with the sale of cloth.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps and canned food

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
Nemecio trabaja como chofer asalariado de servicio publico interciudad, la esposa es comerciante tiene tres hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años de edad, vive en alquiler en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar en la compra de su herramienta de trabajo (Taxi) con lo que podrá trabajar independientemente y generar mayores ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Nemecio works as a salaried driver of intercity public transit. His wife is in business. He has three children, of 10, 6, and 3 years of age. He lives in a rented place in Pampahasi, a part of the city La Paz. This loan would be used to help with the purchase of his working tool (a taxi) with which he would be able to work independently and generate better income for his family. This is his first credit with IMPRO, our test qualified him for the loan he is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the taxi he currently drives but does not own

loans.name: Isaac M.

texts.es:
Isaac trabaja de transportista tiene una movilidad de servicio publico inter- ciudad La Paz - El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su dos pequeños hijos y esposa; viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la conversión de combustible de gasolina a gas licuado vehicular mismo que le permitirá un ahorro del 50% de gasto en combustible, con lo que incrementaran sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado por Isaac.
texts.en:
Isaac works in transportation. He has a ZZZ in intercity public transit in La Paz, in El Alto. This is his principal source of income with which he covers the expenses of his two small children and his wife. They live in their own home, located in Pasankeri, an area of the city of La Paz. This loan would be destined to convert his gasoline engine to natural gas, which would allow him to save 50% of the expense of gasoline, with which he would increase his family’s income. This is his first loan with IMPRO, our test qualified him for the loan requested for Isaac.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To convert a taxi engine to use natural gas instead of gasoline

loans.name: Wilson R.

texts.es:
El señor Wilson C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tembladerani, en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Paola Mercado y su hijo.
El señor Wilson trabaja como empleado en una fábrica textil de esta ciudad, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
Su vivienda, debido a su antigüedad y al deterioro necesita el cambio del muro lateral al vecino.
El crédito será destinado a la construcción del muro lateral de su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Wilson C. lives in his own home in Tembladerani, which is on the east side of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Señora Paola Mercado, and his son. Señor Wilson works as an employee in a textile factory in this city. His wife is a housewife. His house, thanks to its age and deterioration, needs to change the wall next to his neighbour. This loan would be used for the construction of the side wall of his home. This is the second time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis revealed that he is well qualified and able to have access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the cost of constucting a side wall of his house

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  vive en la  zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, los cuales administran un pequeño taller de costura.

Se dedica  al transporte urbano como chofer  de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción ( estuco, cemento, pinturas) y asi realizar algunas mejoras en sus  habitaciones ya que por temporada de lluvias se encuentran deterioradas. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Edgar lives in Achachicala, a part of the city of La Paz. He lives in a house with his parents and his children, who run a small sewing factory. He works in urban transit, as a driver of a taxi in a central route of the city. This credit would be used to get the materials for construction (stucco, cement, paint) and so be able to make improvements in his home, which was damaged during the rainy season. This is his second loan with IMPRO, our test qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stucco, cement, and paint to make improvements on two rooms in his house

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijo en la calle Illampu de la zona Rosario de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como chofer realizando viajes a Oruro en transporte libre; con estos ingresos él mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para instalar un sitio de servicio de Internet en la casa de sus suegros lugar donde su esposa podrá atender y de esta  manera aumentar sus ingresos.

No tiene Historial por que es cliente nuevo pero por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Robert lives in his parents' house with his wife and son on Illampu street in the Rosario zone in the city of La Paz. He works as a taxi driver making trips to Oruro; he supports his family with the income. He seeks credit to install a site for Internet service in the house of his in-laws that his wife could attend to and increase their income. He does not have history of loans because he is a new client but his social character qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install internet service for the public

loans.name: Camara

texts.fr: Camara Z. est née vers 1965. Elle a 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Au début, elle a commencé avec la couture. Depuis 5 ans elle commence la vente de beignets et l’igname frite (une nourriture traditionnelle béninoise). Avec le crédit, elle va acheter un sac d’igname et 5 kg de haricots. Le crédit qu'elle avait eu lui a permis de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait changer d’activité.
texts.en:
Camara Z. was born in 1965 and has four children who are all in school. In the beginning, she started with sewing. Five years ago, she began selling beignets (a kind of doughnut) and fried yams (a traditional Beninese food). With this loan, she is going to buy a sack of yams and 5 kg of beans. The loan that she used to have enabled her to support her family. In the future, she would like to change her field of business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of yams and 5 kg of beans

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou D. a 48 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six (6) enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente de pâtes et tubercules de manioc afin d’ en faire de  l’Attieke. Elle a appris cette activité  depuis maintenant vingt (20) ans auprès d’une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal en compagnie de ses amies. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle, qui vient acheter en gros et les revendre en détail pour la qualité de ses produits.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle decida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre (4) ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association de femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC) , tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 30 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) et 15 sacs de manioc à Sikasso afin de les mélanger pour donner d’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Vu son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame   Safiatou D.   vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée trés généralement de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts.
texts.en:
Madam Safiatou D. is 48 years old and lives in a large family with her husband and six children (one boy and five girls) in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work without success, she got initiated in this work buying and selling pasta and cassava tubers in order to make "attiéké". She learned how to do this twenty years ago from a neighbor from the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire. She works at home in the company of her friends. Because of the quality of her products, she is in high demand by her customers, who come to buy wholesale and to sell retail.

To satisfy her growing customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, with a women's association in her district (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), she is on her second PIC (a commercial individual loan). She intends to use the loan to buy 30 sacks of cassava pasta (tièkèdoro) in Bouaké (in Côte d'Ivoire) and 15 sacks of cassava in Sikasso in order to mix them to make good quality attiéké.

Because of her work experience in the district, she sells her merchandise to customers composed mostly of women, cash or credit accepted. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta and cassava root

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna del Carmen L. Balitan tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Reyna tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 26 años trabaja por cuenta propia su hijo de 24 años no estudia y su hijo menor de 22 años no estudia, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de seguir con la actividad económica por lo que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tiene que buscar el pan de cada día tanto para su familia como para ella misma en sus deseos esta el tener salud para seguir luchando por le trabajo ya que también en sus deseos quiere realizar un viaje al extranjero por lo que le gustaría conocer otras partes del mundo sus sueños son de sacar adelante a su familia para que en un futuro ellos puedan hacerse cargo del negocio y no tengan dificultades para resolver problemas.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general por lo que vende productos como: camisas, ropa interior, calcetines y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Reyna inicio este negocio porque desde que era joven le gustaba trabajar por lo que esto dio la pauta para ella comenzara con otro negocio como lo fue la venta de prendas de oro pero con el tiempo este tipo de negocio no le favoreció por lo que los diferentes clientes no pagaron las deudas contraídas con Doña Reyna por lo que decide iniciar con otro negocio y comienza ofertando los productos como: ropa nueva, cosméticos, perfumes y prendas de plata por lo que así obtiene este negocio y sus diferentes clientes por lo que al principio le fue muy difícil conseguir lo que ha obtenido actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar una serie de compras ya que las realiza en Managua y Chinandega de los siguientes productos como cremas, perfumes, prendas de plata por lo que da las gracias a las Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que dan ayuda para que se lleven a cabo los sueños y los propósitos a cumplir.
texts.en:
Reyna del Carmen L. Balitan is 50 years old. She is not married. Reyna has 3 sons whose ages are the following: her oldest son is 26 years old and works for himself; her 24 year old son is not studying; and her youngest son, who is 22, does not study. Her life partner works for himself. Her goal is to continue with her work because it is the only source of income for her family. She has to look for the daily sustenance for her family as well as for herself. She hopes to have good health so that she can continue with her work; another of her hopes is to be able to travel because she would like to see other parts of the world. Her dream is to help her family get ahead so that in the future they can take over the business and not have any difficulties resolving problems. Reyna works in general sales and she sells products such as: blouses, underwear, socks, and other things. She is a street vendor and has had this business for 15 years. Reyna began this business because she has always liked to work, ever since she was young. This gave her the idea to begin a business selling gold jewelry, but over time this didn’t go well for her because some customers didn’t pay the debts they had with her. So, she decided to start another business and started offering products such as: new clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She established this business and gained customers. It was difficult at first, but now things are going well. The loan is for working capital so that she can make purchases in Managua and Chinandega of the following products: lotions, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She is grateful to Fundación León 2000 and the organizations that give their help so that she can carry out her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Salia

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Salia G. est âgé de 36 ans et vit avec son épouse et leurs 2 enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Salia G. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, il s’est initié à cette activité de couture depuis maintenant sept (07) ans. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un des maîtres tailleurs les plus talentueux de la ville de Sikasso.  Il mène son activité au nouveau marché d’Hamdallaye, au bord du goudron où il dispose son atelier de couture. Monsieur G. est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida   d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre (04) mois avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter une (1) machine de brodérie.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Salia G., 36, lives with his wife and their two children in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. G., after having tried out a number of businesses without success, began his present tailoring business about 7 years ago. He learned the trade from one of the most talented master tailors of the town of Sikasso. He has his workshop in the new open-air market of Hamdallaye, on the side of the paved road. Mr. G. is much in demand since his clientele recognizes the quality of his work.

In the hope of better satisfying the needs of his ever growing clientele, he decided to join the institution of micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso four months ago, and he is now on his first individual loan. With this loan he intends to purchase an embroidery machine.

With the loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which will go toward supporting his family, making repayments on his loan, while investing any remainder back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of an embroidery machine

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is fifty years old. She is widowed but has given birth to six children: two boys and four girls. Almost all her children are out of school. The last born dropped out of school due to ill health. Together with some of her children, she lives in a business community in the Eastern Region of Ghana called Nkawkaw.

Ama works hard to provide for her children. She is a fish monger and also runs a cold store in the local market square. She sells fresh and smoked fish and meat, such as grass cutter. She procures her goods from the big cold stores in Kumasi that sell at wholesale prices. Ama has been in business for over fifteen years. She says one of her daughters helps on very busy days. According to Ama, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk and also to acquire bigger refrigerators.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk and also to acquire bigger refrigerators.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: two girls and a boy. She says one of her children is in the senior high school, one in the junior high school, and the other one is a lady who owns a hair dressing salon in the town in which they live. She lives with her children in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Martha works hard to support her husband in the children’s upbringing. Her husband sells minerals while she is a food vendor. She cooks rice and yam slice with stew. She buys bags of rice and tubers of yam from Kumasi and sometimes from surrounding villages. Martha has been in business for over fifteen years. Apart from the food selling, Martha also treks in maize. She distributes to food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and tubers of yam on large scale so that she can cut down on the costs of frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice and tubers of yam in bulk.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca C. S. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada Doña Francisca tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes el mayor de sus hijos tiene la edad de 22 años no trabaja su otro hijo de 20 años cursa el 4 año de su carrera en una universidad publica y su hijo menor de 17 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos para con su negocio son que siempre se mantenga activo para que la afluencia de sus clientes no decaiga ya que ellos son la clave para que su negocio se mantenga sus deseos son de que sus hijos puedan administrar perfectamente este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan  un poco de ingresos para subsistir sus sueños son de tener otro negocio que contenga una diversidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y además tener suficiente vida para lograr ver esto en un futuro.

La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es una sala de videos juegos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su c asa de habitación con la siguiente dirección costado norte de la iglesia de Guadalupe 75 varas al oeste, el tiempo que tiene Doña Francisca de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, sus inicios en este negocio surgen de la manera siguiente el negocio se origina por la necesidad de hacer frente a la situación económica y al encarecimiento de la canasta básica la idea surgió por los hijos de Doña Francisca ya que ellos tenían palystations, Mario cars y otros  por lo que los diferentes vecinos que en su mayoría son niños por lo que su Mama decide realizar la compra de mas equipos para establecer su negocio en su casa de habitación y es así como al paso del tiempo ella consigue la fama de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para mejorar la calidad de de los servicios y de los equipos para ofertar a los clientes lo mejor en calidad de sus juegos ya que la compra de estos son muy caros y tiene que viajar hasta Managua.
texts.en:
Francisca C. S. is 51 years old. She is married and she has 3 children whose ages are the following: her oldest child is 22 years old and isn't working; her other son is 20 years old and is in the 4th year of study at a public university; her youngest son is 17 years old and is in his 4th year of high school. Her life partner works for himself. Her goal for her business is to always stay active so that the number of customers won’t drop off, since they are crucial to her business. Her hope is that her children will be able to run this business so that in the future they will have some income. Her dreams are to have another business with a variety of products to offer to her customers, and also to live long enough to see this happen. Francisca has a video game business. It is located in her house, at the following address: to the north of the Guadalupe church, 75 varas [unit of distance measurment] to the west. Francisca has had this business for 2 years. This is how she became involved in it--it came about because of the need to deal with the economic situation and because of her dwindling ability to buy basic food items. It was Francisca’s children who thought of the idea. They have Playstations, Mario cars, and other video games. Most of their neighbors have children, so Francisca decided to to buy more video game equipment to start her business in her house. As time has gone by, she has become more well-known. The loan is for working capital to improve the servcies she offers and also to improve the equipment she has so that she can offer the best quality in games. These are expensive and she has to travel to Managua to purchase them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia Owusu is thirty-four years old. She is divorced and has two children: a boy and a girl. Her children are both currently in school. She says her son is in the senior high school while her daughter is in the basic school. Sylvia says her ex-husband helps to cater for the children. However, the children live with her in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Sylvia runs a provision store to make some of the money needed to meet other demands of the children and herself. Her shop is located at the lorry station. She has been in business for three years now. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, and tin fish. Sylvia also trades in dresses and bags in other towns. She procures her goods from wholesalers in the big surrounding cities, such as Kumasi. She wants a loan to expand the size of her shop and also to buy goods in bulk. It is her dream to own one of the big supermarket shops in her community.

loans.use: To procure provision in bulk and expand her shop.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is thirty-three years old. She is divorced and has three children: two sons and a girl. She says her first child, her daughter, is currently learning a trade while her sons are in the basic school. Adwoa says her husband provides for the children in some ways. She lives with the children in a town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Adwoa owns a provision kiosk. She has been in business for eight years now. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, and tin fish. Adwoa procures her goods from wholesalers in the big surrounding cities, such as Kumasi, and at times in her community. She says her kiosk is located at the lorry junction and so makes good sales. She wants a loan to expand the size of her kiosk and also buys goods in bulk.

loans.use: To expand the size of her kiosk and also buys goods in bulk.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Gifty Acquah is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and a mother of four children: two boys and two girls. She lives with her children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. Gifty says she is the sole provider for her children’s needs. She says her ex-husband cares less about the children’s upbringing. She therefore works very hard to meet the children’s needs and, most importantly, to pay their school fees.

Gifty sells vegetables of all kinds, like tomatoes, peppers, onions, and garden eggs. She sells on a table top in front of her house. She says her target customers are the people in her community who walk all the way to the market everyday to buy such products. She buys from Kumasi and at times from farmers who come who to sell in the local market. She has been in business for ten years. Gifty wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk, like boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es:
La Empresaria de Nombre Leyla Isabel B. M. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Leyla tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes Esther Marina Blanco tiene la edad de 23 años y trabaja por cuenta propia su otra hija Caren Patricia tiene la edad de 21 años y trabaja por cuenta propia y su otro hijo Adalmar Antonio tiene la edad de 16 años y cursa el 3 año de secundaria, sus esposo labora como bodeguero en una empresa, Doña Leyla tiene los propósitos de darle mejoras a su  humilde vivienda con los ingresos obtenidos ya que Doña Leyla es una persona luchadora que le gusta salir adelante con su familia sus sueños son de tener su propio negocio en su casa de habitación por lo que actualmente ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante sus deseos son que no acabe la ayuda de los diferentes países ya que necesaria para cada uno de los nicaragüenses.

Su actividad económica es la de mercadería en general como es la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años, ella inicia este negocio por una amiga que le dio crédito para vender los productos y mas tarde con la ganancia lograba comprar productos para formar poco a poco su propio negocio por lo que al comienzo no le fue tan fácil distribuir sus productos pero conforme pasaba el tiempo fue que obtuvo su experiencia en este negocio y al ver que le generaba ingresos decidió invertir lo suficiente en el negocio por lo que ahora el motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y así ofertar mejores productos para cada uno de sus clientes y satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de ellos por lo que la mercadería la compra en los diferentes departamentos del país como Managua y Chinandega.
texts.en:
Leyla Isabel B. M. is 45 years old and she is married. She has 3 children, whose ages are the following: Esther Marina Blanco is 23 years old and works; her other daughter, Caren Patricia, is 21 years old and also works; her son, Adalmar Antonio, is 16 years old and is in the 3rd year of high school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper at a business. Leyla has the goal of improving her humble house with the income she earns because she is a determined person and likes to help her family. Her dream is to have her own business in her home, since she currently sells her products in the street. She hopes that other countries won’t end their help Nicaragua because it is necessary for all Nicaraguans. She sells general merchandise, such as: new clothing, cosmetics, and others. She sells as a street vendor. She has had this business for 7 years. She was able to begin it with a loan from a friend and later she was able to buy products with her earnings. In this way she was able to slowly build up her business. It wasn’t easy to distribute her products in the beginning, but over time she gained experience in the business. When she saw that she was making a profit, she decided to invest what was necessary in the business. Her motive for requesting a loan is to buy merchandise so she can offer better products to her customers and satisfy demand. She buys the merchandise in different departments of the country, such as Managua and Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Abena Agyekumwaa is fifty years old. She is widowed and has eight children: five sons and three daughters. She says three of her children are currently in the senior high school while the rest have completed school and are living independently. Abena lives together with her last three children in a town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Abena works very hard to provide for children and also pay their school fees. She sells tomatoes in boxes. She buys directly from the tomato farmers in the surrounding villages and sells at wholesale prices at the local market. She says most of her customers are food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for over fifteen years. Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy tomatoes in bulk so she can trek to other towns to do business.

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr: H. Moulikatou est née le 5 mai 1965. Elle est veuve et elle a deux enfants,  Fathyiath a 17 ans et Ashadou a 15 ans. Ils ont tous scolarisés. Elle a commencé sa commerce avec la vente des condiments comme la tomate fraiche, le piment, et les légumes. Actuellement elle vend les fruits comme les oranges, les mangues, l’ananas, et les bananes. Avec le crédit elle va acheter les fruits a Tokpa. Les autres crédits de Kiva lui a permis d’arrêter d’acheter a crédit, et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Dans le futur, elle voudrait développer votre activité par acheter en gros et aussi vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Moulikatou H. was born on May 5, 1965. She's a widow and has two school-attending children, Fathyiath (age 17) and Ashadou (age 15). She started her business selling condiments, such as fresh tomatoes, chili pepper, and vegetables. Today, she sells fruits such as oranges, mangoes, pineapples, and bananas. With this loan, she will go buy fruits in Tokpa. The former Kiva loans enabled her to buy supplies, and to pay the school expenses of her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business by buying and selling wholesale.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of fruits

loans.name: Obeng

texts.en:
Obeng A. is fifty-one years old and married with three children: two boys and a girl. All of Obeng’s children are in the basic school. He lives with his family and children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region.

Obeng enjoys trading very much. He owns a provision shop in which he sells groceries such as milk, milo, sugar, and biscuits. He also sells in a store in front of his house which is by the street. He sells the provisions mostly to the people in his community who walk all the way to the market to buy. He has been in business for five years. Obeng says that he buys some of the goods from the big shops nearby. He does, however, travel to the bigger towns to procure some of his groceries sometimes. He hopes to increase the quantity of goods that he buys at each trip so as to cut down on his frequent transportation and sell to more people in his neighborhood and even beyond.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is fifty-one years old. She is a widow and the mother of five children, two boys and three girls. She lives with her children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says one of her children has completed tertiary. Others are in senior high school and junior high school. Rita says she is the sole provider for her children’s needs. She therefore works very hard to meet the children’s needs and most importantly, pay their school fees.

Rita sells vegetables of all kinds – tomatoes, peppers, onions, garden eggs (a kind of small, whitish eggplant), etc. She sells in a kiosk in front of her house. She says she sells to the people in her community who otherwise would have to walk all the way to the market every day to buy such products.

Rita says that, in addition to the vegetables, she also sells charcoal. She buys from Kumasi and at times from wholesalers who come to sell in the local market. She has been in business for twenty years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Elizabeth M. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with four children between the ages of 10 and 18. Elizabeth has been running a crops selling business since 1990. Client’s business is to purchase crops from villages on a wholesale basis and sell them in town.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her brother. Elizabeth currently earns about 158 USD a month from her business. She is requesting 375 USD in order to purchase a bag (100kg) of rice, bag of beans, and transportation. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of rice, a bag of beans and transportation

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Imasumac Village Bank. “Imasumac” is Quechua for “How Beautiful.” She is 49 years old and is a widow. She had four children, but three of them died while young. She has one living child and also takes care of her nephew, both of whom live with her.

Elizabeth sells plastic products (mostly for the home and kitchen) from a stand in the Nery Garcia Market. Before she started this business, she worked as a nurse, a schoolteacher, and sold clothing. She has been a FINCA Perú client for the past four years. Her sister brought her to the Imasumac Village Bank, and her first loan was for just 300 soles (about US$100).

Today, Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more plastics to sell. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to get a chance to rest. She says that her son always tells her that she shouldn’t be working anymore, but she plans to keep working for as long as she can. Her goal used to be for her son to become a working professional, but now that he has become a police officer she has met this goal. She would like to see her nephew to graduate from college with a professional degree, too.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy plastics to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is sixty years old. She is divorced and the mother of ten children, four of whom are male and six female. She says for the past ten years, ever since she divorced, she has been taking care of the children. The grown-ups are now independent and working. She says her last born is in junior high school.

Cecilia lives with some of her children in a town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Cecilia enjoys trading very much. She owns a provision shop in which she sells groceries such as milk, Milo (malted milk powder), sugar, biscuits, bread, and many other food items. She has been in business for ten years.

Cecilia also sells tilapia and some vegetables on a small tabletop in front of her store. She says that she procures most of her goods from the big towns nearby. Cecilia wants to use the loan to procure goods in large quantity to stock her shop. She hopes to increase the size of her shop.

loans.use: To buy provisions to expand her shop

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a member of the Imasumac Village Bank. “Imasumac” is Quechua for “How Beautiful.” Cipriana is 37 years old and is married with four children. She has a small grocery store in the Carmen Alto neighborhood of Ayacucho. Each Friday, Cipriana travels to the countrysiD. to buy lambs so that she can sell their meat. She has had her business for the past six years, and works alone from 6am to 8pm each day.

Cipriana is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy a large freezer to store meat. She says that her goal for the future is to keep working at her store for the rest of her life. Having the store is a nice break from her previous job as a street vendor, which was very tiresome.

loans.use: Cipriana would like to buy a meat freezer to store meat that she sells.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta B., 52 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge dont 03 scolarisés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter du mil et du bois pour préparer de la bouillie et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration de l’alimentation et la santé de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fanta B., 52, is married and raising 5 children, of whom 3 are enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for 6 and a half years. Her business is buying millet and firewood to prepare and sell porridge. Her income permits her to help improve the nourishment and health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing millet and firewood to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet D. is forty years old. She is married and has three children. All her children have completed senior high school and are yet to continue their schooling. She lives with her husband and family in a business town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial activities.

Janet’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates oranges and palm nuts. Janet is in the business of palm oil production. She buys the palm nuts from local farmers in addition to what they harvest from her husband’s farm. She processes them at her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. She has been in business for eight years.

Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the fruit of a palm tree which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and boiled again to expel any water content. Janet desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Jane G.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Jane M., a married woman from Tukuyu. Jane has been running a shoe-selling and tailoring business since 2003. Her business is to purchase shoes from wholesellers and sell them retail.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Jane currently earns about 250 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase more shoes and tailoring materials in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of shoes she sells. Jane thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté, 39 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants scolarisés en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter du bissap, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre et autres pour faire des jus et glaces qu’elle vend. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration de l’entretient de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, 39, is married, raising four children, all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for two and a half years. Her business is buying bissap (hibiscus flowers), monkey bread (baobab tree fruit), sugar, etc. to make juice and popsicles for sale. Her income allows her to help support her family better. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing bissap, monkey bread, etc. to make juice and popsicles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is thirty-six years old. She is divorced and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She says she has been divorced for the past eight years. According to Elizabeth, her husband travelled overseas, only to let her know that they couldn't continue to be a couple.

Elizabeth says she takes care of the children alone. Her son is currently in senior high school while her daughter is learning a trade: hairdressing. Elizabeth is a food vendor. She sells fried yams and cocoyams by the roadside. She procures her goods from local farmers, at times on credit, and pays them back after her sales. She has been in this business for two years. Elizabeth wants a loan to buy the raw materials in bulk so that she can expand her business. She desires to pay for her son to attend university.

loans.use: To buy yams and cocoyams in bulk

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – a boy and five girls. Two of her children are currently in senior high school. Some have completed their schooling whilst others are in junior high school. She lives with her husband and family in a business town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial activities.

A.’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates cocoa and palm nuts. Janet is in the business of palm oil production. She says she runs this business with her husband. She buys palm nuts from local farmers and adds them to what little she harvests from her husband’s farm. She has been in business for eight years.

Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the fruit of the palm tree. A. desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou S., 54 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Château d’Eau Bignona depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du parfum, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du citron, de l’huile de palme, du sucre et  autres pour son activité de vente de parfum, de produits alimentaires et de glaces. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou S. is 54 years old, married, and is responsible for seven children. She has been a member of the "Château d’Eau Bignona " village bank for six and a half years. She wants to buy perfume, baobab fruit, lemons, palm oil, sugar and other products for resale. She sells perfume, foodstuffs and ice cream. She will repay the loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for resale:  foodstuff and perfume.

loans.name: Ashura E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Ashura M. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children between ages 6 and 7. Ashura has been running a clothes business since 1998. She sells clothes retail, including vitenge and khanga (Tanzanian traditional clothes).

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Ashura currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Ashura thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia B. is a forty five year old married woman. She has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls. Currently, all her children are in school. Patricia and her family live in Nkawkaw, a town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Nkawkaw is a business community. Her husband owns a provisions shop in the community they live in. She cooks food and sells it to the local people and with the profit supports her husband with taking care of the family. She sells ‘ampesi’ (stew with yam slices) to the school pupils on the local school grounds during the day. She also sells in the evenings from her home. She procures most of her stock from the surrounding villages where prices are quite reasonable.  The ‘yam ampesi’ is served hot with stew. Patricia has been in business for eighteen years and she is requesting a loan to buy food items in bulk.

loans.use: To procure food items in bulk

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a forty year old married woman. She has given birth to five children, four of whom are boys. All her children are currently in school. Two are in the elementary school and the youngest is in the nursery  school. Faustina lives with her family in Nkawkaw, a town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Nkawkaw is a community which is full of business activity. Faustina’s husband owns a provision store. 

Faustina sells smoked fish in the market square. She buys fresh fish and smokes it herself. She also sells some of the fresh fish to the food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years and has requested a loan to start buying larger quantities of fish in bulk so that she can distribute it to customers in her community.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Mariétou D., 19 ans est célibataire avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Château d’Eau Bignona depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter des bijoux, des chaussures, des sacs et des boubous teintés pour renforcer son commerce d’effets vestimentaires et de bijoux. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariétou D. is 19 years old, single, and is responsible for one child. She has been a member of the "Château d’Eau Bignona" village bank for one and a half years. She wants to buy jewelry, shoes, bags and dyed cloth in order to bolster her clothing and jewelry business. This loan will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, shoes, bags, and cloth for resale.

loans.name: Zaina W.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Zaina N. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 15. Zaina has been running a fishmongering business since 1985. She buys fish from fishermen at the lake and sell them in town. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. She currently earns about 60 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase more fish in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Zaina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in bulk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with two children, both girls. Both of her children are currently in junior high school. Alice says her husband is a farmer. He cultivates crops such as oranges and palm nuts in the community in which they live. She is an entrepreneur. She sells provisions such as milk, sugar, bread, and vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

Alice sells on a tabletop in front of her house. She has been in business for over fifteen years. Alice says she buys her goods from Kumasi and at times, from the wholesalers in her community. It is her dream to expand her business by acquiring a store to sell out of. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk from the big cities where the cost is economical.

loans.use: To buy provisions and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. is fifty-three years old. He is married and has six children – three boys and three girls. Some of his children are currently in senior high school. Some have completed their schooling whilst others are in junior high school. Alfred lives with his wife and family in a business town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commerce.

Alfred is a farmer cum palm oil producer. He cultivates cocoa and palm nuts. He says he produces palm oil using the palm fruits from his farm and also buys from other farmers. He buys the greater part of the palm nuts from the local farmers and adds to that the little he harvests from his farm.

According to Alfred, customers come from the cities to buy the palm oil by the gallon and retail to consumers. He has been in business for ten years. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the fruit of the palm trees. Alfred desires to use the loan to expand his business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida D. es una dama originaria del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida preparada por ella misma destacándose en la preparación del baho que es un platillo que vende en su establecimiento a la intemperie pero en busca de cómo obtener su propio tramo en el mercado.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le permita la compra de la carne para preparar el platillo y venderlo en el mercado donde se desempeña día a día.
texts.en:
Candida D. is a lady originally from the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega and is dedicated to selling prepared food. She is known for preparing 'baho' (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made from a mix of meat, green plantains and yucca cooked in banana leaves) that she sells from her place out in the open, but she is searching for a her own place in the market. Today she is seeking support from Ceprodel to benefit from a loan which will allow her to purchase meat to prepare her dish and sell it in the market where she is everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Francisca Johanna

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el municipio de El Viejo, se encuentra la señora Francisca L. el cual se ha desempeñado en su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son elaboradas por ella misma y a la vez ella misma las vende con el propósito de mantener a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

La señora L. ha acudido a Ceprodel por la razón de que requiere un crédito para la compra de la leña y del maíz y para esto ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the municipality of El Viejo, one can find Ms. Francisca L., who has worked to make and sell tortillas that are made and sold by herself to maintain and support her family with her much-needed support. Ms. L. has approached Ceprodel for the reason that she needs a loan to purchase firewood and corn and for this she has come to Ceprodel to apply for credit and thus succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw goods

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El trabajo de ebanistería requiere de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y mucha arte para dar excelentes acabados a los trabajos llevados a cabo con la madera. En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Pedro B. se dedica a esta actividad y para ello hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado en la compra de madera y en la compra de las herramientas de trabajo.
