En esta ocasión, el señor Pedro ha solicitado el crédito con el propósito de comprar la madera y para ello ha hecho uso del apoyo incondicional brindado por Ceprodel el cual espera que su crédito le sea otorgado  y así continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Working as a furniture maker requires great effort, dedication and a lot of art to carry out excellent work made from wood. In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega Mr. Pedro B. is dedicated to this activity and therefore makes use of the credits provided by Ceprodel which have been used for the purchase of wood and working tools. On this occasion, Mr. Pedro has requested the loan for the purpose of buying wood and having made use of the support provided by Ceprodel he expects that this loan for purchasing wood will be granted and that he can continue with his business that requires support.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Jasmina P. se dedica a atender su pulpería el cual ha desarrollado brindando los productos a sus clientes. Hoy en día ella consciente de que necesita desarrollar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para dar lugar a la compra de la los productos para comercializarlos. 

Es importante destacar que con este crédito que se le brinde se beneficia tanto ella como su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo por ser ella el único sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo of the city of Chinandega, Jasmina P. works administering her small grocery store which she has developed by providing products to her clients. Today as she is aware that she needs to develop her business she has applied for a loan in Ceprodel to allow for the purchase of the products to sell them. It is important to highlight that with this loan that you provide, both her and her family will benefit as they greatly need her support as she is the only provider for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan R. esta muy agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito.  El está solicitando su cooperación para este otro préstamo que solicita. 
Ya que se esta dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera para el hogar pero le está haciendo falta mas material para llevar a cabo los pedidos que tiene para entregar. 
Ya que de este negocio depende su familia y dos personas que trabajan para el.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan R. is very thankful for the great support that all of you provided him with his previous loan. He is requesting your cooperation for this other loan for which he is applying. He is already working in wood furniture making for the home but he is lacking more materials to make the orders that he has to deliver. His family and the two people who work for him depend on this business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for furniture construction

loans.name: Silvia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Silvia C. se dedica a atender su pulpería en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chianandega donde la visitan los clientes para realizar sus compras y también es visitada por jóvenes ya que también tiene un pequeño negocio de alquiler de videojuegos.
	
Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Cepordel es para hacer la solicitud de un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para ofrecerlo en su pulpería. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Silvia C. works attending to her small grocery store in the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chianandega where clients visit her to carry out their purchases and it is also visited by young people as she has a small video game rental business. Today the reason why she has approached Cepordel is to apply for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to offer it in her small grocery store. With this loan she will benefit greatly and will advance in her business that so greatly requires her unconditional support.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchadise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Evangelina S. ha sido acreditado de FVP ya pago puntualmente seis créditos alguno de ellos fueron para mejoramiento de sus vivienda y otros de salud. 
Ella necesita una cocineta para poder guardar su despensa ya que es madre soltera y vive sola, porque sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar su cocineta y planea pagarlo con su trabajo como cocinara en un comedor de una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Evangelina S. has been accredited by FVP as she has already re-paid six loans punctually, some of which were for housing improvements and others for healthcare. She needs a kitchenette to be able to keep her supplies as she is a single mother and lives alone because her children already have their own families. She is requesting this loan to buy her kitchenette and plans to pay for it with her work as a cook in a factory cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a kitchenette

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María R. y su esposo el señor Manuel Paz tienen ya mas de nueve años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, Juguetes y Electrónica.
Ellos desean invertir más en mercancía para tener variedad de artículos, ya este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
El negocio le trabajan entre los dos cada uno se pone en distintas puntos de la ciudad y así poder generar más ingreso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María R. and her husband Mr. Manuel Paz have spent more than nine years selling used clothes, toys, and electronics. They want to invest in merchandise so that they will have a variety of products because this business is the source of income for their family. They each work in the business in different parts of the city, and, in this way, they earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria E. es una señora trabajadora que se ha esforzado por tener su negocio propio, vende ropa y zapatos, negocio que inicio con ayudad de su esposo, el trabaja de albañil, la Sra. Maria tiene 50 años de edad, reside en Laureles norte en la ciudad de Managua, con seis hijos que están independiente con su propia familia. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa de dama y caballeros, zapatos con estilos variados, para elevar sus ventas, sus planes son establecer una tienda en su casa, ya que alquila un modulo en el mercado y se le hace muy cansado.
texts.en:
María E. is a woman who has worked hard to have her own business selling clothing and shoes. She began the business with the help of her husband, who works as a mason. María is 50 years old and lives in the North Laureles section of the city of Managua near her six children, all of whom are on their own and have families. The loan for which she has applied will go towards the purchase of inventory, men’s and women’s clothing, and shoes in various styles. In order to increase her sales, María plans to open a shop in her home rather than renting a stall in the marketplace, as that makes her too tired.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's and men's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es: La señora Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora, que además de ser madre soltera siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante y enseñarle a su hijo que en la vida hay que saber trabajar, ella labora en una clínica de la ciudad en el área de lavandería  desde hace 5 años, su hijo trabaja como cobrador de una compañía con una antigüedad de 2 años, ellos como familia están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas de su casa ya que esa se les acaba de entregar y desean tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Nancy is a hard-working person, who, in addition to being a single mother, has worked to go forward and teach her son that in life, one should know how to work. She has worked in a clinic in the city near a laundromat for 5 years. Her son has worked as a conductor in a company for two years. As a family, they are requesting this loan to put protections on the doors and windows of their house since they have just moved and want to have more protection.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put protections on the doors and windows

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana Francisca reside en el barrio Laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 43 años de edad,  casada, con tres hijos, dos mayores que están independiente y uno de 10 años que esta en el colegio,  su esposo se desempeña como mecánico en una empresa privada INSS, su negocio es la elaboración de manteles, adornos, vestidos y los pedidos y estilo que le deseen los clientes es tejidos manual tiene diez años en este trabajo pues casi todo los trabajo son vendido en el extranjero lo único como dilatan día para estar en las manos de los clientes, así su dinero tarda un poco, aprendió a tejer desde muy chica y ahora es su subsistencia, esta es la quinta solicitud de préstamo que hace en Afodenic y con esta desea comprar lana, tela para elaborar las manualidades ya que el volumen de pedido es mucho y abecé se le dificulta. Sus planes a futuro es crear contactos directos en el extranjero para enviar la mercadería, a si como terminar de hacer mejoras a su vivienda y educar a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca lives in the South Laureles section of the city of Managua. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. Two of the children are grown and on their own, while one is 10 years old and still in school. Her husband works as a mechanic for a private company named INSS. Juana makes tablecloths, decorations, and clothing. Her customers prefer to order handmade knitted items, and she has been in this business for ten years. Almost everything she makes is sold abroad, and since there is a delay before items reach the hands of the customers, her payment is delayed a bit. She learned to knit when she was very young and now it is her livelihood. This is Juana’s fifth loan from AFODENIC and she hopes to buy yarn and fabric for constructing her handicrafts as she has too many orders for the materials on hand. In the future, Juana plans to establish direct contacts abroad to which to send merchandise, to complete some home improvements and to educate her youngest child.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn, fabric and tools for making her products

loans.name: Alhadi Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Alhadi Primary School in Makeni. It was founded in 1996 by a Lebanese called Rashik. It was primarily established for the propagation of the Shiite Islamic faith. Today, it has a total of 722 pupils, with a staff of 18 teachers.

Alhadi is proud that their pupils are able to make good grades on the National Primary School Exams (NPSE). In sports also, (i.e., for both athletics and soccer), Alhadi is proud that they always emerge victorious among all Islamic schools in Makeni town.

Over the years the school has grown so much that it now lacks adequate furniture and teaching materials. There are not enough benches and desks for the pupils, so they have to squeeze together. In addition to this, teaching materials like textbooks and chalk are also a constrain for this school.

This will be the first loan for teachers of the Alhadi Primary School from SMT (through Kiva). This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, and especially so for people in the teaching profession, they can not use such salaries to buy much or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use their share to begin or continue building a house, others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use their share to invest in business in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

Fatu M. K. (left) is the head teacher of this school. She was born in Lunsar, Port Loko district, northern Sierra Leone. She is age fifty-five and a widow of four children. All of her children are now grown-ups and are professionals. She has been head teacher of this school for five years now. Fatu will use her Le 1,000,000 loan to invest in business. She will make "gara lappers" (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fancy designs) to sell in Freetown. Fatu said she wants to get started in business so that once she retires, she will have something to do.

loans.use: Invest in her start-up business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar se dedica al igual que su esposa la señora Flor a la venta de barbacoa y de chicharrones desde hace 8 años, lo cual atribuye la gran clientela y contratación de otros dos trabajadores ya que la venden por toda la ciudad en sus respectivos carros para asi lograr venderla por todas las colonias.
El anteriormente había solicitado un crédito para la educación de sus hijos, crédito que fue pagado siempre con puntualidad, y ahora esta solicitando este para la colocación de una losa de concreto de un cuarto para ampliarse en su hogar y darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar, together with his wife Flor, has sold barbeque and crackling for the past eight years. They have many customers and have hired two helpers as they now sell throughout the city from their respective cars. He had a previous loan for his children's education which was always repaid on time and he is now asking for a loan to pour a concrete slab for a new bedroom to add to his home and make it more comfortable for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a concrete slab poured for his home.

loans.name: Bemilda  Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Bemilda a sus 60 años de edad, vende en un kiosco ubicado en el mercado Roberto Huembes que es transitado por muchos nicaragüenses ya que venden de todo, al gusto del cliente, barato, bonitos y muchos mas, en este negocio tiene dieciséis años de estar en las ventas, reside en Waspan norte, felizmente casada con cuatro hijos mayores, su esposo es jubilado y recibe una pensión mensual, inicio con dinero que su esposo le dio, con esta solicitud es la segunda en Afodenic la cual va invertir en comprar inventario para el kiosco como: carnes, verduras y frutas para preparar los ricos platillo, gaseosas, dulces, y otros para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder ampliarlo para ofrecer mejores condiciones y servicios a sus clientes, y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Bemilda is 60 years old and sells in a kiosk located in the Roberto Huembes market which is frequented by many Nicaraguans because everything a customer could want is sold there, inexpensive items, pretty items, and much more. She has had the business for 16 years. She lives in north Waspan, is happily married with 4 grown children, her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension. She began with the money that her husband gave her, and this, her second loan from AFODENIC, will be invested in buy inventory for her kiosk such as: meats, vegetables and fruits to prepare her delicious meals, soda pop, candy and other items to offer her customers variety. Her short term plans are to expand to offer better conditions and service to her customers and obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, fruit, soda pop and other items to stock her business

loans.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es: La señora Laura es madre soltera,  ella a su familia le esta enseñando que cuando se quiere salir adelante solo con esfuerzo y constancia se puede lograr, ella tiene una tiendita de abarrotes la cual tiene mucho flujo de clientes y por lo mismo esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión de mas mercancía para su negocio asi seguir obteniendo mas clientes, ganancias y un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is a single mother. She is teaching her children that only hard work and perseverance will get them ahead in life. She has a small grocery store and many clients and because of this she is asking for this loan to invest in more goods for her store, to continue to attract more customers, make greater profits and give her family a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: B.d.e.c Home Ecomonics Group

texts.en:
These ladies are staff members of the B.D.E.C. Home Economics Primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. B.D.E.C Home Economics Primary school was founded by Mrs. Rodger K. S. to assist the children of Makeni and its environs, teaching "the art of managing the home and thyself". The school is staffed with twelve teachers, all of whom are female.

They teach pupils who are already in classes five and six from all schools in Makeni and beyond. Each school in town will bring their pupils to B.D.E.C Home Economics on a fixed day of the week for lessons. Among the subjects they teach are: home management; child care; Family and Life Education (F.L.E.); agriculture; clothing and textiles; food and nutrition, and so on.

The school is proud that pupils writing the subjects they teach always come with good grades on the National Primary School Exams (N.P.S.E). Since the school caters for pupils from all primary schools in Makeni and beyond, space has become their great challenge – they only have one building of about six classrooms. To add to their problems, the only toilet they had has been stolen. They are now looking to the government to buy them another, a process that might take donkey’s years.

This is the first loan B.D.EC Home Economics is borrowing from SMT (through Kiva). With this loan, they will be able to do something meaningful. Gradually, they will repay it out of their meager monthly salaries. Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone, and with such small salaries, they could not do or buy anything big. With a loan, some of them can buy pieces of furniture; some will pay either their children’s school fees or pay for themselves to pursue further studies; others will use their share of the loan to either start building a house or to complete the building process; and others will use theirs in business to supplement their monthly salaries.

Alen F. (middle) is the head teacher of this school. Alen was born in Kamakwe, which is about fifty-five miles from Makeni. She is forty-eight years of age, married with three children. Alen will use her share of the loan to pay her children’s school fees. Once this is done, it will be a great relief to her she told me, for she will not have to scratch her head again over where to get the funds to pay for them.

loans.use: Pay children's school fees and other expenses

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
La señora Estefana tiene una tiendita de abarrotes, ella vive en compañía de su mama ya que esta divorciada, pero aun y sin el apoyo de una pareja ella ha demostrado que con esfuerzo, constancia y dedicación se puede salir adelante.
Esta solicitando este crédito para el pago de unos proveedores y asi seguir surtiendo su negocio y obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Estefana has a small grocery store. She lives with her mother as she is divorced. She has shown that with effort, perseverance and dedication you can succeed, even without the support of a partner. She is asking for this loan to pay some of her suppliers and thus continue to run her business and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay suppliers.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married and has two children. She is a very kind and hard working person. She sells electronic home equipment like tea castles, coffee makers, irons, and so on. She has invested 15,000 UAH in her goods; her profit is 2,000 UAH per month.

Vera has been in this business for four years. She rented a kiosk at the central market in hopes of selling even more electronic home equipment. Her good location at the market, and Vera's good character has helped her to attract many clients and increase her sales.

Vera would like a loan of 3,000 UAH for two months. She needs to increase the assortment of her inventory, so she can provide better choices to her clients. Additional income will help Vera to take better care of her family.

loans.use: Increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Leonor R. le esta haciendo falta un cuarto para acondicionarlo para  baño, ella quiere que este junto a su casa ya que el actual esta retirado de la vivienda y, es muy complicado para ella y su familia en la temporada de invierno y de lluvias, ya que tiene un niño pequeño y no quiere que se le enferme.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra y llevar acabo lo más pronto posible la mejor que desean.
texts.en:
At Señora Leonor R.’s house, they are in need of a room which they can turn into a bathroom. She would like this room to be next to her house as the current bathroom is away from the house and it’s very complicated for her and her family in the Winter and rainy season as she has a small boy and doesn’t want him to get ill.

She is asking for a loan to purchase the construction material and labor to build this bathroom as soon and as well as possible.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buildin a bathroom next to her house

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Sra.: Maria es una mujer luchadora y con mucha deseo de superación, con 39 años de edad, con dos hijos de 2 y 16 años de edad, casada con un buen esposo que la apoya, el es músico. Doña Maria vende cosméticos, ropa y prendas desde hace trece años, con dinero que presto en Afodenic, el cual le brindo la oportunidad que ha sido de gran beneficio para su familia. Sus planes es seguir mejorando su casa, con esta solicitud es la quinta y va invertir en ropa, joyas ya que tiene muchos encargos vende al crédito de quince y treinta de cada mes, y al contado, para ofertar a su clientela la variedad de sus productos,  sus metas es tener una tienda de ropa en su casa bien surtida, que espera lograr con mucha dedicación. También poder dar la educación debida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is 39 years old and has two children, 2 and 16 years of age. She is married to a good husband who supports her. He is a musician. Doña María has sold cosmetics and clothing since she was 13 years old. Money borrowed from Afodenic has given her an opportunity that has greatly benefited her family. Her plan is to continue improvements on her house. This is her fifth loan request and she will invest it in clothing and jewelry, since she has received a lot of orders. She offers 15- and 30-day credits to her customers, and well as accepting cash, to give her clientele access to her selection of merchandise. Her goal is to have a well-stocked clothing shop in her house, which she hopes to achieve through a lot of hard work. She also wants to be able to give her children the education they need.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Milagros De Jesus

texts.es: Milagros es una joven de 28 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación de Howar  cuatro cuadras al norte, en la ciudad de Managua, se dedica ala venta de cosméticos y costura que desde muy joven a prendió a coser, tiene ocho años de experiencia, comenzó con ayuda que su mama le brindo para que fuera teniendo mas oportunidad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, lo cual desea ir construyendo un futuro para cuando tenga su familia, sus planes son seguir estudiando para formarse como profesional, y ganar un salario fijo, con la solicitud de préstamo va invertir en cosméticos y telas para trabajar en la costura ya que hace a sus clientes los estilos que ellos deseen, así como también hace ropa para vender y aprovechar el tiempo como para obtener ingresos. a futuro es captar clientes, y obtener un inventario de productos mas surtidos.
texts.en:
Milagros is a young woman 28 years old. She lives in Villa Reconcilación in Managua. She sells cosmetics and has been sewing ever since she learned to sew as a young girl. She has eight years of experience. She got started with the help of her mother, who wanted her to have more opportunities. She is single and has no children, and wants to build a future for when she has a family. Her plan is to continue her studies so she can get vocational training and earn a steady income. With this loan request she will invest in cosmetics and fabrics, since she does both custom design for her customers as well as ready-made clothing that she sells to increase her income. Her future goals are to attract more customers and obtain a wider variety of inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics for dressmaking, and cosmetics

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe R. y su esposa tienen tres hijos, a los cuales les quieren darles lo mejor.
Ellos tiene la necesidad de la elaboración de una losa en la parte posterior de la vivienda y así sus pequeños tengan un espacio techado donde puedan jugar, sus planes es después que tengan ya la losa poner unas divisiones para un cuarto que sea para sus hijos.
Don Felipe R.  es empleado de una compañía de electricidad y su ingreso no le  permite realizar una inversión tan fuerte, por lo cual pide apoyo para completar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Felipe R. and his wife have three children to whom they want to give the very best. They need to poor a concrete slab to complete the back part of their house. That way their children will have a covered space where they can play since they plan to divide up the new area into sections with a room for the children. Felipe is an employee of an electricity company and his income does not allow him to make such an expensive investment. Therefore, he is asking for support in order to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To poor a concrete slab for the back part of the house

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Yamileth tiene 39 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa reconciliación de la kativo  tres cuadras al sur, casada y con tres hijos de 8,13 y 15 años de edad, los tres estudian en el colegio del barrio, su esposo se desempeña como mecánico, la Sra.: Yamileth tiene una comideria  hace dieciocho años, que ha sido un negocio familiar de su mama el cual todavía trabajan juntas, con esta solicitud de préstamo que esta haciendo en Afodenic la quiere para invertir en materia prima para elaborar los ricos platillos variados para sus clientes, en si desea incrementar las ventas, lo cual espera que sea de mucho beneficios en el negocio. A futuro espera mejorar la infraestructura del local del comedor para seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Doña Yamileth is 39 years old. She lives in a suburb of Managua, the capital, called Villa Reconciliación. She is married and has three children, 8, 13, and 15 years of age. All three study in the local school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Yamileth has run a restaurant for 18 years. It was her mother's business, and the two of them still work there together. She is requesting this loan from Afodenic in order to purchase foodstuffs to prepare a delicious assortment of dishes for her customers. She wishes to increase her sales, which she hopes will greatly benefit her business. In the future she hopes to improve the infrastructure of the dining space in order to continue offering good service.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meats, produce, drinks, and other products to prepare delicious dishes

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Alicia E. solicita ayuda para cubrir gastos médicos. En el año de 2007 a Bertha se le detecto cáncer en un seno; el cual fue prevenido a tiempo y se lo tuvieron que quitar. Ella se encuentra bien de salud  pero siguen realizando estudios para asegurarse que el cáncer se haya ido por completo. Ella cuenta con seguro por parte de su esposo pero el préstamo es para cubrir gastos como hospedaje alimentación y otros. Solicita la cantidad de $8,000 pesos
La señora E. obtiene ingresos de este negocio que se observa en la foto y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de servicio.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Alicia E. is requesting aid in order to cover her medical expenses. In 2007, Bertha was diagnosed with breast cancer, which was treated just in time; the tumor was removed. She is currently in good health, but the doctors are still running tests on her to make sure that the cancer is completely gone. She has health insurance through her husband, but the loan will be used to cover the food and hospital stay costs, among other things. She is requesting $8,000.00 Mexican Pesos. Ms. E. earns a living through this business pictured here. Her husband works in a service company.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hospital stay costs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan P. ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pago puntualmente, ahora solicita su cooperación para un nuevo préstamo, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar su mejora. Le esta haciendo falta a su vivienda los acabados del exterior y así tenerla ya terminada. 
El planea pagar este crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como empleado de una empresa  de trasportes.
En la foto aparece su esposa la señora Elsa Atzin Garcia ya que Don Juan P. en ese momento se encontraba en su empleo.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan P. has previously obtained a loan from FVP, a loan which he paid punctually. He now requests your cooperation for another loan because at the moment, he does not have the funds necessary for home improvement. His house needs some work on the exterior for the repairs to be complete.

He plans on repaying this loan with income from his job at a transport company.

Because Mr. Juan P. was at work, pictured in this photo is his wife, Ms. Elsa Atzin Garcia.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home exterior work

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Mercedes is 35 years old and is the single mother of three children. Mercedes sells wholesale eggs, which she distributes to different businesses. A few weeks ago, Mercedes opened a restaurant in her house, where she serves lunch to the workers of a nearby institution. Mercedes needs a loan of 750 soles to buy rice, sugar and oil. Mercedes dreams that her children will finish school and graduate with professional degrees.

loans.use: Mercedes would like to buy rice, sugar and oil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Doris Esther

texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. She is a 39-year-old single mother and has two children. Doris sells sweets from a mobile cart in the central park of the city of Ayacucho. She works every afternoon, and in the mornings she takes care of her son, who has had health problems since he was born. Doris wants to open a juice stand. She needs a loan of 300 soles to open the juice stand. Doris dreams of improving her business so that her children will graduate with professional degrees and so she can enjoy a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Trébol. Doris es madre soltera, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Doris se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes y por las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de su hija que tiene problemas de salud desde su nacimiento. Doris tiene proyectado implementar una juguería. Doris necesita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido en el negocio de juguería. Doris sueña con mejorar su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida, sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Doris would like to open a juice stand.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: La Sra.: Luz, trabaja en una casa particular dando sus servicios de domestica desde hace dos año, es un trabajo muy agotado y no es tan buen salario pero sastiface las necesidades de su familia, tiene 46 años de edad, y resida en Villa reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, antes vendía por cuenta propia carnes de cerdo ambulante, pero había día que no vendía lo que debía y quebró su negocio, su esposo trabaja de conductor de camión, lo cual no da con los gastos por eso trabajamos los dos, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la cuarta en Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios ya que con cada préstamo han ido terminando y mejorando su casa, esta solicitud va a comprar un inodoro y todo los artefacto de su instalación para estar mas higiénica y poder gozar de un baño digno con su familia.  sus planes a futuro es comenzar su negocio por su propia cuenta, y así poder ayudar a sus hijos que tengan una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Luz has worked as a domestic in a private home for the past two years. It's extremely exhausting work and the pay is not great, but it meets her family's needs. She is 46-years-old and lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. In the past she had worked for herself as a street vendor selling pork products, but in the end she could not sell as much as she needed to so she closed the business. He husband is a truck driver, which does not pay enough to cover their expenses, so they both have to work. This is the fourth loan they are seeking from AFODENIC. The loans, which they've been using to finish their house and do home improvements, have been very beneficial to them. They plan to use this loan to buy a toilet and the materials to install it, so the family can have a decent bathroom and enjoy better hygiene. Their future plans include starting their own business, and having the means to help their children obtain a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a toilet and the matierials to install it.

loans.name: J Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor J Guadalupe V. M. es una persona ya grande de edad el cual recibe pensión del IMSS. Guadalupe a pesar de los años que tiene casado el se preocupa por el bienestar de su esposa y se ve a la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar aire secos con calefacción; comenta que la casa donde viven en tiempo de verano es muy caliente y en invierno muy fría. La cantidad que el solicita es de $10,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Mr. J Guadalupe V. M. is an elderly man who receives a pension from IMSS—the Mexican Social Security Institute. Despite all the years he has been married, Guadalupe still worries about his wife’s well-being, so he feels the need to request a loan in order to purchase a heater and an air conditioner. He states that the house in which he lives gets very hot in the summer and very cold in the winter. He is requesting $10,000.00 Mexican Pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Heating and air conditioning

loans.name: Ramiro Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Juan is 39 years old and lives with his partner and their two children. Juan buys used oil from oil-change shops, then brings it to Lima to resell to foundries. Juan also owns a truck, which he uses for shipping. Juan plans to start a new business recycling plastics. He needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a machine to grind recycled plastics. Juan dreams of starting another fuel recycling business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Juan es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol. Juan es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Juan se dedica a la compra de aceite quemado que compra en los lugares de cambio de aceite, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Lima en donde lo vende, este combustible lo utilizan en los calderos. Además Juan tiene un camión con el cual realiza transporte de carga. Juan tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de reciclaje de plásticos. Juan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina para moler los plásticos reciclado. Juan sueña con implementar otro negocio de transformación de combustibles.

loans.use: Juan would like to buy a machine to grind plastics to recycle.

loans.name: Sara Araseli

texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Sara is 26 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Sara sells cosmetics, jewelry and cleaning products by catalog on credit. Most of her clients are friends, relatives and neighbors. Sara also studies accounting at a private university. Sara needs a loan of 600 soles to buy perfume and lotion. Sonia dreams of graduating from college with a professional degree, of having her own company, and of supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Sara es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol. Sara es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Sara vende cosméticos, joyas, artículos de aseo por catálogos, de diferentes líneas, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, vecinos y sus ventas son al crédito. Además Sara estudia contabilidad en una universidad privada. Sara necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas. Sara sueña con culminar sus estudios profesionales y titularse, tener una empresa y apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Sara would like to buy perfume and lotion to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria  Isabel M. Ramírez es una señora viuda la cual se mantiene de la pensión que le dieron por su esposo y ayuda de su hermana que es soltera. Ella recurre a nosotros al verse en la necesidad de que sus muebles se  están deteriorando con la humedad que provoca la casa. Aunque no llueva se le gotea es por eso que desea impermeabilizar  y pagar mano de obra. El costo de esto es de $10,000 pesos
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Isabel M. Ramírez is a widow who supports herself from her late husband’s death pension and with help from her sister, who is single. She turns to us because her furniture is getting damaged with the moisture in the house. Even if it does not rain, water leaks in the house, which is why she would like to waterproof it and pay for the labor. All of this would cost $10,000 Mexican pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof her home

loans.name: Angy Milagros

texts.en:
Angy is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Angy is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Angy sells a variety of catalog cosmetics (like Avon and Esika) and jewelry. Most of her clients are friends and relatives; her sales are on credit. Angy also studies cosmetology. Angy needs a loan of 600 soles to buy perfume and shampoo. Angy dreams of finishing her studies, opening her own beauty salon and of studying another profession.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Angy es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol. Angy es soltera y tiene 19 años, vive aun con sus padres, Angy vende cosméticos y joyas por catálogos, de líneas diferentes como Avon, Esika, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y al crédito. Angy estudia cosmetología. Angy necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, champús. Los sueños de Angy son terminar sus estudios, implementar un salón de belleza y estudiar otra carrera.

loans.use: Angy would like to buy perfume and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 23 años, vive con su madre y hermanos en la casa de su madre. Estudió cosmetología y  tuvo la idea de abrir su propio salón de belleza asociada con una amiga. Trabaja  diariamente en horario corrido, ofrece servicios de cortes de cabellos, peinados, todo tipo de tratamientos faciales, entre otros. Han pasado solo 6 meses desde la inauguración y ya ha visto que poco a poco está creciendo su clientela, Rocío tiene grandes expectativas, quiere aprovechar su juventud para forjarse un bienestar y ayudar en su casa, sobre todo a su mamá. El comienzo fue difícil, pero poco a poco las personas la van conociendo y reconociendo su trabajo. Es la tercera vez que Rocío solicita un préstamo con MFP, además está muy contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal porque le gusto mucho el tema de la garantía solidaria, donde todos se apoyan y avalan mutuamente. Invertirá este dinero en  la compra de implementos para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Rocío is 23 years old and lives with her mother and siblings in her mother’s home. She studied cosmetology, and she got the idea of opening up her own beauty salon with her friend as an associate. She works non-stop everyday, offering services such as haircuts, styles and all types of facial treatments, among other things. Only 6 months have passed since her salon’s grand opening, and she has already seen her clientele grow little by little. Rocío has great expectations and would like to take advantage of her youth in order to shape her well-being and help her household, especially her mother. She had a difficult start, but people are slowly beginning to know about her and acknowledge her work. This is the third time that Rocío requests a loan from MFP. Furthermore, she is very happy to work with her microfinance institute because she really likes the surety bond, in which all members mutually support and vouch for each other. She will invest this money in purchasing supplies for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a su bodega, notó que este negocio era una buena oportunidad porque cerca de su casa está el paradero de una empresa de transportes, entonces, los conductores siempre buscan alimentos para consumir durante el día, así fue como Adelaida y su esposo decidieron juntar de sus ahorros y abrir una tienda, la cual empezó  con poca mercadería, pero que con el paso del tiempo se ha venido acrecentando, es por ello que Adelaida  tienes planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que contribuye a la educación de sus hijos, que son lo más importante para ella. Por el momento su dificultad radica en que están reparando la pista donde se ubica su casa y momentáneamente el paradero de los transportistas ha cambiado, pero pronto cuando la pista esté terminada, volverán a su anterior ubicación. Es la primera vez que Adelaida solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal  porque vieron en ella sus deseos de superación y la responsabilidad con que maneja sus cuentas. Con este dinero invertirá en la compra de más productos para su tienda, adquirirá yogurt y otras bebidas, por paquete al por mayor, valorizado en 50 soles cada uno, también comprará sacos de menestra, de arroz y de azúcar, y otros productos adicionales.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children. Her general store has been in business for three years. She noticed that this business was a good opportunity for her because there is a bus stop for a transportation company near her house, and the drivers are always looking for food to eat throughout the day. Thus, Adelaida and her husband decided to put their savings together and open a general store. It started out with only a few goods, but as time went by, it has grown. Adelaida would like to keep expanding her business because it contributes to the education of her children—the most important people in her life. The problem she is currently facing is that the road on which both her house and the bus stop is located is being repaired, but when the road work is finished, the drivers will once again come through there. This is the first time that Adelaida requests a loan from MFP. She was invited to join her microfinance institute because her desire for self-improvement and her responsibility in managing her finances are evident. She will invest this loan in purchasing more goods for her general store. She will purchase yogurt and other drinks in wholesale bulk, which cost 50.00 PEN each, as well as sacks of legumes, rice and sugar, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase goods

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. Asunta is 50 years old and has six children. She sells firewood from her home, which is located in the Asociación Las Americas neighborhood of Ayacucho. She has the wood delivered to her home by the producers. Asunta and her husband also run an auto body repair shop. Asunta needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy firewood and paint. She dreams of improving her business and of buying a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Asunta es viuda, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Asunta vende leña en su casa que se ubica en la Asoc. Las Américas, la leña le traen los productores a su casa. Además Asunta y su esposo tienen un taller de planchado y pintura. Asunta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y pintura. Asunta sueña con mejorar su negocio y comprar un terreno.

loans.use: Asunta would like to buy firewood and paint to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is 46 years old, separated, and has four children. Nelly has a workshop in which she makes different kinds of fireworks (like “castles” and “bombardments”) by special order. Two of her children help her make the fireworks. Nelly also has a small store in her home, where she sells dry goods. Nelly needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles to buy rice, sugar and milk. Nelly dreams of improving her businesses and of buying a car.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: Benigna tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y el menor D. sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 3 años tiene una tienda, la cual tuvo que abrir por la necesidad D. generarse ingresos propios para ayudar a sostener la economía D. su hogar, decisión por la que está muy satisfecha, ya que comenzó con poca mercadería y la ido aumentando poco a poco, también desea aumentar su capital vendiendo comida, dando pensión a algunos clientes que tiene. Su gran anhelo es incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio, Benigna trabaja para distraerse y colaborar con los gastos, generalmente atienD. su bodega por las tardes. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal a la que actualmente pertenece porque vieron en ella cualidades óptimas para un trabajo en equipo. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería como gaseosas al por mayor con un costo D. 200 soles, 500 soles comprará abarrotes no perecibles, y el resto será su capital para la preparación D. sus platos D. comida para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Benigna is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and their youngest child in their own home. For the past 3 years she's had a shop, which she had to open due to the need to generate her own income to help support her household economy. She is very satisfied with the decision, as she began with little merchandise and has steadily increased. She also wants to increase her capital by selling food. Her great ambition is to increase the stock of her business. Benigna works to keep herself occupied and assist with household costs, and usually works at her shop in the afternoon. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP, and was invited to be part of a community bank that she currently belongs to because the bank saw great team member qualities in her. Benigna will purchase merchandise with the money that she requests, such as soft drinks at the wholesale price of 200 soles. 500 soles will be spent on non-perishable groceries, and the rest will be used as capital for the preparation of meals for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
Maria Sonia Patricia L. C. desea instalar drenaje en su casa el cual no ha podido poner por que es muy caro el material como la mano de obra. Nos cuenta que en una ocasión tubo dinero el cual solo le alcanzo para comprar el material y con el tiempo al tenerlo al intemperie se le deterioro. Ahora ella no quiere que le vuelva a suceder y pide un préstamo de $3,000 pesos.
El esposo recibe pensión y su hija le ayuda también con lo gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maria Sonia Patricia L. C. would like to install a drainage system in her house. She has been unable to install one because the materials and labor are very costly. She says that at one point she did just manage to save enough money to purchase the materials, but they got damaged by exposure to the elements. She does not want this to happen again. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 pesos. Her husband receives a pension, and her daughter also helps with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pipes and pay for labor.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Benigna

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is 47 years old and married with three children. Maria has a store in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells replacement car parts, which she buys in the city of Ayacucho and in Lima. She and her husband also have a mechanic’s shop. Maria needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy brake shoes and pads. Maria’s dream is to offer a wider variety of products at her store, and to buy a car and a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en la selva ayacuchana, en donde vende repuestos de carros, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Lima. Además Maria junto a su esposo tienen un taller de mecánica. Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatas, pastillas. Los sueños de Maria son surtir su tienda, comprar un carro y un terreno.

loans.use: Buy brake shoes and pads for her mechanic's shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. Rosa is 45 years old and married with four children. Rosa has a fruit juice stand at the Miraflores market, where she works with her son. Rosa also has another market stand, where she sells potatoes that she buys from local farmers. Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy potatoes in bulk. Rosa dreams of improving her business and that her children will continue to study so that they can grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Rosa es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado de Miraflores en donde prepara jugo de frutas, con la ayuda de su hijo. Además Rosa tiene otro puesto en donde vende papa, que adquiere de los productores. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa por mayor. Rosa sueña con mejorar sus negocio y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk for her market stand

loans.name: Dula Nohemy

texts.en:
Dula is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. Dula is 50 years old and married with four children. Dula sells a variety of costumes from different regions of Peru, some of which she sews herself. Her store is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho. Dula needs a loan of 1250 Peruvian soles to buy different fabrics. Dula dreams of building her own house and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Dula es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Dula es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Dula se dedica al alquiler de disfraces de diferentes zonas del país, algunos de los cuales ella misma confeccionó, su local esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Dula necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas. Dula sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy fabric to sew regional costumes

loans.name: Delia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delia C. es una dama originaria del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León y se ha dedicado por varios años a su actividad de pulpería la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Hoy en día ella ha salido adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha facilitado créditos los cuales ella los ha utilizado en la compra de la mercadería para su pulpería. Es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su amada familia que tiene el deber de mantener.
texts.en:
Delia C. is originally from the Nagarote municipality in the city of León. For several years, she has dedicated herself to her general store which is located in her home. There, she tends to her loyal customer base every day starting from very early in the morning. These days, she is getting ahead thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel which has facilitated credit that she’s used to purchase merchandise for her store. It’s important to highlight that these loans have benefited both her and her beloved family which she must support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is a 34-year-old single mother of one child. Ana is a sales executive for the Esika cosmetics line. She is in charge of sales for a specific area and supervises 60 salespeople; she earns a fixed monthly income. Ana also owns a motorcycle taxi, which she rents out to a driver. Ana needs a loan of 1500 soles for motorcycle maintenance. Ana dreams of finishing construction on her home, of having her own investment capital, and of continuing to work. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Ana es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijos y 34 años, Ana es ejecutiva de ventas de cosméticos de la línea Esika, Ana es encargada de las ventas de una zona en el cual tiene 60 vendedoras a su cargo, por lo cual recibe un sueldo. Además Ana tiene una mototaxi que alquila. Ana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. Ana sueña con terminar de construir su casa, tener capital propio y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Norma Angelica

texts.es: Norma Angélica O. le entregaron su casa el cual no la habitado por que quiere ponerle protecciones. Ella tiene un hijo el cual no quiere que este inseguro en la nueva casa y teme que le pueda pasar algo. El momento que salga a trabajar ella y su esposo. Solicita la cantidad de $3,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Norma Angélica O. was given her home, which she has not lived in because she wants to add some security to it. She has one son, who she doesn’t want to feel insecure in the new home and she fears that something could happen to him when she and her husband go to work. She requests an amount of 3,000.00 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add security to her home.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Francisca is 60 years old and is widowed with eight children. Francisca and her children farm potatoes on rented land. She also buys potatoes from other local growers and sells them in the Abastos Market, in the city of Ayacucho. In addition to selling potatoes, Francisca owns two cars, which she uses as taxis around Ayacucho. Francisca needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy potatoes. Francisca dreams of having her own investment capital and of helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. Francisca es viuda, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, Francisca se dedica a la agricultura D. papa en terrenos alquilados, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Además compra papa D. los productores, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, cuenta con 2 carros con los cuales transporta a la ciudad. Francisca necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa. Los sueños D. Francisca es tener capital propio y ayudar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Olga Amelia

texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Olga is 40 years old and separated with four children. Olga grows potatoes on rented land, and also buys potatoes from other local growers and resells them. Olga has a stand in the Señor de Arequipa market where she sells potatoes, both by the kilo and in bulk, to wholesale distributors. Olga needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy potatoes. Olga dreams that her children will grow up to be working professionals, of having her own working capital, and of feeding her children a nutritious diet.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. Olga es separada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Olga se dedica a la agricultura de papa en terrenos alquilados, también compra y vende el mismo producto, Olga tiene un puesto en el mercado Señor de Arequipa en donde vende la papa y también vende por mayor a los mayoristas de papa. Olga necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Olga sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener capital propio y brindar buena alimentación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Aurea is 43 years old and married with three children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs every day during potato harvesting season to buy potatoes and grains. She also gives farmers money during planting season so that they can buy fertilizers, then visits the same farmers during the harvest to collect potatoes. She and her husband own a car, which he uses to transport the potatoes. Aurea needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes. She dreams that her children will become working professionals, to have good health, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. Aurea es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Aurea viaja a las ferias de la región todos los días por época de cosecha en donde compra papa, cereales, también en época de siembra da dinero adelantado a los agricultores para la compra de abonos y luego en época de cosecha va a recoger los productos, para el traslado de los productos tiene un carro que es conducido por su esposo. Aurea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Los sueños de Aurea son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener buena salud y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Suni ("Strength" in Quechua) Village Bank.  Teresa is 53 years old and is a single mother of nine children. 

Teresa has a stand in the Señor de Arequipa Market where she sells fruits and vegetables seven days a week. Teresa and her daughter also plan to start a new business selling lumber. Teresa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy lumber and fruit. Teresa hopes to improve her house and dreams that her children to have stable jobs.  

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 
Teresa es madre soltera, tiene 53 años y 9 hijos, Teresa tiene un puesto en el mercado Señor de Arequipa en donde vende frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Teresa tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de maderas junto a su hija. 
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera y frutas. 
Los sueños de Teresa son mejorar su casa, que sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable.

loans.use: Buy lumber and fruit

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Desde muy jovencita, en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora Erlinda C. se ha dedicado a su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son elaboradas por ella misma en su casa de habitación donde las comercializa. 

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de continuar con la elaboracion de las tortillas pero por sus escasos recursos ha tenido dificultades por lo que muy sabiamente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para continuar elaborando las mejores tortillas del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
In the Nagarote Municipality in the city of León, Señora Erlinda C. has been making homemade tortillas since she was very young. She makes, cooks, and sells the tortillas from her own home.

Señora Erlinda needs to continue making her tortillas, but has had difficulties due to her lack of economic resources. So she wisely came to Ceprodel and requested a loan so that she can continue to buy the ingredients she needs to make the best tortillas in all of Nagarote Municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Antonia is 49 years old and married with two children. Antonia has a store in her home where she sells general dry goods and beer in bulk. She also distributes beer to stores in different districts (like Muyurina and Chacco). She works with her husband and one employee.

Antonia needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of building on a plot of land she owns so that she can open a chicken restaurant there, and hopes that her youngest son will finish his studies. 



Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 
Antonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, cerveza al por mayor y también reparte la cerveza a las tiendas D. diferentes distritos como Muyurina, Chacco, actividad que realiza con su esposo y la ayuda D. un personal. 
Antonia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar. 
Los sueños D. Antonia son construir un local en el terreno que tiene para implementar una polleria y que su hijo menor culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Luzmila is 45 years old and married with eight children. Luzmila bakes traditional Peruvian breads like “chapla” in her oven, which is located in the Capillapata neighborhood. 

She sells her bread straight from the oven, as well as in the local market. In the summer, Luzmila also sells fruit juice.  Luzmila needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy flour and sugar. Luzmila’s dreams are to improve her oven and to build her own house. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 
Luzmila es casada, tiene 45 años y 8 hijos, Luzmila elabora panes típicos como la Chapla en su horno ubicado en el barrio D. Capillapata, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo horno y también en el mercado D. su zona. Además Luzmila en época D. verano venD. jugos D. frutas. 
Luzmila necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y azúcar. 
Los sueños D. Luzmila son mejorar su horno y construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy flour and sugar

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco López  Ávila desea levantar la barda para que quede mas protegida por lo que nos comenta que ha habido muchos robos y no quiere perder parte de su patrimonio que con mucho esfuerzo ha obtenido. También quiere poner piso firme en la parte de atrás por que en tiempo de lluvias se hace mucho lodo.
Solicita la cantidad de $6,500 para hacer su proyecto.
texts.en:
Francisco López Ávila wants to put up a higher wall for protection. He tells us that there have been many robberies in the area, and he doesn't want to risk losing part of the wealth he has worked so hard to create. He would also like to install a more solid floor in the rear of his house, since during the rainy season his current floor becomes very muddy. He is requesting a loan of $6,500 Mexican pesos to carry out this project.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a wall and solid flooring

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel D. L. C. S. quiere colocar protecciones y un barandal en su casa el cual quiere tenerL. diferente a las demás como también cuidar del bienestar D. su familia para que no le pueda pasar algo. El solicita L. cantidad D. $4,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Gabriel D. L. C. S. wants to make his house more secure by installing security bars and a balustraD.. This will differentiate it from the other houses in the neighborhood, as well as look after the wellbeing of his family. He is seeking a loan of $4,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To place security bars in his home

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos T. S. pide un préstamo para ampliar su casa y poner barda en el patio de su casa. Comenta que su casa es muy pequeña lo cual  desea que sus hijos  tengan comodidad y la seguridad. El solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos
texts.en:
Marcos T. S. is requesting for a loan to make home improvements and to finish his back yard. He tells us that his house is very small, so he would like to provide his children with a more comfortable, safe house. He is requesting for $7,000 mexican pesos ($525).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make home improvements

loans.name: Patricio De Jesus

texts.es: Patricio de Jesús Sarniento R. quiere ampliar su casa  el cual ya tiene parte de la construcción pero le falta algunos detalles y quiere terminar para poder cambiarse a la nueva habitación. Lo quiere para comprar material y pagar mano de obra el cual solicita $6,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Patricio de Jesús S. R. would like to make home improvements. Part of his house is already built, so he needs to make the final touches to be able to move to his new room. He would like to buy construction material and hire workers to help him. He is requesting for $6,000 Mexican pesos ($450).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es: Maria Alejandrina Martínez quiere un préstamo para impermeabilizar su casa el cual en temporadas de lluvias se gotea y no quiere que sus mubles se deterioren con la humedad. Como se observa en la foto se ven manchas que esta provocando la misma humedad en techo. Ella solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos
texts.en:
Maria Alejandrina Martínez would like to ask for a loan to make his home watertight as there are several leaks during the rainy season and she doesn’t want the furniture to be deteriorated by humidity. As it can be seen in the picture, there are several water stains in the ceiling. She is requesting for $7,000 Mexican pesos ($525).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make home improvements

loans.name: Eutequa

texts.en:
Eutequa M. is already 50 years old. Her husband, a farmer, has been tilling the farm and working very hard to support their family. Their son is now in high school. No matter how hard she tries looking for additional income, she is somehow too old and can no longer be employed for a job. Since then, she heard about CEVI and decided to join their credit program and start her own business.

Eutequa's sari-sari store started last February 28, 2008 with PHP 10,000 in capital. Now, she wants to avail another loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She is not just focusing on her displays, but she is also into the “buy and sell” business. With this loan, she believes that she could increase her income and better support her family.

She is happy to be part of the CEVI credit program. Now, Eutequa still enjoys availing the credit assistance, trainings, as well the insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida T. está muy agradecida por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Ella solicita su cooperación para este otro préstamo, para empezar a construir un cuarto para sus hijas ya que están creciendo y desean tener su propio espacio.
Ellos desean realizar esta mejora pero no cuentan con el capital necesario para llevarla acabo. 
Doña Adelaida T. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada los fines de semana y su esposo el señor Francisco Rodríguez trabaja como chofer de camión, estos son los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida T. is very thankful for all the support she received with her previous loan. She is now once again asking for your support with another loan, to start building a new room for her two daughters that are growing up and need her own space. They would like to make home improvements, but they don’t have enough money to do so. Adelaida T. sells used clothes during the weekends and her husband, Francisco Rodríguez, works as a truck driver. Those are their only home income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in the higher floor

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en: This is a small group loan that consists of three members requesting a loan to Kiva. Mrs. V., 33, is a grocery seller in the Numkreab Village in the Battambang Province. She has been selling since 2004 and can currently earn around $2.50 per day, while her husband is a teacher. She has five children, all of whom are small teenagers. She sells a variety of products such as food ingredients, perfumes, and cakes, etc. Her business is going well because she has good communication, selling skills, and has many regular clients. V. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery inventory. This is the second loan for her; the first one was undertaken individually. The other two members are: Mrs. M., 51, who sells porridge and needs a loan to buy more ingredients and Mrs. S., who is a grocery seller and needs a loan to buy groceries for her expanding business. They all live in the Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio M. es padre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que sea más segura y duradera.
Su desea es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor
texts.en:
Flavio M. is the head of his family. He has three teenage children at are still in school. With the money the obtained from two other loans requested to FVP he was able to Guild a room, but he still need more money to finish the roof. His project is to build a concrete ceiling to make it more safe and durable. His wish is to finish this room for his children to they can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a concrete ceiling

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia C., a 60-year-old mother, has nine children. Despite her age, she is still working for the food that she eats. Almost all of her children are married and have separate lives already, but she still wants to help them raise their children. So, when she heard about CEVI, she immediately joined the credit program and started a business. As a member, she maintained good repayment records on her loans and availed higher loans in succeeding cycles.

Virgilia engages in retail business. She sells gasoline and crude oil in her town. Since her business is situated along the highway of Lun Masla, Malapatan, Sarangani Province, Virgilia has had a very good market of her product. She just started with PHP 40,000 in capital for her business and earned a lot of profit from it which she used to renovate her house.

Now, she wants to avail a higher loan this time. Virgilia needs to purchase more stocks of gasoline to cater to all her customers. She believes that by doing so, she will earn higher earnings.

CEVI helps Virgilia sustain her business. Through CEVI, she has access to the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more gasoline to sell

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes P. acaba de quedar viuda su esposo falleció en un accidente.
Tiene la necesidad de la elaboración de una losa de concreta en la parte posterior de la casa, uno de los  motivo es porque  cuando llueve se acumula el agua en el patio. 
Y desea que su hijo este mas seguro cuando ella no se encuentre en la casa, ya que trabaja casi todo el día en una empresa de trasportes  en el departamento de contador financiero este es su ingreso para su familia y con el cual desea pagar este préstamo.
texts.en:
María Lourdes P. just became a widow after her husband died in an accident. She needs to build a concrete slab in her back yard, to prevent water to accumulate when it rains. She also wants his son to feel safer when she is not at home, as she works almost all day in a transport company at the financial accounting department. This is her source of income and she intends to repay this loan with the money the makes out of this job.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a slab in the back yard.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon T., 49 years old, has four children. Her husband, a hog raiser, has been very supportive of her in her retail business. The PHP 1,000 she borrowed from a friend helped her get started in her business. The earnings she gained from it are what she uses to pay for the tuition fees for her children and in buying a one-hectare farm lot.

Corazon dreams of providing a better quality life for all of her children. As a mother, she is seeking the best life for them, like enabling them to graduate from college and to be employed in high paying jobs. Because of this, she was inclined to join the CEVI microfinancing program. She availed the loans and used it to improve her business.

Now that her children are studying, Corazon needs to earn more profit from her business. She is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase additional goods in her store. In this way, she will have more sales and profit as well. 

CEVI always seeks ways to uplift the lives of people. Through its microfinancing program, people like Corazon will benefit much in availing the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that they provide to all their clients.

loans.use: For additional capital and to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Bernardino R. le esta haciendo falta el piso y la losa de concreto en la parte posterior de su casa, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir ese gasto ya que su ingreso es bajo y es mas difícil juntar  la cantidad que necesita para llevar acabo su mejora. Ya que para él es muy importante que su familia tenga lo mejor y que estén más cómodos en su casa. 
Cuando acudimos a su vivienda solo se encontraba su esposa la señora Magda Edith Tovar ya que Don Bernardino se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Bernardino R.’s home is missing the floor and the concrete slab at the back of the house. At this moment, she does not have enough money to cover the expenses as his income is too low and it is hard to raise the amount of money necessary to make these improvements. It is very important to him that his family has a better life and they could be comfortable at home. When we went to his home, we only met his wife, Magda Edith Tovar as Bernardino was working at that time.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish his home floor and the back wall

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
“I started selling chicken barbeque along the highway of Lun Padidu, Malapatan, a small village in Sarangani Province with only PHP 2,000 from my pocket," says Aileen T., a married 28-year-old in our interview with her during her loan request.

She never minds the labor and how hard she has to prepare all the ingredients just to ensure that she has enough money to save for her future family. Her husband’s income as a motorcycle driver is not enough, so she needs to earn money to suffice their growing needs as a couple. Since they are starting a family, Aileen knows how important it is to have an established source of livelihood. So, she decided to join CEVI and learn something about having a business. 

Aileen needs a loan to purchase more meat ingredients for her barbecue business. In the past, she tried to utilize her own native poultry animals, but now that she has more customers, she has to scout for other suppliers to better accommodate them all. She is also interested in looking for some other possible ways to augment their income.

Since she is a CEVI client, Aileen enjoys availing the credit assistance, trainings, as well as the insurance coverage that it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and food items to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Soledad M. y su esposa el señor Alejandro González le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas, ya que tiene poco tiempo que adquirieron su casa de las económicas. Ellos tienen una hija de edad escolar  por lo cual quieren lo mejor y su seguridad cundo este en su casa.
 El que se encarga de los ingresos de la familia es el señor Alejandro González que trabaja en un centro comercial como encargado del aria de carnicería.
texts.en:
Soledad M. and his husband Alejandro González’s needs door and window locks, as they recently bought their humble home.
