They have a daughter that is still in school, and they want to provide her with a safer home. Alejandro González is the head of the family and the only financial support. He works at a mall, in charge of the woodwork area.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place window and door locks

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie I. is 42 years old, married, and has two sons. She operates her own clinic in Brgy. Lun Padidu, Malapatan, Sarangani Province. Since she is a registered midwife, it has been easy for her to manage the business because it is through this that she is able to practice what she learned from school. She joined the CEVI credit program and availed its services to establish her own clinic.

“I started my clinic at home in the year 2000. At first, I applied as a private midwife to some well-off family in town. Then later on, I attended several trainings to enhance my skills and propel my career. Since then, I was able to save a small amount, which I use to put up my very own clinic. Now I am able to accommodate patients in our village," she said. “ This is my dream actually to be able to help people... to take care all of them and offer quality service to patients," she added.

To sustain her business and continuously serve the people in the community, Lenie is requesting a loan to CEVI of PHP 15,000. She will use the funds in purchasing supplies she needs for her clinic.

By joining in the CEVI credit program, Lenie enjoys the access to the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage offered.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her clinic

loans.name: 11- Đông Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Loan Group 11 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in
Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.
Mrs. Trinh Thi Hue is the lead borrower of the group. She is 59 years old, married, and has three children: a 33 year old son who is a bus driver, a 30 years old daughter who works as a health advocate in the hospital and a 21 years old daughter who is studying business at Hanoi University.  
This is Mrs. Hue's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women("FPW"); one of her friends in Dong Thanh market, where she has a stall, recommended FPW to her.  Prior to discovering FPW, Mrs Hue's cost of borrowing was more than twice that charged by FPW. 
Mrs. Hue will use the proceeds from this loan to buy kitchenware for her stall where she sells pots, pans, scissors, teapots, mops, thermos flasks, rice cookers, washing up liquid, chopsticks, etc. Along with the pension she receives from the government (as a former government employee), she will use the profits from this loan to pay for her 21 years daughter's board and lodging in Hanoi, as well as her university fees.
The loan will be split equally between all six borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:
* Mrs. Trinh Thi Hue is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$93) to buy kitchenware such as pots, pans, scissors, teapots, mops,thermos flasks, rice cookers, washing up liquid and chopsticks for her market stall.
* Mrs. Ngoc is borrowing money to buy clothes for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lien is borrowing money to buy sugar, salt, towels, candies, biscuits, breads, etc. for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lam Thi Hue is borrowing money to buy bowls, dishes and spoons for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Loi is borrowing money to buy blankets, pillows and sedge mats for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lanh is borrowing money to buy bread for resale on the street in the early morning.
texts.en:
Note: original loan description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bowls, dishes, blankets, pillows, clothes...

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
“I will never stop dreaming big for my children. Even if it means I have to double-time my work to earn bigger for my family. I really will do everything to make them able to attain the highest education I never achieved," says Adelfa D. C., a 38-year-old mother of five children from Lower Masagana, Lun Padidu, Malapatan, Sarangani Province. Her husband is a farmer and helps her manage their charcoal business. Since all of their five children are young students, they need to work hard to be able to pay the school fees and other needs.

Their charcoal business started in 2003. With only PHP 10,000 starting capital, Adelfa began managing the business and making it flourish. Her profit is what she uses to feed all of their children. She is so lucky to have so many friends. Her people skills increase her sales as she markets her products. 

She still wants to avail a loan from CEVI. She needs additional capital to buy charcoal and sell them later on. Adelfa also wants to find another line of business. This would be to augment and better contribute to the family income.

As a client, Adelfa is receiving credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To puchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer J. is only 27. However, despite her age, she is already mature and started to worry about how is she going to stretch their family's budget. She has a son, who also has growing needs. At first, she was scared to raise him, but then her mother had been very generous in offering her a small store to manage. 

Now, she is into retailing. Jennifer sells a variety of goods and earns enough money for the family. She also wants to consider venturing into other lines of business. That is why she joined the CEVI credit program, to avail loans and be able to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Jennifer is happy about partaking in the benefits of joining the CEVI microfinancing program. Now, she enjoys availing its services, including the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel G. is a 37-year-old mother of two children. She married so early; that is why she never finished her college education when she was younger. She has two children and happily nurtures all of them to fulfill whatever dreams she failed to achieve. She calls her business “G. Coco Lumber and Charcoal." With her husband’s support, together they are able surpass all the challenges in their family.

Because she is into retail, Marizel developed a character that knows how to sell. She knows her products and clients well, and this helps her achieve her target sales. Now, she is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase additional materials and capital for the business. Marizel desires to increase the size of her store, which she believes in doing so, will reap larger earnings. She is also considering looking into some other possible ways to contribute to the family income.

Like other CEVI clients, Marizel also enjoys the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage as the benefits.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Crisula

texts.en:
“I’m already old, but I never lost hope to achieve my dreams for my family," says Crisula M., a 63-year-old mother of six children from Lun Masla, Malapatan, Sarangani Province. She is a food vendor and proudly displays all the food that she cooks since their place is just a walk away from the school. Everyday she has to cook foods to earn a living for the family. She only completed her education at an elementary grade level; that is why she works so hard to at least send her children to school and achieve the higher education that she never had. 

When Crisula joined CEVI, she had the chance to mingle with other entrepreneurs who wished to change their lives. Since then, she became a member of the microfinancing program and has made a reputation of always paying the loans that she borrowed. 

Because the demands are high, Crisula needs to add more merchandise to sell in her store and food stall. In this way, she will be able to save money to expand her business. She needs an additional loan to purchase more ingredients and food items to sell. She believes that by doing so, she will not only increase her sales, but also the loyalty and appreciation from her customers.

CEVI is helping Crisula sustain her business. She was given the privilege to avail credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage after joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and other food items to sell

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
At a very young age, Jennilyn R. decided to get married. Now at 27, she still doesn’t have a baby like the other wives in their town. However, she still hopes to have a child soon. What she focuses on now is managing her business to support her future family. Jennilyn liked the CEVI microfinancing program and joined their program. She believes that by partaking in the loans CEVI offers to people, she will not just earn a living, but also save money for their future.

Jennilyn needs a loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She is renting a stall in the public market, which is very accessible and open to the people. She has chosen the best market place, a good venue. 

She is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. This is also to purchase the goods she would be selling in the market. Jennilyn believes that this year is a good season for market vendors like herself. Her good marketing style is her edge to sell her wares. 

CEVI constantly provides credit assistance to Jennilyn. Aside from that, she availed the trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: 13- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 13 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Luong is the lead borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are at school: a 10 year old son and a 6 year old daughter.

This is Mrs. Luong's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW").  She will use the proceeds from her loan to buy clothes for her market stall.  

She buys women's clothes in the Vuon Hoa market and sells them in the Dong Thanh market. With this loan, she will be able to buy 10 jackets on which she expects to make a 13% profit. She buys jackets for 160,000 VND (~US $9.15) and sells them for 180,000 VND (~US $10.30).  On a good day when the weather is chilly (as it is now), she can sell 5 jackets a day.

Mrs. Luong will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children's school fees and for general household expenditures. 

The loan will be split equally between 6 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Yen is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$93) to buy material that she will use to make and sell women’s clothes.
* Mrs. Chien will buy many kinds of small fish to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Bien will buy outfits to rent to others for special occasions (Teacher Day, Army Day, etc.)
* Mrs. Nguyet will buy pork to make lean pork paste and grilled chopped meat to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Minh Quyet will buy bowls and dishes to sell in the Dong Thanh market.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Bình 36 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Ban đầu chị Bình vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, nhưng sau một thời gian vừa chăn nuôi vừa học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh gia đình chị Bình đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư cho  chồng đi mua lợn con ở các hộ chăn nuôi về bán cho nhà máy đông lạnh và bán ở chợ. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị  nguồn thu nhập ổn định 4 triệu đồng/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Bình mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán lợn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô Thị Bình is 36 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2000. In the beginning she used her loans to raise pigs. After a while she has learned the trade & gained experience in this domain, she and her family had decided to get a loan to start a new business: buy pigs from other entrepreneurs and resell to companies who make frozen food. They also retail pork at the market. Their business is good, they earn a good income at 4.000.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 15.000.000 VND to continue investing in her family business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Yuthea

texts.en:
Mr. Yuthea M., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-aun M., 27, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of the children attend school.

Yuthea has been a teacher for nine years. In addition to teaching, he has been repairing motorbikes for seven years. His wife has been selling Cambodian cake for one year. She buys her cooking ingredients from the local market and sells the cake in her village. 

Yuthea is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase a pressure washer for his motorbike repair business and to buy spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles for his stock.

loans.use: To buy a pressure washer and spare parts for bicycles and motorbikes

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị L. năm nay 32 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000.  Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định. Hiện tại công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ  chăn nuôi lợn gà và tiền công đi làm thuê của chồng với tổng thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị L. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm con giống, mở rộng chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ngô Thị L. is 32 years old, a TYM fund member since 2000. She lives in Ý Yên district, Nam Định province with her husband and their 2 children. She raises pigs & chickens, her husband works as a laborer. Thair monthly income is 4.500.000 VND. She is requesting a L. of 9.000.000 VND to renovate the pig pen, buy breeding pigs and to expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renovate the pig pen, buy pigs

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanroeun S., 28, and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhoun, 33, who live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of them are in school. Beside of her children she also has one mother living with her.

Chanroeun has been selling grocery items and rice for 18 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She buys rice from Vihea Sor district about thirty kilometers from her home for resale in her village. Her husband has been building a wooden house for three years. He sometimes works at other places far away from his house. Chanroeun is requesting a loan of 1000 to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Chín  năm nay 38  tuổi,  gia đình chị có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà và kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Chín mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Chín is 38 years old. She has three school-aged children. Mrs. Lê has been participating in TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, the family's main source of income is raising pigs, chicken and a general goods store amounting to 4,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, Mrs. Lê hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to purchase more products such as candies, snacks and other such products desired by customers for the upcoming Tết (Lunar New Year) festivities.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Groceries/General Goods Shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuyến  năm nay 33  tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện nay chị Xuyến đang chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa còn chồng chị làm nghề chụp ảnh. Đây cũng là những  công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Xuyến mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Xuyến is 33 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 2002. Today, Xuyến is raising livestock and has a general store. Her husband works as a photographer. These are their main sources of income and provides 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Xuyến hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND to purchase snacks and foods to sell as her customers prepare for the upcoming Tết (Chinese/Lunar New Year) celebrations.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hương  năm nay 36  tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương do thiếu vốn nên chị Hương chỉ  đầu tư vốn để buôn bán rau nhưng sau khi có thêm nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ tình thương chị Hương đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa và nuôi cá. Công việc kinh doanh và chăn nuôi đã đem lại cho gia đình chị Hương nguồn thu nhập ổn 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hương mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ  một phần chị sử dụng để mua cá giống về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Trần Thị Hương is 36 years old, a TYM fund member since 1998. Before joining TYM, she did not have capital to start any business so her income came solely from selling vegetables. With TYM fund, she opened a grocery store and started farming fish. These 2 businesses bring in 2.000.000 VND a month for her. Her husband works as a construction worker with a salary of 2.000.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow 15.000.000 VND to buy breeding fishes and merchandise (candies, cookies ...etc) for her grocery store to get ready for Tet

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Lân  năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004.  Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh chè khô và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị Lân mong muốn được vay 7.000.để phục vụ cho công việc buôn bán chè khô nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Lân is 42 years old. She joined the TYM Fund in 2004. At the moment, the family's main sources of income are selling dry snacks and the husband's construction worker salary. They have an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Mrs. L. hopes to borrow 7,000,000 VND to invest further into their dry snacks business and increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling dry snacks

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S. is a villager in Preak Ta Erk village in the Kandal province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chab Sopheap, is a fisherman. Even though he works hard, they do not earn enough income to support the family. The couple also does not own their own piece of land where they can build a house. Mrs. Sophal S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings so they can purchase land build a house for her family.

Mrs. Sophal S. is 41-years-old and the mother of four children. One child is a fisherman, another is a tailor, and the remaining two children attend the local school. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To add money to a savings account and buy a piece of land to build a house for the family.

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oeun K., 53, is a widow with five children: two sons and three daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, two daughters are silk weavers, one son is studying at University in Phnom Penh, and the youngest son is studying in the local school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-oeun has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. She wants to continue her weaving business and hopes that her children will have full-time employment after they finished their study. 

Sam-oeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to pay school fee for her son who studies in University.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to pay school fee for her son.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C., a 65-year-old, is a mother of six children. She owns a small store and sells a variety of goods to all her neighbors. This is what she does to pay for her family's food and clothing. Her children are taking care of their own businesses thanks to her efforts at teaching them business management. This is what makes her proud, to see all of her children succeed in their business ventures. Her husband is a humble farmer. Everyday he tills the land to ensure good harvests for the family. Coconut, vegetables, and banana are their main crops. Together they manage their small store as well as their farm.

In 1999, she started putting up a PHP 10,000 capital for the mini-store. Her target is to cater to all the basic needs of the people in their village. Now, that she has already well-established her store, she wants more capital to be able to buy additional merchandise for all her customers. She is requesting a loan from CEVI to enable her to expand the size of her store and to further augment her income.

CEVI constantly is making a lasting impact on the lives of people. Through the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that they give, more and more people are able to sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon H. is a farmer who lives in Preak Phum village in the Kandal province. Since her field is quite a distance from an irrigation system, Mrs. Lon H. has difficulty watering her field. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to irrigate her field and improve her crops. Her husband, Mr. Em Srin, helps her on the plantation.

Mrs. Lon H. is 41-years-old and the mother of eight children. Three are employed in a garment factory, while four others are attending the local school. The youngest child, age four, stays at home.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to irrigate the field and improve the crop production.

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un M., 58, is a widow with one daughter who is a silk weaver. Her daughter was married and lives with her. The family lives on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-un has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Now, she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa A. is a 47-year-old mother who has six children. She owns a small store where she sells a variety of goods including fish, to earn additional income for the family. Her husband is a casual employee of their municipality; however, the income that her husband gets in his job is not enough to support the needs of their children well. She needs to look for some other line of business to contribute to the family income.

Having started from a small capital of Php 6,000, Felisa manages to run a small store. She has the best market place so she always hits her target sales. Now that her business is growing, she needs more capital to sustain her business. She needs to purchase more merchandise to sell to make her business grow. She wants to avail of a loan from CEVI to expand her business. She believes that by doing so, she will earn a bigger income and achieve the dreams she has for her children. All she wanted ever since she decided to engage in marriage is to have a child who will make the family proud. She keeps on dreaming that all her children will be able to finish a college degree and have a very stable job.

Felisa is a happy and proud member of the CEVI credit program. Because of her being part of the program, she has access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI provides to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun M., 50, and her husband Mr. Nen Net, 58, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have eight children: five daughters and three sons. Five of her children attend school, one child is married and lives outside the family house, and two children are silk weavers.

Phun has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband used to farm, but now he has stopped and assists his wife in the weaving business.

Phun is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mr. Yean Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes fourteen people who are located in Soupy village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Yean C. is the village bank president and was selected by the members. He is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets and use the rest of the portion of his loan to buy pig food to feed thE.. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

His wife, Mrs. Seing Phal, is a basket maker in the local village. Mr. Yean C. is 53-years-old and the father of five children. One is a palm juice collector while two are farmers. The remaining children are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets and pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị T.   năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị T. rất khó khăn, sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ  được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đấu thầu ao của xã để nuôi cá. Đến nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  mua gà và cá về nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 42 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 1999. Before joining TYM, Mrs. Nguyễn's family faced financial hardships. Upon joining the fund, she was able to borrow money to invest in raising livestock and purchase some land to farm fish. Today, her family's income is at 4,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle Mrs. Nguyễn hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy chicken and fish to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Chicken and Fish

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Savoeun R. is 47 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh.  She also lives her two daughters, two sons, as well as her husband, who she married almost thirty years ago.  Savoeun has been selling groceries for several years, which she buys from the market in Phnom Penh and resells near her home.  Her husband raises pigs and produces rice wine, while one of their daughters works as a silk weaver.  In order to purchase a greater inventory of groceries, Savoeun is requesting a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en: Voeung C. is 57 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh.  She lives with her four sons, three daughters, and husband, who she married in 1978.  While her husband and sons work as house builders, Voeung has been a silk weaver for almost two decades.  Having learned the trade from her mother, she is now teaching silk weaving to her daughters.  After producing the fine cloth, Voeung sells the product to a merchant who resells it in the markets of Phnom Penh.  In order to diversify their family's employment, however, Voeung is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase pigs and materials for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for domestic use.

loans.name: Hoang Thi Loan` Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Loan sinh năm 1976( Mã số: 010107050014 )  hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học tại thôn Văn Thượng. Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, ngoài ra chị còn đi chợ, chồng đi làm thuê( phu hồ, xây,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích đi chợ. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Tiền sinh năm 1972( Mã số: 010107050013), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích mua giống cây cảnh về trồng và bán.
 Hoàng Thị Hằng sinh năm 1982( Mã số: 010107050015 ), gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ,
 Đặng Thị V. sinh năm 1950( Mã số: 010107050012), thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi.
 Đào Thị Ánh sinh năm 1976( Mã số: 010107050016)  . Hàng ngày chị thường đi mua trứng đem ra chợ bán, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.

loans.use: small retail business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Luyện  năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Luyện rất khó khăn, thu nhập chủ yếu dựa vào việc đi làm thuê.  Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ  được vay vốn gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đấu thầu đầm để nuôi cá. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
 Vòng vốn tới chị Luyện mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để  mua thêm cá về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Luyện is 42 years old. She has been a part of TYM Fund since 1997. Before she joined the fund, Mrs. Trần's family experienced a lot of financial hardship. Their main source of income was from working as laborers/hired hands. Since TYM, she and her family have worked hard to borrow money and invest in rearing livestock and purchase land to farm fish. These are the main sources of income for the family - amounting to 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Mrs. Trần Thị Luyện would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more fish to farm/raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising/Farming Fish

loans.name: Mrs. Khorn Sou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-three people who all live in Tang Kruos Lech village in the Kampong Chhnang province are a part of the village bank loan with Mrs. Khorn S. elected as the village bank president. She owns a small store where she sells grocery items to her local customers. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand and decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She is a 42-year-old widow with a child who is a laborer and is also going to marry soon. Thus, Mrs. Khorn S. is going to have a big happiness party in her family.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twenty members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị L. năm nay  46 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1999 chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm đậu phụ bán. Hiện nay đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua nguyên liệu làm đậu phụ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị L. is 46 years old. She has three children, two of which are grown. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed capital to invest in raising livestock and in making tofu to sell. These businesses are her family's main source of income today providing 3,500,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to reinvest in both her businesses of rearing livestock and to purchase the materials to make and sell tofu.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing Livestock & Productions and Sales of Tofu

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Nga Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Nga sinh năm 1962 ( Mã số: 010107010024 ) hiện đang sống cùng chồng và ba con tại thôn Lực Canh, Xuân Canh. Gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ, chồng đi làm thuê. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.578.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Trần Thị Chúc sinh năm 1961( Mã số: 010107010025)  gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. chị than gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
 Đào Thị Lý sinh năm 1964 ( Mã số: 010107010026). Hàng ngày ngoài công việc đồng áng, chị còn đi chợ rau. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.270.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Q. sinh năm 1959( Mã số: 010107010027)  . Gia đình cũng chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó chị còn đi làm thuê. Thu nhập bình quan của gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích chăn nuôi.
 Lê Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1966( Mã số: 010107010028 ). Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hàng thu nhập khoảng 200.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.

loans.use: small retail business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Okil

texts.en: Okil A. is 60 years old and married with six children.  He has worked as a taxi driver in Isfara, Tajikistan, for over a year but previously spent many years working as a bus driver.  Okil is committed to good customer service is keen to improve and expand his business every year.  Currently his taxi needs thorough repairs in order to effectively transport customers through Isfara's narrow streets.  In order to pay for the general repairs to his vehicle, Okil is requesting a loan of $1,025.

loans.use: To pay for general repairs to taxi.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun S. is a villager in Lvea Sor Kandal village in the Kandal province. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn for living. She now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sarun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make her crops more productive. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to dig a well to give her family access to clean water. Her husband, Mr. Chu Moeun, helps her on the plantation.

Mrs. Sarun S. is 46-years-old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive and dig a well for clean water

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam A. is 50 years old and lives with his six children in Sabra, Beirut.  He has owned a garage since 1993, where he fixes all kinds of car models and repairs other automotive machinery.  In order to expand his business, Issam needs to renovate his garage and renew his toolkit.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and make renovations.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy  năm nay  28 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại xã Yên Đồng huyện Ý Yên. Năm 2004 chị Thủy  tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư buôn bán hoa quả. Hiện nay  ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh dịch vụ vận tải hành khách với tổng thu nhập đạt 6.000.000đ/ tháng .
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để  đầu tư mua dầu máy phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh vận tải hành khách của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thủy is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children in the Yên Đồng village, Ý Yên district. In 2004, Thủy joined TYM Fund and received a loan to invest in fruit sales. Today, in addition to the income from the fruit sales, her family also have income from their business of assisting with transportation of cargo for a total income in the amount of 6,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND to purchase motor oil for the family's cargo transportation business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Cargo Transportation

loans.name: Le Thi Hong

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Hồng D.  năm nay  27 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.Trước khi tham gia Quỹ hai vợ chồng chị chủ yếu chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ, sau khi được vay thêm vốn chị đã đầu tư mua máy cày ruộng để chồng chị đi cày ruộng thuê cho bà con trong xã. Hiện nay  đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để  đầu tư sửa máy và mua thêm dầu máy phục vụ cho  công việc cày ruộng thuê của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Hồng D. is 27 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 1999. Before TYM, she and her husband only raised livestock and a small retail setup. After being able to borrow some capital, she purchased a rice paddy plough so that her husband could render his services ploughing rice paddies for people in their community. Today, the ploughing business is the main source of income for her family with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to fix the plough and purchase more machinery oil to help with her husband's rice paddy ploughing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Plough Rice Paddies

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew A. is a hardworking businessman aged 49. He is married with 5 children, of whom 2 are still in his care. He started his retail shop business 10 years ago and now dreams of transforming it into a wholesale shop. The loan proceeds are enabling Andrew to replenish his stock of rice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil. He hopes that the income from the business will enable him to construct a residential house on the piece of land he inherited from his late parents.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trịnh Thị Thủy  năm nay  35 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2008. hai vợ chồng chị Thủy hiện đều tham gia công việc buôn bán cá. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy cá từ các ao nuôi cá của bà con về cho chị bán tại các chợ. Công việc ngày càng phát triển đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán cá của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trịnh Thị Thủy is 35 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2008. She and her husband both work in the fish sales. Each day, her husband gathers fish from the neighborhood's farm sites so that she can resell them at the markets. This business continues to grow and evolve bringing the family an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to reinvest in the family's fish selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Selling Fish

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty B. is an ambitious business lady in Fortportal. She began her clothing business 5 years ago. She mainly  purchases her stock from Kampala, but now dreams of importing the products from Dubai herself. The loan proceeds  are enabling Betty to purchase more shirts, suits, dresses and trousers to meet the demands of her customers. Betty is a single mother of  two. Her business has enabled her to sustain her family. She hopes to save more funds to purchase a piece of land to build a residence for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, suits, dresses and trousers

loans.name: Neema E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Neema M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because her parents cannot take care of him.

Neema has been running a kuku business since 1995. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are kuku, you may ask. Kuku means "chickens" in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons:

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally. Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Neema currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to expand her kuku business and buy a cow for milk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her kuku business and buy a cow for milk

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman A. is a 28-year-old married man who lives with his three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the Internally Displaced People Settlement called Bilasuvar. Rakhman has been selling sheep for the last six years. Since sheep-selling is a profitable business, Rakhman has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. His income has been enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering the family's needs has become harder.  So Rakhman is applying for a loan to expand his activities and purchase more sheep.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet T. is 47 years old. She is married with 5 children. Annet sells fabrics in Fortportal on a retail basis. However, she now hopes to expand her business into a wholesale shop. The loan proceeds are enabling her to purchase more yards of fabrics like silk, cotton and linen. The silk fabric she sells is in high demand by her customers, as it is used to make busuuti, traditional wear. She also dreams of seeing her children through higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase more yards of fabrics like silk, cotton and linen.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara H. is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has four children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Sara. She chose a livestock field.  She started this business more than 20 years ago with the support of her husband. Now Sara has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. So she would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Sara is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. She has agreed to repay this loan within 15 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dreams become reality.

loans.use: Purchase two head of cattle

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị N.  năm nay 46  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Thời gian đầu mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn để đầu tư đi thu mua phế liệu. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia vay vốn làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng chuyên sản xuất các loại cửa sắt phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm sắt về phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 46 years old. She originally joined TYM Fund in 1998 to borrow loans to invest in her scrap metal business. After 10 years, her investment grew and her family now owns a business specializing in manufacturing metal doors. Her business brings an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in more materials to meet the needs of her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ThienN. Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina M. has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Mina and her husband are very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and sheep farming so that they can give their one dear son the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. A good education is the most important inheritance Mina and her husband can give to their son. Mina now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase their production. Mina and her family are waiting for your your help.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep and fodder

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Hải  năm nay 48  tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó H. con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thu mua phế liệu về bán lại cho các đại lý thu mua. Hiện nay đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  12.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn đi thu mua phế liệu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi H. is 48 years old. Her family has three children, two of whom are grown. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund to invest in buying scrap materials for reselling. Currently, this business gives her family an income of 3,500,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to invest in buying more scrap materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: John Frank

texts.en: John Frank K. set up his lodge in Ntungamo 20 years ago. To meet the changing tastes and preferences of  his customers, he is using the loan to renovate the lodge and also purchase more comfortable beds and mattresses. He is 55 years old, married with 6 children of whom 2 are still in school. His dream is to open up an attractive modern hotel within his locality.

loans.use: To renovate the lodge and also purchase more comfortable beds and mattresses.

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en: Oruj I., age 49, is married and has four children. Twenty-two years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local restaurants. Also, during harvest season, Oruj works as a farm hand to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Oruj requests a loan to buy more calves to raise and thereby expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Oruj thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Veronica J

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Veronica M. from Kyela. She is married with two children aged 11 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them.

Veronica has been running a crops-selling business since 2004. Client’s business is buying crops from farmers and bring them at town where she can sell it at higher price. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members.

Veronica currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Veronica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Zakhid

texts.en: Zakhid A., age 40, lives with his wife and one son in the city of Bilasuvar, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He supports his family by raising cattle, which he sells to a butcher shop in the local market after fattening them to a desirable size over the course of eight or nine months. Zakhid recently realized that his business has the potential for significant growth, and has decided to purchase two more calves each season. Zakhid is requesting this loan in order to achieve this goal, which will allow him to earn more profit and better support his family.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
K. Patience is 30 years old. She is the loving mother of two children, aged 3 and 1. Ten years ago, she began her nursery school in Ntungamo. The income from her business enables her provide for her family.

To accommodate the rising number of students at her school, Patience is requesting a loan to purchase more desks, chairs and reading materials. She dreams of setting up a primary school with modern facilities to offer quality education for local children and employment opportunities for the community.

loans.use: Purchase more desks, chairs and reading materials.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Huyền năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Trước đây thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và lương làm công nhân của chồng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương, được vay vốn chị Huyền đã đầu tư  để kinh doanh các thiết bị điện nước. Hiện tại ngoài thời gian đi làm công nhân chồng chị Huyền còn nhận lắp đặt điện nước cho các hộ gia đình tại địa phương  nên thu nhập của gia đình khá ổn định( 3.500.000đ/ tháng). Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh thiết bị điện nước
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 29 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2004. Before joining the fund, her family's main income came from livestock raising and her husband's salary as a blue collar worker. After joining the fund, she Mrs. Duong borrowed money to invest in selling plumping and electrical equipments. Currently, in addition to working as a blue collar worker, her husband also sets up water and electrical works for the locals' homes so her family's income is very stable (3,500,000 VND/ month.) She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in plumping and electrical supplies.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Dam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đàm Thị năm năm nay 23 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn- Hà Nội. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ thu nhập của hai vợ chồng chị chủ yếy dựa vào kinh doanh bao bì bằng nhựa nhưng sau khi vào tham gia Quỹ tình thương được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua máy tái chế nhựa để tạo hạt nhựa cung cấp cho các nhà sản xuất. Hiện nay công việc của gia đình chị đang ngày càng phát triển và cho thu nhập ổn định ( 5.000.000đ/ tháng). Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho kinh doanh và mua phế liệu về tái chế.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Thi is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children at Soc Son District, Ha Noi. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 2008. Before joining the fund, her family's income mainly relied from selling plastic bags. After joining the fund, her family has invested in a plastic recycling machine to supply plastics for local manufacturers. Currently, her growing business brings a stable income of 5,000,000 VND/ month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in more scrap plastic to recycle.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Neema N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Neema N. N. from Tukuyu. She is married with one one-year-old child. Neema has been running a timber business since 2005. Her business is to purchase timber from villages and resell it in town.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Neema currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more timber in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Neema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad M. is a 28-year-old farmer who keeps cattle and sells them for meat production. He lives with his parents in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. Elshad works very hard every day of his life to provide a better life for his family. He wakes up early in the morning, cleans the shed, and pastures the calves. Currently, Elshad has three calves and he would like to purchase two more calves to increase his profit, especially since he is going to be married this year. Development of his business is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
T. Judith is 34 years old. She sells utensils and cutlery in Ishaka. With her 10 years of experience in the business, she dreams of opening up an outlet within the region. The loan proceeds will enable her to increase her stock of saucepans, plates, cups and glasses.

Judith is the loving married mother of 3 school-going children. The income from her business has enabled her to cultivate her banana plantation, which has been generating funds for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: Purchase saucepans, plates, cups and glasses.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị Đào năm nay  48 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1993. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ nguồn thu nhập của gia đình chị Đào chủ yếy dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để  đầu tư  kinh doanh, buôn bán. Hiện tại gia đình chị có một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh rau, và các loại thực phẩm khô. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay (4.000.000đ/ tháng). Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm nên kinh tế đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi D. is 48 years old. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 1993. Before joining the fund, her family's main income comes from farming and raising livestock. After joining the fund, she has borrowed funds to invest in a small business selling vegetables and dried food. This main source of income brings her 4,000,000 VND per month. With extra financial help from her working children, her family's income is very stable. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Kim

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Kim N. năm nay 38 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con  đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1996 chị N. tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Sau một thời gian vùa làm vừa học tập kinh nghiệm kinh doanh  từ những thành  viên khác trong Cụm chị N. đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để đầu tư cho buôn bán. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu rất ổn định từ việc buôn bán gà với tổng thu nhập bình quân 4.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị N. mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, buôn bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Kim N. is 38 years old. She has four school-age children. In 1996, she joined TYM Fund to invest in raising livestock and farming. After learning about investment from the more experienced members of her loan group, she has borrowed fund to invest in selling chickens. Currently, besides her income from raising livestock, she also has additional income from selling chickens. Her income averages at 4,500,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in raising livestock and selling chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị S. 38 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đang tuỏi đến trường. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và làm đậu phụ bán với thu nhập 5.000.00đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu về làm đậu phụ, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị S., 38 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. She has two children who attend school. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and tofu production. Their total monthly income is 5,000,000 VND (288 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. S. hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest chiefly in buying ingredients for making tofu, and also in part to raise animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tofu production

loans.name: Arafaat

texts.en:
Arafaat is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Arafaat has been working as a plasterer for 23 years. Arafaat requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase wood and spraying machines. This is his second (loan) cycle, and he has always paid on time.

The first loan has influenced his life in a good way. It let him purchase better machines and thereby improve his work. In turn, he improved his lifestyle. Arafaat stands out professionally because of his good work and punctuality. Anybody can be his client. He decided on doing his work because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and spraying machines.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hường  25 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương ngoài chăn nuôi chị Hường còn đầu tư vốn để thu mua phế liệu. Công việc phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định. Hiện nay ngoài  thu mua phế liệu gia đình chị còn có thêm nghề rửa xe máy nên kinh tế đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hường mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua phế liệu về tái chế lại và cung cấp cho các nhà sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Hường, 25 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2004. Since becoming a member of the Fund, Mrs. Hường has been able to start a recycling business in addition to raising animals. Her business collecting scrap materials has grown steadily and now brings in a dependable income for her family. And recently, her family has been able to start yet another small business washing motorbikes, so that their total monthly income has risen to 3,500,000 VND (204 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs.Hường hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in buying up recyclable scrap materials which she can sell to industrial producers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recycling scrap materials

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
B. Adam is 55 years old. He sells milk and yoghurt on a retail basis in Ishaka town, and has has seven years of experience in the dairy business. Due to increasing consumer demand and a need to improve his services, Adam is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler and more cows for additional milk production.

Adam’s dream is to open up a retail shop as another source of income. He also wishes to increase his banana farming by purchasing more land in his locality. Adam is a responsible father of 7 children, 3 of whom are still in school. He therefore hope that when his ambitions come to pass, he will build a modern residential house for his family and also send the children to the best institutions of higher learning.

loans.use: Purchasing a cooler and more cows

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working as a plasterer for 22 years. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase wood and spraying machines. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because of his honesty and good reputation. Anyone can be his client. When he first started, his faced difficulty with the competition. He decided on doing his business because he always wanted to have his own workshop. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and spraying machines.

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en: Aysel N. is very young entrepreneur at 18 years of age. She just finished school and already has a business mind. Poverty in her family pushed her to work from a young age. Her parents have land where they raise crops to sell to the local bazaar traders. Aysel analyzed the commodity most demanded by the people living in her city and concluded that meat-selling is the most profitable business. From money she saved, she purchased one calf and now is raising it for sale in four more months. Her parents support her and have approved her asking for a loan to purchase two more calves. Let’s do our best to help this young and brave girl!

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Kiều Thị Sơn  27 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn- Hà Nội. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi và  kinh doanh hàng giải khát. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi, kinh doanh hàng giải khát gia đình chị  còn mở rộng buôn bán thêm hoa quả và kinh doanh dịch vụ đám cưới( phông bạt, bát đĩa...) với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị Sơn mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thức ăn để phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kiều Thị Sơn - 27 years old - she is living with her husband and young child in the district of Sóc Sơn in the city of Hà Nội (Hanoi - capital of Vietnam). In 2005, she joined TYM Fund to borrow funds for the businesses of rearing livestock and selling beverages. Currently, outside of raising livestock, her family has added fruits and wedding celebration items to their beverage retail business providing an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, Sơn hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to purchase more animal feed for their livestock rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase for raising livestock

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mohammad has owned a bakery for seven years. Mohammad has an oven, and he sells mankoucheh. He is known for his good and very tasty mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Mohammad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase flour, pay school tuition, and pay off his debts. This is the first time that Mohammaad has requested a loan.

Mohammad is known for his work because he makes very good and tasty mankoucheh. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he faced the difficulty of finding clients. He decided on doing this business because he had good experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, pay school tuition, and pay off his debts.

loans.name: Frozia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Frozia B. from Dar es Salaam She is married with five children. Frozia has been running a cloth-selling business since 1998. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Frozia currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375 USD in order to purchase additional clothes. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her merchandise. Getrude thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
N. Gorretti is 32 years old. She has 10 years of experience in operating a retail shop. She sells most of the fast-moving consumer goods in Ibanda town. The success of Gorreti’s business can be attributed to her good conduct and customer courtesy.

Due to an increase in her consumer base, Gorretti is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, rice, aitme cards and soft drinks. She hopes to save the income from the business to enable her finish the construction of her rental houses. Gorretti has one son and hopes to see him through all levels of education.

loans.use: Purchase more sugar, rice, aitme cards and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya M. is a 22-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. Three years ago, Ulviyya`s husband offered to help her start a business, since it was hard for a woman with a small child to find any job. Ulviyya accepted his offer and the same day went to the local livestock bazaar to purchase her first head of cattle. Since she is at home all day with her child, it is easy to look after calves and she really enjoys it. That’s why she has applied for a loan to purchase more calves and increase her income. She wants to expand her business in order to provide the best education possible for her lovely daughter. Ulviyya and her family thank you for your help.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Mach's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in Chamka village in the Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan with Mrs. Lorn M. as the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Doeun Phuon, are farmers who own a plot of land T. cultivate both rice and vegetables. Even though they work hard, they still gather little rice revenue which cannot support their family very well. In order T. improve their living conditions, Mrs. Lorn M. decided T. ask for a loan T. buy three piglets T. start a breeding business. She is 53-years-old and the mother of two children, both who are attending the local school.

Ten members in this group loan are committed T. end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. It allows them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T. do so. Most clients start T. make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

Mrs. Sokun O., one of the loan participants, is represented by her husband in the phoT..

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Khoái  51 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị Khoái chỉ vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi nhưng đến năm 1998 chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô.  Đến nay sau 13 năm tham gia Quỹkinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Năm 2007 chị đã đầu tư mở thêm một của hàng làm nhôm kính để tạo công ăn việc làm cho con trai. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Khoái mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô để phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Khoái, 51 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1995. When she first joined, she only borrowed money to invest in raising animals, but in 1998 she boldly took a loan to invest in a new business selling dry goods. During her 13 years of membership in the Fund, the financial situation of her family has steadily improved. In 2007, she opened another shop on the same model in order to provide a livelihood for her son. Currently, the total family income is 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Khoái hopes to borrow 15,000,000 (875 USD) to buy dry goods and other foodstuffs that will meet the needs of local residents during the lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dry goods

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
T. Expedito is 40 years of age. After attaining a college certificate in tailoring, he opened a workshop in Ibanda town. His fine suits, uniforms and bitenges are popular, and his quality services have earned him the loyalty of his customers. With the assistance of 3 well-trained employees, he is able to meet his customers' deadlines. The income from his business has enabled him provide for his 5 children and his late brother’s 3 children as well.

This loan will help Expedito purchase more fabric, stiff paper, lining and threads. He dreams of opening a fashion designing school in the district.

loans.use: Purchasing more fabric, stiff paper, lining and threads.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tý  45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị là từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán thực phẩm và lương làm thợ xây của chồng với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị Tý mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng thực phẩm phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con địa phương
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị Tý is 45 years old, a TYM fund member since 2003. Currently her family income of 3.000.000 VND a month comes from raising livestock, food sales and her husband's salary as a construction worker. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 10.000.000 VND to buy food products to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
L. Julius is a hardworking businessman. He has 4 years of experience in the hardware business. His retail shop in Ibanda sells a wide range of hardware products. This loan will enable him to replenish his stock of cement, ironsheets, paint and cement.

In addition to his hardware store, Julius also has a small carpentry workshop. He toils hard to ensure he provides for his 4 children. He dreams of opening another outlet in the neighboring town. When his plans are realized, he will construct a modern residential house for his family.

loans.use: Purchase cement, ironsheets, paint and cement.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Bẩy  34 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Hiện tại hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi, chồng chị đi lấy hoa quả từ các chợ kinh doanh hoa quả về cho chị bán lẻ tại chợ. Đây cũng là  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia dình chị  với thu  nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị Bảy mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Bẩy, 34 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1996. In addition to raising animals, she and her husband have a fruit-selling business. Each day, her husband goes and purchases fruit at the large wholesale markets and brings it back to her. Then she sells the fruit in retail quantities at the neighborhood food market. This business is their main source of income, earning them about 5,000,000 VND (288 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Bẩy hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest in her fruit sales enterprise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Amlato

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Mr D. Amlato est père de huit (08) enfants et réside actuellement à Gapé au Sud du Togo.  Après avoir abandonné les études, li s’est adonné à la vente de produits alimentaires de premières nécessités et autres. Doué et expérimenté dans ce genre de commerce, il sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. Ceci lui permettra de venir à bout de ses problèmes financiers et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie sur le plan économique et social.
texts.en:
Thirty-two years old, Mr. Amlato D. is the father of eight children and lives in Gapé in the South of Togo. After leaving school, he began selling staples and other foodstuffs. Talented and experienced in this type of business, he is asking for a loan to expand his merchandise. He will thus put an end to his financial problems and improve his living conditions both economically and socially.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đồng Thị D. năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Ban đầu chị D. vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, đến năm 2000 chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở của hàng ăn. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh dịch vụ hàng ăn và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đồng Thị D., 48 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1996. At first, Mrs. D. used her loans only to raise animals. Then, in 2000, she made the bold decision to use a loan to open a restaurant. Today, both she and her husband work in their restaurant, which has become their main source of income, earning them about 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. D. hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (875 USD) to invest in her restaurant and also in raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Birungi

texts.en:
