There is no competition between them as both have secure employment, one in the public sector and the other in the private sector, and they both receive monthly salaries. Martina has invested all of her money in buying construction material. This will be the fifth loan she has received, and she has punctually repaid all of the previous loans. She does not owe money to any other financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Joyce N. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has one child who is four years old. Joyce has run a clothing business for the last year. She buys her clothes wholesale and sells them retail. She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, six days a week. Joyce currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 in order to buy additional stocks of cloth. In the future, she plans to expand her business, and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cloth In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.name: Filomena Rosario De

texts.es: LA SRA. FILOMENA QUE CUENTA CON 55 AÑOS VIVE EN SU PROPIA CASA UBICADA POR LA ZONA NORTE DE WARNES, CERCA DEL HOSPITAL GRAL. JUNTO A SU ESPOSO DE 61 Y SUS HIJOS DE 33 Y 23 AÑOS DE EDAD. ELLA ES AMA DE CASA Y SU ESPOSO ES RENTISTA, JUBILADO DE LA EMPRESA MADERERA SOBOLMA LTDA. NO TIENE COMPETENCIA YA QUE ES AMA DE CASA Y SU ESPOSO RENTISTA (JUBILADO). LA SRA. DE F. A COMPRADO ARTEFACTOS PARA SU HOGAR, DONDE HA INVERTIDO TODO EL MONTO SOLICITADO. ESTE SERIA EL SEXTO PRESTAMO DE LA SRA. ROSARIO, Y TODOS LOS ANTERIORES LOS A CANCELADO PUNTUALMENTE. ELLA NO TIENE DEUDA EN NINGUNA OTRA FINANCIERA.
texts.en:
Filomena is 55 years old, she lives in her own home located in the northern area of Warnes, near the Gral hospital, along with her 61 year old husband and children ages 33 and 23. She is a housewife and her husband is an investor, retired from the Maderera Sobolma business. She doesn’t have any training as she is a housewife and her husband is a retired investor. Mrs. De F. has purchased items for her home, where she has invested the requested loan. This will be the 6th loan for Rosario, and all the previous loans were repaid punctually. She doesn’t have debt in any other financing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is a single mother with five dependents. She has completed up to senior high school. Veronica sells fish. She buys fish directly from the fishermen, processes and preserves them, and than sends them to the market at Liverpool Street in Elmina to sell.  She has done this since 2005. Veronica uses her income to pay for her family's financial needs and the children's school fees. Veronica will use the loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the increased profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to reinvest in the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: Veronica will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Fernandina

texts.es:
Fernandina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc.
Fernandina es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Fernandina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donD. venD. verduras al por mayor y menor, sus productos los adquiere D. los productores. Además Fernandina venD. cerveza, gaseosas los días domingos en la comunidad D. Muyurina.
Fernandina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cebolla, tomate.
Fernandina sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Fernandina is a member of the Imasumacc Community Bank. She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. She has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells vegetables both wholesale and retail. She buys the produce directly from the farmers. Fernandina also sells beer and soft drinks on Sundays in the community of Muyurina. Fernandina is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy onions and tomatoes. She dreams of owning her own grocery store, and hopes her children can pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Anna A. Nyengella from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 16. Anna has been in business as a food-seller since 2004. She buys crops from farmers at a low price and sells them in the city at higher price.She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Anna currently earns about $350 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase rice, maize and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the goods.  Anna thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and beans.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: LA SRA. MIRTHA TIENE 49 AÑOS CUENTA CON UNA VIVIENDA PROPIA EN LA URBANIZACION EL QUIOR,  TIENE DOS DEPENDIENTES UNO DE 12 Y OTRO DE 19 AÑOS. LA SRA. MIRTHA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALDOS EN EL MERCADO ALTO SAN PEDRO, ACTIVIDAD EN LA CUAL LLEVA MAS DE 10 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA Y ADEMAS CUENTA CON UNA RENTA DE UN VEHICULO EL CUAL TRABAJA COMO TAXI. LA COMPETENCIA EN AMBOS RUBROS ES FUERTE, PERO LA EXPERIENCIA QUE LOS AÑOS DE TRABAJO LE HAN OTORGADO  HACE QUE CUENTE CON CLIENTES FIJOS   PARA LA VENTA DE SUS  CALDOS. LA CLIENTE TIENE UN PROMEDIO DE VENTA DE 250 BS/DIA CON UNA GANANCIA PROMEDIO DE  40% SOBRE LAS VENTAS DEL DIA. LA CLIENTE YA HA TENIDO DOS OPERACIONES ANTERIORES A ESTA EN LAS CUALES  HA DEMOSTRADO LA RESPONSABILIDAD EN EL PAGO DE LAS CUOTAS.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 49 years old. She lives in an urban area called “Quior”. She has two dependent children, a 12 year old and a 19 year old. Mirtha has sold shoes at the Alto San Pedro market for over 10 years. She also rents a car that is used as a taxi. Both businesses have a high market competition, but with her experience after so many years, she managed to acquire fixed clients that regularly purchase her shoes. She has an average daily sales income of 250 bolivianos ($35), with an average earning of 40% over the daily sales. This is Mirtha’s third loan and she has proven to be responsible with her payments before.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Marina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en la Av. Arenales, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de un personal, también vende bebidas. Marina tiene proyectado aperturar un restaurante en la ciudad de San Francisco.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Marina son construir su casa, tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the community bank “Imasumacc”. Marina lives with her partner. She is 22 years old and has a son. She own a restaurant in a rented place located in Av. Arenales. The restaurant is opened every day and she is assisted by her personnel. She also sells beverages. Marina’s project is to open a second restaurant in the city of San Francisco. She needs a 2500 soles ($800) loan that will bed used to purchase tables and chairs. Marina’s dream is to finish building her home and to own a clothes shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs for her new restaurant.

loans.name: Silveria Maria

texts.es: SILVERIA TIENE SU NEGOCIO BIEN ESTABLECIDO Y CONOCIDO EN EL BARRIO, ESTO DEBIDO A QUE DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS ATRÁS ATIENDE POR ESTE LUGAR. ESTO LA ANIMÓ A AMPLIAR SUS SERVICIOS ATENDIENDO AHORA A PENSIONADOS. EN SU VENTA LE VA BIEN YA QUE ESTA FRENTE A UNA PLAZITA DONDE VENDEN AUTOS NO EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE ESTA EN PLENA ESQUINA DE UNA AVENIDA LA CASA Y NO EXISTE MUCHA TIENDA DE ESE TIPO SI NO MAS BIEN NEGOCIOS DE OTRO RUBRO, SILVERIA ESTABA ATENDIENDO PENSIONADOS POR LO QUE NO SE PUDO ENTRAR A SU CASA YA QUE SOLO ESTABA SU HIJO PEQUEÑO, SOLO TOMO LA FOTO POR FUERA. LA CLIENTE HA TENIDO BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGOS EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA.
texts.en:
Silveria has a known, well-established business in the neighborhood due to his longevity in this locale. This success has inspired him to expand his services now to retirees. His sales are going well as he is located in across a small plaza where they sell cars and there isn’t much competition as he is on the corner of the La Casa avenue. There aren’t many stores of this type but rather there are business catering to other areas. Silveria was taking care of retirees so we couldn’t enter his home as only his small son was there so the photo was taken outside. The client has a good payment history with all his previous loans no problems to report.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his sales and sell to retirees

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Maria J. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children ages one and eight. Maria has been running a pharmacy since 2004. She works at the business for 13-16 hours a day, six days a week. Maria currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 to purchase additional stocks of medicines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Maria thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of medicines

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc.
Clotilde es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Clotilde tiene una mini imprenta en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, donde brinda servicios de tipeos, de la atención se encarga un empleado. Además Clotilde junto a su esposo tienen un centro de estudios de la violencia sociopolítica. Trabaja como consultora.
Clotilde necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles de computadora para su imprenta.
Los sueños de Clotilde son formalizar la institución en una ONG, construir su casa y tener un centro de rehabilitación para los pobres.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the community bank “Imasumacc”. Clotilde lives with her partner. She is 25 years old and has a son. She owns a small printing shop at the “12 de Abril” market, where she performs typing jobs. She has an employee who runs the shop. Clotilde’s husband runs a study center of socio-politic violence. She also works as a consultant. She needs a 1000 soles ($325) loan that will be used to purchase computer furniture for her printing shop. Clotilde’s dream is to establish his company as an NGO, to finish building her home and to have a rehab center for people with low resourses.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer furniture for her printing shop

loans.name: Beth K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Beth M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children, between the ages of 16 and 28. Beth has operated a restaurant since 1991. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her children. Beth currently earns about $13 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase more maize flour, rice and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business . Beth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Jesusa es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Jesusa tiene cabinas de Internet y también juegos de playstation en su casa que se ubica en la alameda del cementerio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo.
Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de 2 juegos de playstation.
Los sueños de Jesusa es que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a member of the Community Bank “Empecemos” (Let’s Get Started). Jesusa is married. She is 37 years old and she has a son. She lives in near the cemetery. She owns an Internet café and also rents Play Station consoles, together with her son. Jesusa needs a 1600 soles ($525) loan to purchase two other Play Station consoles. Jesusa’s deam is to see her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two Play Station consoles

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: OSCAR ESTA CASADO CON LA SRA. SANDRA DELGADILLO. TIENEN DOS HIJOS: 19 Y 9 AÑOS. POSEEN UN BIEN INMUEBLE PROPIO EN EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA FUNCIONANDO EL NEGOCIO. OSCAR PRESTA LOS   SERVICIOS DE CERRAJERIA, BICICLETERIA Y GOMERIA,  LA CONYUGUE ATIENDE EL NEGOCIO DE COMIDA QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU DOMICILIO, AMBOS ATIENDEN SUS NEGOCIOS HACE 18 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA, PERO LA ANTIGÜEDAD, EXPERIENCIA, CALIDAD Y  RAPIDEZ EN EL SERVICIO PRESTADO, LES HA PERMITIDO SER CONOCIDOS EN LA ZONA Y EN EL BARRIO, POR LO QUE CUENTAN CON MUCHA CLIENTELA. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA INCREMENTAR EL CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES DEL NEGOCIO Y LA COMPRA DE UNA NUEVA COMPRESORA. CUARTO PRESTAMO  AL QUE ACCEDE EL CLIENTE, CON EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO Y PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS. NO REGISTRA UN SOLO DIA DE MORA EN NINGUNA CUOTA DE LOS CREDITOS OTORGADOS.
texts.en:
Oscar is married to Mrs. Sandra Delgadillo. They have two children ages 19 and 9. They own their own building where their business is located. Oscar provides locksmith service, a bicycle shop, and a tire repair shop. His wife has a food business in their home. They both have attended to their respective businesses for approximately 18 years. Their competence is high, but their longevity, experience, quality and fast service has enable them to become known in the area and neighborhood so they have many customers. The loan will be used to increase their working capital and buy a new compressor. This is the fourth loan to be given to this client, who has been excellent and punctual in his payments. He has never been a day late on any payment of his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Zaria A. Majid from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children ages seven and ten. Zaria has run a grocery business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, six days a week. Maria currently earns about $350 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase additional stocks of foods such as rice, potatoes, maize and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Maria thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of foods such as rice, potatoes, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Christina M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Christina M. from Tukuyu. She is single and has four children between the ages of 16 and 20. Christina has run a food-selling business since 1992. She buys her goods from local farmers and sells them in nearby villages. She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, seven days a week, with help from her children. Christina currently earns about $370 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase ten bags of maize, three bags of groundnuts and two bags of beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of the goods she has for sale. Christina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of maize, three bags of groundnuts and two bags of beans in bulk

loans.name: Wilma De

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilma tiene la edad de 55 años es casada y cuenta con dos hijos que viven en su domicilio, cuenta con vivienda propia que esta inscrita en DDRR a su nombre. La Sra. Wilma cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su  propio domicilio, hace mas mas de 3 años que cuenta con esta tienda de abarrotes. 
La tienda de abarrotes es la unica mas surtida de la zona en la que los vecinos encuentran lo que necesitan.                                                                                          El destino del credito es para el capital de operacion de su tienda de abarrotes para aumentar mas mercaderia ya que en la epoca de fin de año tiene mas ventas. La clienta tiene un buen historial crediticio en nuestra institucion ya que es el cuarto credito que refinancia teniendo un buen comportamiento de pago, ademas cuenta con credito tambien en otra institucion de la cual esta pagando en fecha.
texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, married and has two children who live at home. She owns her own home which is legally registered under her name. Wilma has a grocery store located in her home and has had the store for more than 3 years. The store is the only well-stocked one in the area in which her neighbors can find the goods they need. This loan will be used for working capital for the store in order to have more merchandise for the end of the year when there are more sales. Wilma has good credit; this is her fourth loan and she has had a good payment history. She also has a loan with another institution that is being paid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 60-year-old Fatuma A. P. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with four children between the ages 16 and 45. Fatuma has made a living running a cafe since 2004. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour) and plantain (a cooked savory banana), served with beans, vegetables, meat and a variety of sauces.

Fatuma works at her business for 9-12 hours a day, seven days a week. She currently earns about $400 a month from her business, and is requesting a loan of $750 to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and beans. In the future, she plans to renovate her business. Fatuma thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se dedica a la produccion y venta de Batanes, la Esposa se dedica a la produccion y venta de linaza en la avenida suecia, tienen 7 hijos desde 26 a 9 años de edad, los cuales colaboran en las actividades, poseen una casa en la avenida suecia.                                         
Tienen mucha competencia en ambas actividades, pero han logrado establecer una clientela la cual los busca por la calidad de sus productos. Con el credito solicitado ellos compraran materia prima con la cual ampliaran sus negocios lo que les proporcionara mayores ingresos con los cuales seguir mejorando su domicilio y manutencion.                                                         
El anterior credito en Agrocapital se cancelo sin demoras, se trata de clientes muy responsables, los cuales tienen un solo dia de retraso debido que exisitia un embotellamiento y no pudieron llegar a tiempo al Banco.
texts.en:
Juan produces and sells grinding stones (motars). His wife produces and sells flaxseed on Suecia Avenue. They have 7 children, ranging in age from 26 to 9, who help in these activities, and they have a house on Suecia Avenue. They have a lot of competition in both activites but have been able to establish a customer base who buys from them because of the quality of their products. With the loan requested they will buy materials with which they can expand their businesses; this will give them more income with which they can continue to improve and maintain their home. Their previous loan with Agrocapital was repaid on time. They are responsible clients who were behind on a payment only once due to a traffic jam which caused them to not be able to arrive on time to the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital and to purchase materials.

loans.name: Anna S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Anna M. from Tukuyu. She is widow with six children between the ages of 18 and 37. She is also responsible for supporting two other people because they are orphans. Anna has made a living running a clothes shop since 1997.

She works at this business for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week, with help from her children. Anna currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of items she has for sale. Anna  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Christina M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Christina K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with three children between the ages of 6 and 18. She is also responsible for supporting another child whose parents died of  HIV. 

Christina has made a living selling produce since 2002. She buys her crops from nearby farms and sells them in town for higher price. She works for 9-12 hours a day, 7 days a week. Christina currently earns about $500 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 in to buy maize, beans and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Christina  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans and rice in bulk

loans.name: Claudia Esthela

texts.es: La Sra.: Claudia vende ropa y productos de cosméticos, gaseosa desde hace cinco años,  que comenzó  con fondos propios, haciendo ahorro cada día, para tener algo con que subsistir con su familia, como toda familia le ha tocado vivir sola ya que es madre soltera con dos hijos menores que están estudiando la primaria. Tiene 37años de edad, y habita en Hialeah en la ciudad de Managua, los productos que vende son por encargo y tiene en venta en general al contado y al crédito, para poder mantener su negocio hizo préstamo en Afodenic lo cual me ha beneficiado de mucho por que gracias a los crédito que me han brindado he podido mantener el negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual voy a invertir en la compra de ropa para niños y adultos, productos variados de cosméticos, y gaseosas para seguir ofertando a sus clientes. a futuro es poder captar mas clientes  y tener un mejor inventario, a si como ayudar a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Claudia has sold clothing, cosmetics and soft drinks for the past five years. She started the business with her own money, saving each day so that she could have something with which to support her family. Like others, she is on her own as she is a single mother with two young children who are studying in primary school. She is 37 years old and lives in the Hialeah area of Managua city. She sells product by order and also has products in stock which she sells either for cash or on credit. To keep her business going she took out a loan with Afodenic which helped her a lot and thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain the business. This is her fifth loan application and she will invest in clothing for children and adults, a variety of cosmetic products and soft drinks. In the future she would like to get more customers and improve her inventory as well as help her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for adults and children, cosmetics and soft drinks.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia E. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes este ha sido su fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad una hija de 8 años de edad que esta estudiando. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder surtir su negocio y así poder ofrecer más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Natalia E. has been selling groceries for over four years and this has been her family’s source of income as she is a single mother with responsibility for her 8 year old daughter who attends school. She would like her business to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers but she doesn’t have the necessary capital to be able to stock her business and therefore be able to offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria P.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Maria M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child, aged 4. Maria has run a business selling phone accessories since 2004. Despite being a ‘developing’ country, it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general--not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids and vendors. It can be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

Maria works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, 7 days a week and gets help from her husband. Maria currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy more phone accessories such as phone cases, batteries and chargers to resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories such as ases, batteries and chargers

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Don Rubén desea adquirir un préstamo para poder pagar el hospital donde nació su hijo, ya que en ese momento no contaban con el dinero.
Él solicita este crédito para poder liquidar su adeudo con  la clínica en su totalidad. Planea sufragar la ayuda brindada con el ingreso de su trabajo ya que se dedica a la limpieza de terrenos en el vecino país.
Cuando se realizó la visita al domicilio del señor Rubén P. se encontraba trabajando, solo estaba su esposa la señora Karla Carolina Sosa quien fue la que nos atendió y aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Rubén wishes to acquire a loan in order to be able to pay the hospital where his son was born, because at the moment he doesn’t have the money to do so. He is asking for this loan to be able to totally clear his debt with the clinic. He plans to repay the help he received with the income from his job as he excavates land in a neighboring country. When we visited Mr. Rubén P. he was out working and only his wife Karla Carolina Sosa was home to meet with us and it is she who appears in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay medical expenses

loans.name: Fidecy C.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Fidecy  M. from Tukuyu. She is married and has three children who are between the ages of 3 and 11. Fidecy has run a tailoring business since 2005, making and selling clothing.

She works for 9-12 hours a day, 7 days a week with help from her husband. Fidecy currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy materials for her tailoring services. In the future, she plans to build her own store because now she is renting.  Fidecy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring mart

loans.name: Edda J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Edda M. from Tukuyu. She is married and has four children between the ages of 15 and 20. Edda has run a timber-selling business since 2004, buying wood from the forest and selling it in towns.

She works four hours a day, seven days a week and has one employee. Edda currently earns about $400 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase additional timber. In the future, she plans to increase her stock even further -- and by doing that, expand her small company. Edda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
El negocio de papelería de la señora Veronica Sanchez le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía de artículos escolares, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así tener mas variedad de productos.
Doña Veronica Sanchez es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos de edad escolar y así su mama que le ayuda atender el negocio cundo ella no esta. Esta solicitando este crédito para poder tener más ingresos en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Veronica Sanchez has an office supply store and she needs more school supplies, so she is asking for a loan to invest in her business and thereby have a greater variety of products. Veronica Sanchez is a single mother and is responsible for two school-aged children. Her mother helps her with the store when Veronica is unable to be there. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to have greater income in her business as it is the source of her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Felista I.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 65-year-old Felista M. from Tukuyu. She is married and has four children who are between the ages of 30 and 42. Felista has been selling mobile phones since 2003. Despite being a ‘developing’ country, it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general--not just professionals, but grandmas in villages, school kids and street vendors. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

She works at the business for nine hours a day, six days a week. Felista currently earns about $375 a month from her business. She is seeking a loan of $375 to buy additional phones. In the future, she plans to further increase both the number and types of phones she sells. Felista thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional mobile phones

loans.name: Jorge Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Pablo tiene 15 años dedicándose al comercio de ropa usada, el nuevo reto que se planteó es  la venta de ropa nueva, para esto tiene que realizar una buena inversión pues quiere ofrecer al publico productos de la mejor calidad.
 El negocio lo atienden el señor y su esposa ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y quieren lo mejor para su hijo que apenas empieza a estudiar.
Solicita el apoyo de ustedes para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Pablo has been selling used clothes for 15 years and the new challenge he has planned is the sale of new clothes. This is a good investment because he wants to offer the public better quality products. The business that he and his wife run is the source of income for their family and they want the best for their son who has just begun to study. He asks for your support to accomplish his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Bahati  A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This 26-year-old Bahati K. from Tukuyu. She is single, and since 2005 has made a living running a clothes shop. She buys clothes wholesale and sell them retail to her customers.

She works at the business for nine hours a day, seven days a week, earning about $750 a month from her business. Bahati is requesting a loan of $775 to buy additional clothes for her business. In the future, her goal is to increase quantity and range of items she has to sell to her customers. Bahati thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Joyce J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Joyce M. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with two children, ages 10 and 20. Joyce has made a living selling clothes since 2002. She buys her clothing wholesale and sells it retail to her customers.

She works at her business for eight hours a day, six days a week, earning about $140 a month. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy additional clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to open another business selling shoes. Joyce thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married to to Marcus Nweti and they have 5 children, with one of the children below 15 years of age. As a hard-working woman, Elizabeth has faced many challenges in life such as the death of relatives, poverty, and ill health. Theses problems made life miserable for Elizabeth until the year 1999 in which she learned about GHAPE and registered as a member. In the years 1999, 2001, 2002, 2003, 2004, 2006, and 2008, she received loans (15,000; 30,000; 35,000; 40,000; 100,000; 75,000, and 100,000 FRS respectively) and the repayments of the various loans were made promptly.

Given her loan, she plans to buy an oil mill for 450,000 FRS, piglets for 30,000 frs and 10,000 frs will be used for fuel. Repayment will begin on the fourth month from the day of disbursement. Elizabeth is quite convinced her business will succeed, because she will not offer credit to untrustworthy clients. She has a good business site and her children all are willing to help her in the business.

Her business will help her community by providing pork (meat from her pigs) which is a source of protein, and she will help process their oil. With the profit from the business, she will pay her children's school fees, give good medical attention to her family, and will also construct a house for her family.

Elizabeth prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE offers. Also, the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying piglets and an oil mill

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: El señor Artemio C. P. ya tiene 18 años trabajando en un negocio en el cual vende lonches y tacos llamado "El trompo loco", es atendido por él y su esposa, este mismo les proporciona buenos ingresos. Pero ahora el señor Artemio desea usar este prestamo para poner un negocio de abarrotes y tener dos giros diferentes , para que de esa manera pueda obtener mayores ingresos los cuales son necesarios para que su esposa e hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Artemio C. P. has been running a business for 18 years that sells tacos and lunches, called “The Crazy Top,” served by himself and his wife which provides a good income. Artemio wants to use this loan to create a grocery business and have two different businesses so that he can have higher revenue which is necessary for his wife and children have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply merchandise to start a grocery business

loans.name: Lucy H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Lucy T. is 53 years old and she is from Tukuyu. She is divorced with 2 children, who are 26 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant, who is an orphan.  

Lucy has earned a living running a charcoal business since 1995. These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth provide a good way of life for charcoal sellers, and are crucial to those who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots to cook, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

Lucy works at her business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. Lucy currently earns about $500 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD in order to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, she plans to increase the amount of charcoal she sells and open another store. Lucy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Queen O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Queen M. is 35 years old and she lives in Tukuyu. She is married with 1 child, who is only a year old. Queen has been running a tailoring business since 2004. She sews clothes, such as shirts, trousers, and dresses and then sells them in her shop.

She works at her business for 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. She works there with another member of her family. Queen currently earns about $200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 USD in order to to buy another two sewing machines for her business. In the future, she plans to employ someone to help her so she can expand her business. Queen thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To to buy another two sewing machines for her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Naomi M. is 33 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with three children, who are between the ages of 1 and 12 years old.

Naomi has been running a tailoring business since 2005. Her business is doing well. She works 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Naomi currently earns about $200 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy more vetenge (material) for making clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Naomi thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vetenge (material) for making clothes

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro Deciderio Velásquez  tiene la edad de  46 años  , habita en el barrio el rodeo ubicado en San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos de la casa ; ellos no tiene  a su cargo ningún hijo ya que estos son mayores de edad y viven en su propia casa . Los planes hacia su familia de don Genaro es mejorar económicamente para tener una vida mejor junto a su esposa .El hace dieciséis años trabaja como agricultor y la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento. Inicio con sus propios esfuerzos el cultivo pero este carece de insumos lo cual necesita el apoyo de la institución para poder ser efectiva dicha aplicación. Con esta solicitud va a comprar insumos de fertilizantes y venenos para tener una mejor producción y poder venderla a mejor precio lo cual le generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Genaro Deciderio Velásquez is 46 years old. He lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood located in San Juan de la Concepción along with his wife, who helps out with the household expenses. They do not have any children to take care of as theirs are all adults and live in their own homes. Genero´s plans for his family are to improve financially so that he and his wife can have a better life. For the past 16 years he has worked as a farmer and the greatest difficulty has been lack of financing. He started growing crops but lacked supplies and needed the support of an institution in order to be successful. With this loan request he will buy fertilizers and poisons so that he can produce more and be able to sell at a better price which will generate more income for him.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and poisons.

loans.name: Dinalzade

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Dinalzade N. is 42 years old and from Mwanza. She is separated from her husband and she has two children who are 12 and 15 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan.

Dinalzade has been running a cosmetics business since 2006. She sells the cosmetics through her retail store to her many customers. She works 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She has one assistant. Dinalzade currently earns about $350 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more cosmetics for her to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Dinalzade thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Bibosi Group

texts.es: El grupo "Bibosi" esta representado por la señora Felicia y conformado por 22 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como al transporte público, secretariado y al comercio D. productos como los cosméticos, panadería, cocina y al comercio D. productos D. la época. Como es D. saber existe gran competencia en el mercado en especial en el ámbito comercial y nuestros socios (as) no son la excepción ellos luchan en sus diferentes puestos D. trabajo para lograr adquirir el ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia y para cumplir con las diferentes obligaciones D. cada uno D. ellos (as). El destino D. los fondos otorgados por la Fundación Agrocapital es para el incremento D. sus mercaderías y su material D. trabajo para poder rendir mejores ingresos y mejorar así su calidad D. vida. El grupo se encuentra cursando su segundo ciclo en la institución en la cual demostraron responsabilidad, cumplimiento y calidad humana, por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y como un grupo numerosa saben como salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
The "Bibosi" group is represented by Felicia and is maD. up of 22 members who work in different activities such as public transportation, office work, and sales of products such as cosmetics, bakery goods, food and seasonal products. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace, especially in sales, and the members of this group are no exception; they struggle in their different jobs to earn a daily wage to support their families and meet their different obligations. The proceeds of the loan granted by Fundación Agrocapital will be used to increase their inventories and their working materials so that they can be profitable and improve their standard of living. The group is in its second round with Fundación Agrocapital and has shown responsibility, compliance and camaraderie because they all have experience in groups and as a large group they have learned how to pull together.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Caroline E. is 29 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with one child, who is three years old.

Caroline has been running a stationary business since 2007. This micro-entrepreneur has demonstrated her business savvy by placing her stationary shops, stalls and tables strategically close to post offices, banks, schools and universities. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She is assisted by one employee. Caroline currently earns about $350 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $500 USD in order to buy stationary equipment. In the future, she plans to open a new stationary store. Caroline thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stationary equipment like paper, scanners, and printers

loans.name: Miriam Julia

texts.es: MIRIAM TIENE 3 HIJOS, UN VARON DE 19 AÑOS, UNA NIÑA DE 12 Y UN VARON DE 8AÑOS, VIVE EN ALQUILER, EN UN PEQUEÑO DEPARTAMENTO. EL ESPOSO TRABAJA JUNTO A ELLA EN SU TALLER DE CONFECCION. MIRIAM SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE JEANS, TIENE UN TALLER CON VARIAS MAQUINAS Y REALIZA LA CONFECCION DESDE EL CORTADO HASTA TERMINAR LA PRENDA, LA COMERCIALIZA EN EL MERCADO DE LA CANCHA. SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD HACE MUCHOS AÑOS. TIENE COMPETENCIA EN SU RUBRO PERO DEBIDO A SU EXPERIENCIA ELLA TIENE MERCADO ASEGURADO, TIENE BASTANTE CALIDAD EN SUS PRENDAS POR LO QUE ELLA PREFIRE CONFECCIONAR LA PRENDA HASTA SU ACABADO. MIRIAM COMPRARA ROLLOS DE TELA PARA PRODUCIR SUS PROPIOS MODELOS Y VENDERLOS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CANCHA. EL ROLLO DE TELA CUESTA 300 $. MIRIAM TAMBIÉN TRABAJA CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS. ES MUY BUENA CLIENTE EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION NO TIENE MALOS ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS.
texts.en:
Miriam has 3 children, a 19-year old boy, a 12-year old girl, and an 8-year old boy. She lives in a small rented apartment. Her husband works with her in her clothing workshop. Miriam works sewing jeans and her workshop has various machines. She makes the jeans from cutting the fabric in the beginning until the jeans are finished. She sells them in the Mercado de la Cancha (The Field Market), where she has sold them for many years. She is very competent in her field, and due to her experience, she has a secure market. Her jeans are high quality because she prefers to sew them herself from beginning to end. Miriam buys rolls of fabric in the Mercado de la Cancha. Each roll of fabric costs $300. Miriam also works with other lending institutions. She is a very good client of Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, and does not have any negative credit history with them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Elizabeth R. is 33 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with three children, who are between the ages of 4 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan.

Elizabeth runs a tailoring business. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, primarily for women. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week. Elizabeth currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy one tailoring machine, and more materials for making clothes. In the future, she plans to open another store. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy one tailoring machine, and materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Carolina Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "CAROLINA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA CINTHIA PAOLA Y CONFORMAN 13 SOCIAS DE LAS CUALES 11 SON MUJERES Y 2 HOMBRES, TODAS ELLAS SE CONOCEN ENTRE SI YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO, EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES COMO LA VENTA DE ROPA, ABARROTES EN TIENDAS DE BARRIO, VENTA DE COMIDA AMBULANTE, A LA ELABORACIÓN DE PAN, AL SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA Y A LA VENTA DE LICORES. DENTRO DEL RUBRO COMERCIAL EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA POR LO QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE QUE BUSCAR MODOS DIFERENTES PARA PODER VENDER SU MERCADERÍA Y LOGRA UN MEJOR INGRESO PARA EL SUSTENTO DE SUS FAMILIAS. EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO DE MERCARÍA E INSUMOS PARA PODER COMPETIR EN EL MERCADO COMERCIAL. LOS SOCIOS (AS) TRABAJARON ANTES CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO Y LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE EN CADA FINANCIAMIENTO.
texts.en:
The Carolina Group is represented by Cinthia Paola and consists of 13 members, 11 women and 2 men. They all know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. Most of them make their income from commercial activities such as clothing sales, a neighborhood grocery store, food sold by a street vendor, bread making, a cleaning service, and liquor sales. There are a lot of competent people in these fields, so the members have to find different ways to sell merchandise and earn a better income to support their families. This loan from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital will be used to buy merchandise and ingredients to compete in the commercial market. The members have worked with supportive groups before, so they know about the work and responsibilities necessary for each loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Carmenn Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO EL CARMENN  ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA ROSEMARY QUIEN ES MIEMBRO DE UN GRUPO CONFORMADO DE 12 SOCIOS (AS) LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES COMO  A LA VENTA DE COMIDA, ROPA, POLLO Y ALGUNOS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA PANADERÍA A LA EDUCACIÓN PÚBLICA Y AL SERVICIO DE COCINA. DENTRO DEL ÁMBITO COMERCIAL Y DE PRESTACIÓN DE SERVICIOS EXISTE UNA GRAN COMPETENCIA PERO LA EXPERIENCIA Y EL MOVIMIENTO DE MERCADERÍA HACE QUE LOS (AS) SOCIOS (AS) SALGAN ADELANTE SIN PROBLEMAS. LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ESTÁN DESTINADOS AL INCREMENTO DE MERCADERÍA Y PARA ALGUNOS A LA REPARACIÓN DE SUS MATERIALES DE TRABAJO. DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTE GENTE CON EXPERIENCIA EN EL TRABAJO DE GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN EL MODO DE TRABAJO DE LA INSTITUCIÓN DEMOSTRANDO EN ANTERIORES GRUPOS RESPONSABILIDAD EN LOS PAGOS, LOS SOCIOS ANTIGUOS SE ENCARGARAN DE IMPULSAR A LOS SOCIOS NUEVOS DEL GRUPO A SEGUIR ADELANTE CON RESPONSABILIDAD Y CUMPLIMIENTO.
texts.en:
The Carmenn Group, which is made up of 12 members, is represented by Rosemery. The members work in different commercial activities such as food sales, clothing sales, chicken sales, and some work at a bakery, a public school, or in a kitchen. Within the commercial and services fields there is a lot of competition but the experience and the movement of the market lets the members get ahead without problems. The funds lent by Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital will be used to buy merchandise and repair work materials. There are some group members who have experience working with supportive groups, so they know how the institutions work and have demonstrated responsible repayment in previous groups. The older members are in charge of motivating the newer members to keep moving forward in their fulfillment of their responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Anna M. is 49 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 19 years old.

Anna M. has been running a cosmetics business since 2005. She sells many different types of cosmetics, like body lotions, powders, perfumes and "super black." She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Anna M. currently earns about $380 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more cosmetics to sell. In the future she plans to add more cosmetics to her business to sell. Anna M. thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
MARIO TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERO, TIENE 2 HIJOS DE 25 Y 23 AÑOS DE EDAD. 
LA VIVIENDA EN LA QUE HABITA ACTUALMENTE ES ALQUILADA.                                                                                          DEBIDO A QUE EL SECTOR DE LA CONSTRUCCION ESTA EN CONSTANTE CRECIMIENTO EXISTEN MUCHAS PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD,PERO AUN ASI ES BAJA LA OFERTA DE MANO DE OBRA EN ESTE SECTOR. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE UNA MAQUINA MEZCLADORA. DE ACUERDO A INFORMES DE INFOCRED EL SR.MARIO PRESENTA UN BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO; EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION ES EL SEGUNDO CRÉDITO AL QUE ACCEDIÓ, MOSTRANDO EN EL PRIMERO UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old, single, and has two children ages 25 and 23. He currently lives in a rented home. Due to the fact that the construction industry is constantly growing, there are a lot of people who work in construction. Despite the growth, the wages of a manual laborer are still low. This loan will be used to buy a mixing machine. According to Infocred reports, Mario has a good credit history. This is the second loan that he has taken out from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, and he demonstrated excellent repayment with his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mixing machine

loans.name: Derling Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Darling Mercedes G. se dedica a su negocio de venta de agua y gaseosas en la ciudad de León específicamente en el mercado La Terminal donde ha laborado desde hace cuatro años.

La razón por la cual la señora Darling ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las gaseosas, los jugos y el agua y por este motivo ella espera en Ceprodel para continuar con su actividad y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling Mercedes Garcia has a business selling water and soda in the city of Leon, specifically in the “La Terminal” market where she has worked the last four years. The reason that Darling has gone to Ceprodel is to get a loan that will allow her to buy soda, juice, and water and she hopes that through Ceprodel she can continue this activity and succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda and water

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería el cual la ha logrado mejorar a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo. Ella se dedica con gran esfuerzo a esta actividad y para ello ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su puesto.  

La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería porque le urge tenerlos de inmediato y por esta razón ella confía  en que obtendrá el crédito y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza del Socorro Lopez sells various products in her own shop, which has improved over time. She has devoted a lot effort to this activity and has succeeded in improving the conditions of her store. The reason that she went to Ceprodel is to get a loan to buy products for her store because she needs them immediately. She trusts that she will get the loan and thus succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Jane M. is 38 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants whose parents cannot care for them.

Jane has been running a stationary business since 2003. She has demonstrated her business savvy by placing her stationary shops, stalls and tables strategically close to post offices, bookstores, schools and universities. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is assisted by one employee. Jane currently earns about $300 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy stationary equipment like a scanner, computers and a printer. In the future, she plans to open a new stationary store. Jane thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stationary equipment like a scanner, computers and a printer

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra  R. con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de venta de agua, jugos y bebidas en el mercado la terminal de la ciudad de León donde diariamente comercializa estos productos en conjunto con algunas verduras y frutas como lo son tomates y bananos pero en menores cantidades.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por el motivo de que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su negocio el cual le es de mucho beneficio salir adelante en este y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
With much effort and dedication Mrs. Isidra R. has managed to move ahead in her business of selling water, juice, and drinks at the La Terminal market in the city of Leon where each day she markets these products along with some vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes and bananas but in smaller quantities. Now she is seeking the support of Ceprodel since she hopes that her loan will be approved so she can continue with her business. The loan is of great benefit to her to move ahead in the business and so continue with the maintenance of her home which requires so much of her support.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase water and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Liku

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Liku M. is 31 years old and she is from Mwanza. She is single. She is responsible for supporting one dependant whose parents cannot care for her.

Liku has been running a poultry (kuku) business. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. (Kuku means chicken in Swahili.) Raising chickens to sell is popular for a number of reasons. First, it requires little start-up capital. You can start with one or two chickens and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, the chickens require little space, so you can let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while the chickens grow, they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten. Liku has been in business since 2006 and her business has been doing well.

She works at her business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week. She is assisted by two employees. Liku currently earns about $300 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to continue with her poultry business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Liku M. thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To continue with her poultry business

loans.name: Josefa De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Josefa U. se dedica a su actividad de venta de verduras las que son vendidas con mucho éxito por ella misma todos los días con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia y llevar el sustento y el pan a su mesa.

La situación actual que ella atraviesa es que a su alrededor existen muchos competidores y por esto ella decidió solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel para dar lugar a la compra de las verduras y así continuar ofreciéndolas a sus fieles clientes en su sector.
texts.en:
In the La Terminal market in the city of León, Mrs. Josefa U. works selling vegetables which she herself markets with great success every day with the goal of benefiting her family and bringing food and bread to the table. The current situation she is going through is that there are many competitors around her. Because of that she decided to request a loan from Ceprodel to allow for the purchase of vegetables and so continue offering them to her loyal customers in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for resale

loans.name: Atukuzwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Atukuzwe Mbanga is 33 years old and she is from Mwanza. She is married with one child, who is eight months old.

Atukuzwe has been running a tailoring business since 2007. She purchases vitambaa, vitenge, and kanga (all types of materials) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is assisted by one employee.

Atukuzwe currently earns about $200 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase additional materials for her business. In the future, she plans to open another business. Atukuzwe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase materials such as kanga and vitenge

loans.name: Paula Emelina

texts.es:
En el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León, la señora Paula S. con mucha experiencia en el trabajo, se dedica a su actividad de pulpería vendiendo bolsas plásticas, papel higiénico, pastas dentales y algunas bebidas como las gaseosas el cual son comercializadas con gran esfuerzo con el propósito de mejorar su situación económica y llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de las bolsas plásticas y de las gaseosas para su respectiva comercialización y así de esta manera salir adelante en el negocio que es su único ingreso.
texts.en:
In the La Terminal market in the city of León, Mrs. Paula S., with much experience in the job, works in her store selling plastic bags, toilet paper, toothpaste, and some beverages such as soft drinks all of which are marketed with great energy with the goal of improving her economic situation and providing for her family.
