The reason she is applying to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan that allows her to purchase plastic bags and soft drinks for resale and in this way succeed in the business which is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic bags and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Halima S. is 33 years old and she is from Mwanza. She is married with three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 13 years old.

Halima has been running a clothing business since 2007. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Halima currently earns about $250 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Halima thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Arnulfo Nicolás

texts.es:
El Señor Arnulfo Nicolás M. Chávez tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casado, Este Señor tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tiene las siguientes edades su hijo mayor de 30 años y trabaja por cuenta propia, su otro hijo de 27 años de edad es un profesional y trabaja por cuenta propia, su hijo de 23 años y su hijo menor de 23 años de edad, su compañera de vida labora como ama de casa, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo para poder mantenerse con este trabajo, sus deseos son de obtener otra unidad para trabajar y no solo adquirir los ingresos de lo que el gana con su taxi ya que con este otro podría tener un respaldo de ingreso.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es taxista, el tiempo que tiene poseer su negocio es de 9 años, el inicia este negocio por la necesitaba un trabajo que le proporcionara ingresos ya que tenia una familia que mantener y decide ingresar al negocio de manejar un taxi al principio no conocía muy bien león por lo que esto era necesario para llevar a los pasajeros al destino que ellos pedían y fue así como logro  adaptarse a esta nueva vida y adquiere la experiencia en este campo por lo que hoy en día hay mucha competencia  en este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que invertir en su unidad de transporte ya que tiene que proporcionarle las debidas mejorías como lo es llantas, frenos y otros por lo que este le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnulfo Nicolás M. Chavez is 51 years old and is married. This gentleman has four children who have the following ages: his oldest son is 30 and works for himself; his other son is 27, is a profesional, and works for himself; another son is 23 and his youngest son is also 23. His life companion works as a homemaker. His plans are to maintain his active business in order to provide for himself with this work. His goals are to obtain another vehicle for working and not only have the income which he earns from his taxi, but with this other one he would be able to have additional income. The economic activity in which he works is taxi driver. He has had this business for nine years. He started the business out of the need for a job that would provide him income since he had a family to support and decided to go into the business of driving a taxi. In the beginning he did not know León city very well, which was necessary to take the pasengers to the destination they requested. But he was able to adapt to the new life and acquire experience in this field. Since there is a lot of competition in the business these days, the financing is for working capital he needs to invest in his transport vehicle, since he has to make needed improvements like tires, brakes, and other things that will help him provide better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: VICENTE ES UN SEÑOR DE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, SU FAMILIA SE CONSTITYE DE TRES MIEMBROS, ÉL SU ESPOSA Y SU HIJO. EL SR. VICENTE R. OÑA TIENE BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN EL SECTOR DE TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS (MOTOTAXI), TAMBIEN DESARROLLA SUS ACTIVIDADES COMO ALBAÑIL. LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA DEBIDO A QUE EXISTEN UN NUMERO CONSIDERABLE DE MOTOTAXISTAS Y DE ALBAÑILES PERO POR OTRA PARTE TAMBIEN EXISTE MUCHA DEMANDA PARA LOS ALBAÑILES DEBIDO AL CRECIMIENTO DE SECTOR CONTRUCCION. EL PRESENTE CREDITO ES PARA LA REFACCION DE VIVIENDA. CLIENTE CON MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO MANTIENE CERO DIAS DE MORA EN SU ANTERIOR OPERACION.
texts.en:
Vicente is a 31-year old man, and there are three members of his family, himself, his wife and his son. Mr. Vicente R. Oña has a lot of experience transporting passengers (by mototaxi), and also works as a bricklayer. There is a lot of competition because there are a large number of mototaxi drivers and bricklayers, but at the same time there is also a lot of demand for bricklayers because of the growth of the construction industry. This loan will be used to repair his house. He has a very good credit history and never made a late payment on his previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair home

loans.name: Gloria Ernestina

texts.es:
La pequeña Empresaria de Nombre Gloria Ernestina R. D. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Gloria tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 4 años cursa el 2 nivel de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como farmacéutico, los propósitos son de mantener su negocio ya que este es el que le da el sustento de diario por lo que con este pequeño negocio es que ha podido saciar las necesidades de sus hijos sus sueños son de que en el futuro comprar su casa propia para dejarle a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir y sea de su propiedad es por eso que en la casa que habita actualmente no es de su propiedad y debido a su necesidad tiene que alquilar sus deseos son de establecer una tienda donde ofrezca una variedad de mercadería y poder dejarle a sus hijos un negocio para que ellos puedan subsistir para el día de mañana por lo que tiene que trabajar fuertemente para darle mejores condiciones de vida a toda su familia.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería donde ofrece los productos como: golosinas, pasta de dientes, cremas, gelatina  entre otras cosas, la ubicación de su negocio es en la colonia Avellán, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un medio de trabajo y una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos y el pago de diferentes deudas y al principio tenia un trabajo estable pero debido a la situación tuvieron que despedirla y fue entonces que decide buscar un medio de ingresos y fue por iniciativa propia que decide establecer un negocio lo cual fue una pulpería y comenzó con pocos productos como: jabón y golosinas y poco a poco fue aumentando su materia prima pero todavía necesita aun mas es por eso el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes de niño y niña ya que se acerca la entrada de clases y quiere aprovechar las nesesidaes de los clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Ernestina R. D. a 36-years-old businesswoman; she is married and has two sons. Her 16-year-old son is currently in his second year of high school and her 4-year-old son is in level 2 of his elementary education. Her partner works as a pharmacist.

The intentions for her loan are to maintain her business, which is now what gives her daily support. This small business has been able to fulfill the necessities of her son and the family’s future dreams are to own their own home and property in order to give their sons a place to live. The house where they currently live is not their own property and due to necessity she has to rent.

Gloria wishes to establish a store where she offers a variety of merchandise and wishes to leave the business to her sons in the future. She works very hard to give her family a better life.

Her business is a local store where she offers products such as: candies, toothpaste, creams and gelatin among other things. The location of her business is in the Avellán district and she has been running her business for 3 years. She began the business out of necessity for work to support her sons and to pay different debts. In the beginning she had a stable job but due to her situation she had to leave it. It was then that she decided to search for a new mode of income and it was by her own initiative that she decided to establish her store. She began with few products such as soap and candies. Little by little she has increased her product offerings but still she needs more. For that reason she asks for this loan for the purchase of school supplies and boy’s and girl’s uniforms now that the beginning of school is approaching and she wants to take advantage of the necessities of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Petrona Virginia

texts.es:
La Señora petrona Virginia E. Hernández tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es viuda, Doña Virginia tiene 2 hijas a su cargo su hija mayor tiene la edad 25 años y estudia la carrera de medicina ya que su hija tuvo que estudiar mucho para clasificar en esta carrera y su otra hija de 22 años y estudia licenciatura en sistema, sus propósitos son de mantener su línea de crédito a pesar de lo difícil de esta situación ya que estas micro financieras son un  medio de ayuda para todo aquel que tenga la voluntad e salir adelante sus deseos son que sus hijos mantengan la actividad de su negocio ya que en esta situación es muy difícil mantener este tipo de negocio por lo que hay mucha competencia sus sueños son que sus hijas logren coronar su carrera para ejercer lo que conocimientos obtenidos en sus estudios.

La actividad económica  de Doña Petrona es una pulpería donde ofrece los productos de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, sopas y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación del colegio INO ½ al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 29 años, ella inicia con otro tipo de negocio como lo es la venta de frutas, leche y leña y a pesar de las dificultades por la que ha pasado entonces impulsada por la necesidad de dar el sustento de sus hijos por lo que decide establecer un negocio en sus casa de habitación y fue con lo mas poco que logro empezar por lo que debido a todas las circunstancias que sucedieron en su vida como fue la perdida de su esposo por lo que mas tarde decide recurrir a Fundación León 2000 como medio de ayuda para trabajar con su pulpería por lo que decide invertir mas sus productos es por eso el motivo del financiamiento para capital de trabajosa que tiene que realizar los productos como: jabón, azúcar, golosinas y mas granos básicos por lo que agradece la mano ayuda que le ayudara para cumplir sus obejetivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Virginia E. Hernández is 52 years old and is widowed. Mrs. E. Hernández has two daughters in her care; the oldest is 25 years old and studies medicine; she had to study a lot to be successful. Her other daughter who is 22 years old is studying for her degree.

Mrs. E. Hernández intends to maintain her line of credit despite the difficulty of her situation. You, the micro-financier are a means of help through your kindness; granting her wish of maintaining her business which is very difficult to due to the competition from similar businesses. She also wishes that her daughters reach the top levels of their careers and exercise the knowledge that they have obtained during their studies.

The business is a local store where she offers products such as: basic grains, candies, natural drinks and soups among other things. The location of her business is in her home. She has been running her business for 29 years. She began her business career with the sale of fruit, milk and firewood but had to change her business due to difficulties such as the loss of her husband in order to provide for her children. Recently she has decided to turn to Fundación León 2000 for help in improving her store. She will invest the loan in products such as: soap, sugar, candies and more basic grains. She appreciates the helping hand, as you will be helping her to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es:
La Emprendedora Señora de nombre Imelda Pastora Alarcón tiene la edad de 50 años, sus estado civil casada, Doña Imelda tiene 3 niñas sus edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 26 años trabaja por cuenta propia su otra hija de 23 años cursa el 4 año de su carrera y su hija menor de 20 años cursa el 3 año de su carrera, su esposo labora como maestro de obras, sus propósitos son generar lo suficientes ingresos para seguir manteniendo su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos sus deseos son de que sus hijas tengan un futuro asegurado en donde ellas puedan salir adelante ante cualquier situación que se les presente sus sueños son tener salud para ver el logro de que sus hijas coronen sus carreras además en sus sueños esta dejarle una vivienda para que puedan tener un techo donde vivan dignamente.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería en la que ofrece productos como: cuadernos, lápices, borradores, lapiceros, cartulinas, la ubicación de su negocio es en telica, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de obtener otra fuente de ingresos que le ayude a ella y a sus hijas a darle un mejor vivir y contar con el sustento diario cuando inicia este negocio fue con capital propio y con una pequeña cantidad y empezó colocando cosas pequeñas como reglas, bolsos y marcadores pero solo con estas cosas no logro satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes por lo que mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para realizar todas las compras necesarias pero debido al nuevo auge de la entrada a clases es por eso que necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que estará destinado para la compra de mas útiles escolares por lo que hoy en día recibe pedidos y así saca mejor provecho de sus productos.
texts.en:
The businesswoman Mrs. Imelda Pastora Alarcón is 50-years-old, married and has 3 daughters. Her eldest daughter is 26-years-old and self-employed. Her 23-year-old daughter is in her fourth year of her studies and her youngest daughter who is 20-years old is in her third year of studies. Her husband works as a construction worker.

Her intentions are to generate sufficient income in order to continue maintaining her business, which is now her primary source of income. Her hopes are that her daughters will have a secure future in which they can overcome whatever situation they are presented with. She also wishes to have good health in order to see the success of her daughters in their careers. Additionally she wishes to leave them with housing where they can live with dignity.

Mrs. Pastora Alarcón runs a bookstore where she offers products such as: notebooks, pencils, erasers, pens and cards. Her business is located in Telica and she has run the business for 10 years. She began her business in order to have another source of income, which helped her and her daughters to have a better life and security. When she began her business it was with her own small amount of capital that she invested in small things such as rulers, bags and markers but with only these things she could not satisfy the demand of her customers. Recently she has decided that a loan would help her to make all of the necessary purchases of school supplies for the peak time in sales and take advantage of the need for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Betzabé

texts.es: Betzabé tiene 27 años y vive con su esposo. Desde hace más de 10 años trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de carteras y accesorios diversos de vestir, de acuerdo a la temporada. Reparte sus prendas a sus amistades más cercanas que trabajan de manera estable. Inició este negocio movida por la necesidad económica de cubrir sus necesidades, como los gastos de su hijo que está por nacer. Es la quinta vez que Betzabé solicita un crédito con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión, solicita este dinero para la compra de más mercadería para sus ventas de fin de año y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Betzabé is 27 years old and lives with her husband. For more than 10 years she has been working independently selling bags and various clothing accessories according to the season. She distributes her merchandise to her closest friends who have stable work. She began this business because of her economic need and in order to pay for her necessities, like the expenses of the birth of her son. It is the fifth time that Betzabé has requested a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she has demonstrated that she is punctual in her payments. On this occasion, she requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her year end sales and the new year.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pillars to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fuel for an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fishnets.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hùy năm nay 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1994Gia đình chị có ba người con đều đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang chăn nuôi, trồng và kinh daonh cây cảnh tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hùy  mong muốn được vay 16.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và kinh doanh cây cảnh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hùy, 50 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1994. She has three grown children. Currently, in addition to raising animals, she and her husband grow and sell ornamental potted plants from their home. This is the main source of earnings for the family, whose total income is about 5,000,000 VND (289 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Hùy hopes to borrow 16,000,000 VND (925 USD) to invest in raising animals and their ornamental plant business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ornamental plants and raising animals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Năm  37 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Khi mới tham gia Quỹ nguồn thu nhập của gia đình chị năm chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị Năm còn đi thu mua đỗ, lạc của bà con để bán lại cho người tiêu dùng, còn chồng chị đi làm thuê . Với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Năm đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị Năm mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc thu mua đỗ, lạc...
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Năm, 37 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2000. When she first joined the Fund, her family depended on raising animals and growing crops for their income. Today, in addition to raising animals, Mrs. Năm also buys beans and peanuts in bulk from local farmers and sells them to consumers, and her husband works as a hired laborer. With their current income of about 3,500,000 VND per month, the financial condition of her family is steadily becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Năm hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest in her business selling beans and peanuts.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bean and peanut sales

loans.name: Xuan

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Xuân  48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 16 năm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Xuân gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng mất sớm, các con còn nhỏ. Đến nay sau 16 năm tham gia Quỹ, được vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện tại với việc trồng trọt và chăn nuôi 150 con gà, 10 con lợn và sự hỗ trợ của các con đã trưởng thành hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Xuân mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua con giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Xuan is 48 years old, and has been with TYM fund for 16 years. Before joining the fund, the economic situation of her family was wrought with difficulties because her husband died young while her children were still small. After being in the fund for 16 years. she was able to borrow money to invest in raising animals, so her economic situation became more stable day by day. Currently with farming and raising 150 chickens, 10 pigs and the assistance of her now grown children, her family's monthly income averages 172 USD. For this next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy seeds and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Victoria O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Victoria M. is 27 years old and she is from Tukuyu. She is married with 3 children, who are between the ages of 3 and 10. Victoria has been running a business selling clothes and shoes since 2006. She sells them to her customers through her retail store.

She works at the business 4 hours per day, 2 days per week. Victoria currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase 200 pairs of shoes and 100 pieces of cloth for her business. In the future, she plans to open another store and increase the quantity and range of inventory that she sells. Victoria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ly

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng Lý năm nay 27 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn Hà Nội. Hiện nay chị Lý đang là chủ cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa còn chồng chị là thợ lắp đặt điện nước. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn làm dịch vụ rửa xe nên thu nhập của gia đình hàng tháng rất ổn định( 4.000.000đ/ tháng) Vòng vốn tới chị Lý mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm dụng cụ phục vụ cho việc phát triển dịch vụ rửa xe.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hong Ly is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and 1 small child in the district of Soc Son, Ha Noi. She is the owner of a grocery store while her husband installs electricity and water. In addition, she also has a business washing vehicles and thus her family's income is very stable (234 USD per month). For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to buy additional supplies to expand her car wash business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Maria E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Maria M. from Mbeya. She is married with three children, between the ages of 9 and 13. Maria has been running a "kuku" business since 2004. Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about "kuku".

Who or what are "kuku", you may ask. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising "kuku" is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

Maria works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Maria currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 450 USD in order to purchase more chickens ("kuku") for re-selling. In the future, she plans to open another business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens (kuku) for re-selling

loans.name: Husna S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Husna O. from Mbeya. She is married with four children, between the ages of 5 and 13. Husna has been running a salon since 2005. This is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

Husna works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Husna currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 700 USD in order to purchase salon facilities. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Husna thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase salon facilities

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Рахима Дехконова женщина 36 лет , портниха на дому имеет троих детей.Муж Рахимы на заработках в России.Она сама также занимается откормом и продажей скота.В основном Рахима откармливает скот а продаёт у неё её брат ,т.к. это мужская работа.Пока скот дешёвый Рахима хочет закупить пару больших дойных коров.Чтоб иметь своё молоко. У Рахимы есть свои постоянные клиенты по пошиву платьев.
Рахима когда начинала кредитную историю имела всего одну корову , а на сегодняшний день у неё две коровы и пять баранов.Она благодарит инвесторов за такую возможность для расширения бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Rahima is a 36-year-old woman with three children. She works out of her home as a dressmaker. Rahima's husband has gone to work in Russia. As a sideline, she also fattens and sells cattle. Usually Rahima feeds the cattle for the market that belong to her brother, because that is man's work, but while the price of cattle is down, Rahima wants to purchase two large dairy cows of her own for the milk. Rahima has regular customers for her dressmaking business. At the time of her first loan, Rahima only had one cow, but today she has two cows and five sheep. She is grateful to the investors for the opportunity to expand her livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en: S. Nuriniso applied to MicroInvest for the first time in 2008 when she asked for a business development loan to open a trade outlet. Today she trades in the local bazaar in the new trade outlet for mens wear. Nuriniso has been engaged in business for 10 years and she is a skilled trader. Nuriniso brings her wares for herself from Uzbekistan and Istaravshan. She has good taste so a lot of repeat customers come to buy her assortment. Nuriniso applies the KIVA to ask the financial support of her existing business with a the loan of 1400 STJ for 1 month to import seasonal wear. Nuriniso thanks KIVA for its support of the low-income entrepreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: to import seasonal wear

loans.name: Neem A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!  This is 29 years old Neem M. from Tukuyu.  She is married with three children between the ages of three and 10 years old.  

Neem has been running a genge business since 2005.  The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge.  A genge is a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish.  It is the kind of place local people send their children to fetch ingredients when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and do not have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, seven days per week.  Neem currently earns about $60 USD a month from her business.  She is requesting a loan of $ 400 USD in order to purchase sugar, rice and soaps in bulk.  Neem thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and soaps in bulk

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak S. has been a client of our program since 2006, and she describes herself as a very serious borrower.  She has never delayed repayments and makes them regularly and accurately.  Muborak works in the commercial service and trade industry; she specifically trades underwear and children wear.  She works together with her son who sells in Kyrgyzstan and Istaravshan.  

Muborak is married with three children; the oldest son helps her in business.  Mrs. S. Muborak asks Kiva lenders for the financial support of her business, and she asks for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for eight months.  The loan will increase her assortment of clothing articles, especially new seasonal wares.  She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: Assortment of clothing articles and new seasonal wares

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru: Туйчи закончив свой кредит решил получить очередной займ для покупки баранов.Сам Туйчи по специальности строитель.Но в зимнее время года он занимается только откормом и продажей скота.С чего у него и продвигается жизнь.при мониторинге мы убедились что кредит пошёл ему в пользу, у него увеличилось количество скота.
texts.en:
After paying off a previous loan, Tuychi resolved to take out another loan for the purchase of sheep. By trade, Tuychi is a builder, but in wintertime he only raises livestock for market, and he is able to get by on that. When we visited, we saw that the loan had been of assistance to him, that he had increased the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Сattle

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra T. has been applying for loans from MicroInvest since 2004 when she started her business in street small wares.  She started practically from scratch, but today, she has her own department selling food products.  She opened the department in the first floor of her own house.  She sells drinks, cakes, tea, sugar and vegetable oil.  She dreams of having her own mini-market where she can trade big-scale assortments.  

Gulchehra asks Kiva to support her existing business; she requests a loan for 3000 STJ over eight months to increase business assortment.  She hopes for her business turnover to increase.  She thanks Kiva lenders for their support and wishes all the best for the people who help low-income entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Buhorimo

texts.ru: Шарипова Бухоримо проживает в районе Вахш. озраст 36 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Работает в торговле уже 10 лет. Торгует одеждой на центральном рынке района. Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.  Несмотря на то, что ее семья не очень большая , она очень много работает так , как хочет дать детям хорошее образование. И если она сможет увеличить свой бизнес , ей удасться достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Buhorimo S. lives in Vahsh region. She is 36, married, and has two children. Buhorimo graduated high school and has been working in sales for 10 years. She has been selling clothing at the central market of the region. To increase the volume of goods sold, Buhorimo S. plans to receive a 10-months loan. In spite of having a relatively small family, Buhorimo S. works very hard to give her children a good education. If she is able to grow her business, Buhorimo will succeed in achieving her goals.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Хасанова Дильбар жительница Вахшского района. Работает на рынке района , где торгует одеждой. Работает в сфере бизнеса уже два года. Бизнес развивается неплохо , полэтому она решила увеличить товаооборот , путем получения кредита . Это поможет ей обеспечивать своих детей , так как она разведена и является кормильцем двоих детей. Кредит планирует погашать в теченгие 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar KH. lives in Vakhsh region. She sells clothing at a regional market. Dilbar has been in business for two years. She is doing well, so Dilbar decided to finance a business expansion. This loan will help Dilbar to provide for her children as she is a single mother of two. Dilbar KH. plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Saodathon

texts.en:
Saodathon N. has been a MicroInvest client since 2008.  Thanks to previous loans, she was able to open a trade outlet to sell food products.  She is an executive client, so she has never delayed a loan repayment.  Saodathon is taking the next loan step, and today, she asks Kiva for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for six months.  She will use the loan to increase her product assortment.  

Saodathon also works at the creative club, Marhamat, where she teaches children national dances.  She is not married and lives with her mother.  She brings her assortment of goods from Uzbekistan.  She trades vegetable oil, meat products (salami), milk products, sweets, tea and coffee, candy, drinks and national bread.  Saodathon thanks Kiva for its role in helping low-income entrepreneurs fight poverty through free loans for business development.

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Firpuz

texts.ru: Зайниддинов Фирпуз житель Вахшского района. Возраст 22 года, но несмотря на это имеет шестилетний стаж работы в сфере животноводства. Покупает молодых бычков  , откармливает их и затем продает на рынке. Весь процесс занимает около 50 дней . Бизнес дает неплохой доход, но сейчас в связи с зимой цены на животных упали и он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бычков подешевле , а весной он сможет их выгодно продать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firpuz Z. lives in the Vahshad region. He is 22 years old and despite a young age has six years experience in the animal husbandry. He buys young calves, feeds them and then resells on the market. All this process takes about 50 days. This business provides good income, and at this time due to winter the prices for cattle have fallen and he wants to get a loan to buy calves at a cheaper price. In the spring he will be able to sell them and make profit. He will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Erick's Group

texts.en:
K. Erick is the leader of his group in Mityana.  He is a very hardworking man and married with eight children.  He also cares for three other dependants.  Erick sells the produce that he grows, specifically matooke, maize, beans, cassava and sweet potatoes.  He sells his products as both a wholesaler and retailer.  He also buys from other farmers to increase the quantity that he can sell; he figures that the more he has, the more he will sell. 

On his plantations, he works hand-in-hand with his wife and his employees.  They work together to produce high quality food products quickly.  Erick would like to get another loan to help with his labor on the farm and buy more produce from other farmers.

loans.use: Labor (manpower) on his farm and buy more produce from other farmers to sell

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en:
Mamur U. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan that is famous for its warm wool sock-making and its livestock. Mamur is engaged in a service industry, working in a TV-repairing office. He repairs TVs and he is skilled in this sphere. Mamur has special education and he is a master with a good reputation.

Mamur is married and has one child. He is 27 years old and he has been in business for 5 years. His young wife makes the warm wool socks that he also sells in the Synday bazaar.

Mamur is asking KIVA for financial support of his existing business repairing TVs. He is requesting a loan of 1000 STJ for 4 months to purchase special equipment for his work.

loans.use: purchasing special equipment

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Асоев Мухаммад житель района Вахш. Возраст 38 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже десять лет , как он занимается торговлей. Имеет свой магазин .Торгует продуктами питания . овар привозит из города Душанбе , покупая его у оптовиков. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов , а так же увеличить прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhammad A. lives in the Vahshad region. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. It's been ten years since he started a retail business. He has his own store where he sells food. He brings the merchandise in from Dushanbe where he buys from wholesalers. He plans to get a loan to increase the variety of his inventory. This will help him attract new customers and increase his profits. He will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Tuhtasun

texts.en:
Tuhtasun K. lives in the Asht region and he is engaged in the flour business. He is married and has one child. Tuhtasun has been a MicroInvest client since 2008. Thanks to previous loans he was able to improve their existing business of flour-selling and to increase the flour volume so that it improved their business turnover.

Tuhtasun also works as a bus driver. He sells flour together with his father. He works with direct suppliers so he can sell at lower prices than the bazaar prices. His wife is a school teacher.

Tuthasun is applying for a KIVA business support loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months for opening an outlet in the specialized flour-selling trade.

loans.use: opening a flour-selling outlet

loans.name: Sylivia's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia M. is a very friendly person with a salon business called Mama Emmanuel’s Beauty Salon that is doing well since its inception 10 years. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. In her salon, she makes braids, does weaving, shampoo and set, retouch and all kinds of treatments and this diversification has helped her a lot in her business success.

Through being able to save, Sylivia has been able to buy a plot of land on which she plans to construct commercial houses. She has been able to educate her children and she hopes to take them much further in education. Sylivia plans to use her share of this loan to buy more braids, weave-ons, shampoos, and chemicals for her business.

loans.use: More braids, weave-ons, shampoos and chemicals for re-sale

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.ru: Асуев Абдурахмон житель Вахшского района. Живет в одном из самых дальних кишлаков района. Единственная сфера деятельности населения это животноводство. Поэтому и он , имея четверых детей занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство . Планируемый кредит , хочет использовать для того, чтобы закупить материал для ремонта коровника. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdurakhmon A. resides in the Vakhsh region, in one of the region's remotest villages. Animal husbandry is the only way the residents have of making a living. Since Abdurakhmon has four children, he raises livestock and has a small farm. He plans to use the loan he has requested to purchase materials to repair his cowshed. He will repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his cowshed

loans.name: Lien

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Liên  năm nay 45 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành . Năm 1996 chị Liên tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.  Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu rất ổn định từ việc đan hàng mây tre đan xuất khẩu với tổng thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Liên mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua con giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Thi Lien is 45 years old. Her family has 4 children and 3 are grown. In 1996 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in raising animals and farming. Currently, in addition to raising animals her family also has a very stable source of income from making rattan merchandise, bringing in average income of 200 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy additional animals and feed for her business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Lieu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Liệu 54 tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay công việc đem alị thu nhậpchính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và thu nhập từ cửa hàng sửa xe đạp của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

Vòng vốn tới chị Liệu mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua phụ tùng đầu tư cho công việc sửa chữa xe đạp của chồng, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Lieu is 54 years old. She joined TYM fund since 1995. She lives with her husband and 1 grown son. Currently her family's main source of income is from raising animals and her husband's bicycle repair shop at 230 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy accessories/spare parts for her husband's bicycle repair shop, and the remainder to buy feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.vi:
Chị N. Thi Xuyên  năm nay 48 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có 3 con đã trưởng thành . Năm 1995 chị Xuyên tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.  Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu rất ổn định từ việc đan hàng mây tre đan xuất khẩu của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm  với tổng thu nhập bình quân 4.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Xuyên mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua con giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Xuyen is 48 years old. Her family has 4 children and 3 of whom are grown. In 1995 Ms. Xuyen joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in raising animals and farming. Currently, in addition to raising animals, she also has another stable source of income from her husband's business of making rattan merchandise, as well as financial assistance from her children who are also employed. Total income for her family is 258 USD per month. For her next loan, Ms. Xuyen wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy additional animals and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Самадова Назира проживает в районе Вахш. Ей 40 лет и уже 5 лет она занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , которая нуждается в ремонте. Она планирует создать условия необходимые для работы. Для закупки материала и оплаты услуг она решила получить кредит сроком на 9 месяцев. Назира замужем и имеет троих детей.Муж на заработках в России , поэтому она одна обеспечивает семью.
texts.en:
Nazira S. resides in the Bakhsh region. She is 40 years old and for the past five years has been in trade. She has a retail outlet in the marketplace that is in need of upgrades. She plans to make improvements to her workplace, and has decided to take out a 9-month loan to pay for materials and labor. Nazira is married and has three children, but her husband is away working in Russia, so she is the sole support of her family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of shelving in her workplace

loans.name: Ngai

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Ngại 33 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện nay chị Ngại đang chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà còn chồng chị làm thợ xây. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với tổng thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Thi Ngai is 33 years old, and joined TYM fund since 2002. Currently Ms. Ngai raises pigs at home while her husband is a construction worker. These are their main sources of income totaling 233 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 700 USD to buy more pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi  57 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002.  Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ thu nhập của gia đình Lợi chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ nhờ có vốn vay gia đình chị đã  đầu tư làm vườn trồng rau màu vì thế kinh tế gia đình phát triển hơn với thu  nhập 3.500.000đ/ .Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua trâu về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 57 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Before joining the Fund, her family's main income sources were from raising livestock and growing rice. After joining the fund, with the loan received, her family changed to grow vegetables and therefore the family's economic situation has improved with an income of VND3,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND13,000,000 to renovate the barns and buy buffaloes to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the barns and buy buffaloes to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Nalin Pao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group of 17 members is located in Chamka village in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Nalin P. was elected the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables, but her field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Nalin P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seed, and a piglet for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 26-year-old widow and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. 

Ten members in this group will receive end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, vegetable seed, and a piglet.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002.  Hiện nay công việc đem lại  thu nhập chính cho gia đình  chị là từ trồng trọt, chăn nuôi lợn gà và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập  4.500.000đ/ tháng .Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 46 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Currently the main sources of income of her family is from farming, raising pigs and chickens, and wages for construction work of her husband, which brings a total income of VND4,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy sows and foods for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sows and foods for livestock

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Võ Thị Hà 43 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ chị chủ yếu làm may và buôn bán nhỏ. Sau khi được vay thêm vốn từ Quỹ tình thương chị đã đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh thêm các mặt hàng điện nước. Công việc kinh doanh hiện nay đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng chị còn có thêm lương hưu nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định.   Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hành và mở rộng kinh doanh..
texts.en:
Ms. Vo Thi H. is 43 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1999. Before joining the Fund, she was a tailor and petty trader. After receiving the loan from TYM Fund, she expanded her trade business to include electrical and water-supply supplies. The current business brings an income of VND3,000,000 per month to her family. Apart from this, she also receives pension, so the economic situation is very stable.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy more supplies and expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more supplies and expand the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Eam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in Chamka village in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Ny E. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. S. Rom, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. He now wants to expand his business, and so Mrs. Ny E. decided to ask for a loan to buy more containers for the palm juice. She is 52 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.  
	
Twelve members in this group will receive End-of-Term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy palm juice containers.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav owns a retail business located in Drogobych city. He sells jeans clothing at the city market from his kiosk - an old metal transport container. This is not very convenient for his clients, but safe enough to leave the inventory there. Yaroslav has been in this business for 10 years. He knows his clients and their tastes well and chooses the right inventory, so his business goes well. 

Yaroslav would like to get a loan of $375 to purchase more winter jeans to sell since this winter turned out to be quite cold. Yaroslav’s goal is to improve his business conditions – to build a nice little store at the same place where his metal container is located now.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hồ Thị Vân 43 tuổi,  chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ An.Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và nghề mộc sẵn có của chồng. Hàng tháng tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi, làm mộc đạt 4.500.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua gỗ đầu tư phát triển xưởng mộc của gia đình...
texts.en:
Mrs. Ho Thi V. is 43 years old, she lives with her husband and two small children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. In 2001, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock raising and in the existing furniture workshop of her husband. The total monthly income of her family from livestock raising and furniture workshop reaches VND4,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy woods for the furniture workshop of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy woods for the furniture workshop

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hồ Thị T. 23 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề bán thuốc bắc. Công việc của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua thêm một số vị thuốc phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ho Thi T. is 23 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she and her husband sells traditional medical herbs. The family's business is stable and produces an income of VND3,000,000 per month. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy additional herbs to serve the local community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy traditional medical herbs

loans.name: Mrs. Yalin Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group, which consists of 18 members, is located in Bér village in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Yalin U. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Muon Sophea, is a construction worker. Mrs. Yalin U. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a farmer, and the youngest attends the local school.     

Three members in this group will receive End-of-Term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term B. is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Dần 59 tuổi chồng chị mất sớm vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi 3 con khôn lớn. Năm 1998 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư voà chăn nuôi và làm bánh đa. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, bán bánh đa chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con đã trưởng thành nên cuộc sống đã được cải thiện hơn.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm một số nguyên liệu về sản xuất bánh đa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi D. is 59 years old. Her husband died early so she has to work hard to grow up the three children. In 1998, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and making rice dried pancakes. Currently, in addition to incomes from raising livestock and making rice dried pancakes, she also receives financial support of the grown-up children, so the quality of live has improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy additional supplies for making rice dried pancakes.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional supplies for making rice dried pancakes.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Тургунова Махбуба жительница района Джалоллидини Руми.Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей. Торгует одеждой на центральном рынке. Бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет. К нам за кредитом обратилась для того, чтобы использовать деньги в своем деле. Хочет увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит может в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba T. is a resident of the Jalollidini Rumi region. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is in trade, and for the past ten years has sold clothing at the central market. She turned to MLO Humo and Partners for a loan in order to use the money in her business. She would like to increase her turnover and to provide seasonal goods. She can repay the loan within nine months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Покупка сезонной одежды.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Bảy năm nay 34 tuổi, gia đìnhchị  có 4 con đều đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Qua các vòng vốn vay làm ăn hiệu quả hiện tại gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua được 1 chiếc xe công nông để phục vụ nhu cầu chở hàng của bà con địa phương. Thời gian tới chị dự định sẽ dầu tư vốn để đầu tư phát triển dịch vụ cho  thuê bát đĩa, phông màn … vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 11.000.000đ
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi B. is 34 years old. She has 4 children at school ages. In 2004, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. In previous loan cycles, she used the loans profitably, so her family purchased a vehicle to serve the needs for goods transportation in the local community. In the coming months, she plan to invest in rental services for gathering events, such as bows and plates rental, tablecloths and backdrops rental. Therefore, she wishes to borrow VND11,000,000 for this.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Soy Prok  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Bér village in KampO. Chhnang province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Chan Soy P. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup as a breakfast food to the villagers. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, but she does not have rice seed. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Chan Soy P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. 

Ten members in this group loans will receive End-of-Term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường năm nay 41 tuổi , chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Hiện tại công việc đem lại th unhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập  4.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình  chị Hường đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hường mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà, vịt và thức ăn phụcvụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 41, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2001. Her family’s income comes from raising poultry and her husband’s job as a construction worker. With a monthly income of about 4000000 VND, their life has been improved a lot. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND ($875) to buy more chickens, ducks and food to raise them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has two teenage children. She sells men's and women's clothes at the central market in Zaporozhye city. Nadiya has been in this business for 5 years. She has a very good location that brings many clients her way. A large assortment provides them with a good choice and increases her sales. Nadiya is a very warm and caring person. She treats her clients well and they come back.  

Nadiya is requesting a loan of $800 to increase the winter assortment. Cold winter this year brings more people to the market to buy warm clothing. Nadiya hopes to purchase more winter clothing so she can offer her clients what they need.

loans.use: to increase winter assortment of clothing

loans.name: Mr. Pech Kek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Chamka village in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and Mr. Pech K. is the village bank president. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to hold in inventory and re-sell later at a better price. His wife, Mrs. P. Phally, is a successful pig breeder and she wants to expand her business. Thus, Mr. Pech K. decided to request a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 42 years old and the father of three children who are enrolled in the local school.

All the members in this group loan will receive End-of-Term loans.  In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Ngọc  năm nay 38  tuổi , chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ thu nhập của gia đình chị  Ngọc chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi, làm vườn và lương thợ xây của chồng. Sau khi được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị Ngọc đã đầu tư cải tạo vườn đồi để trồng chanh. Nhờ việc  mở rộng dự án trồng trọt mà kinh tế của gia đình chị Ngọc  đang ngày càng ổn định hơn với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Ngọc mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà, vịt và một số giống cây ăn quả về trồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi N., aged 38, joined TYM Fund in 2005. Before joining TYM Fund, her family’s income mainly came from raising poultry, planting and the husband’s job as a construction worker. After becoming a member of TYM, she used the loans to grow lemons. Her family’s financial situation has been more stable as a result. The family’s income is about 35000000 VND per month. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 10000000 VND ($575) to buy more chickens, ducks and some seeds to grow.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết năm nay 53 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang buôn bán và làm dịch vụ máy say thịt cá tại chợ. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại  thu nhập chính cho cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư buôn bán .
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 53, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2005. Both she and her husband are selling meat in the farmer market, which is the family’s main source of income. Their monthly income is about 2000000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 9000000 VND ($525) to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mr. Sok Thong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group consists of 16 members in Trapang Krapue village in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sok T. was elected by the members to be the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice, but his field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and and the fuel needed to run an irrigation pump. His wife, Mrs. Huot Lis, is a mat maker. Mr. Sok T. is 58 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are construction workers while the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Bình  năm nay 45  tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và ba con tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Chị Bình tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2005. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là sản xuất bún và chăn nuôi. Hàng ngày chồng và các con chị  sản xuất bún tại nhà  còn chị đem sản phẩm đi bán cho các hàng ăn và bán lẻ tại chợ cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi B., aged 45, is living in Nghi Loc town, Nghe An Province with her husband and her three children. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 2005. The family’s source of income is from selling vermicelli and raising poultry. Her husband and her children make vermicelli at home, and then Mrs. B. sells it in the market and some restaurants. Their monthly income is 3000000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 10000000 VND ($575) to purchase ingredients for making vermicelli.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Yên  năm nay 40  tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 2 năm.Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị Yên luôn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn.Cùng với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và các con hiện tại công việc  buôn bán đang rất thuận lợi và là nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị Yên hiện nay với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi Y., aged 40, has been a member of TYM Fund for two years. For the past two years, she has been using all the loans from TYM to invest in her meat-selling business in the farmer market. With the help of her husband and children, the business has been going very well and is the family’s main source of income. Their monthly income is 2500000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 9000000 ($525) to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa NguY., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sharbel

texts.en: Sharbel is a 30-year-old married man with one baby, living in Zahleh in the Bekaa Valley. Owning a blacksmith shop for 5 years, Sharbel wants to expand his business in order to serve more customers. He wants to buy new machinery that would make him capable of diversifying his output; therefore, he is asking to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Buy new machinery

loans.name: Mrs. Phan But Village Bank Group

texts.en:
EleV. people in Trapang Krapue village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Phan B. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, B. her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to repair an irrigation pump. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to purchase fertilizer and fix the pump in order to water her field. Mrs. Phan B. is a 66-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the third is a construction worker.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and repair an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M.  năm nay 37  tuổi Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 2 năm. Hiện tại chị là chủ cửa hàng nhỏ chuyên kinh doanh nước uống giải khát tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An với  thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán .
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., aged 37, has been a member of TYM Fund for two years. She currently owns a small cafe shop in Nghi Loc town, Nghe An province, which brings about 2000000 VND per month for the family. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 9000000 VND ($525) to improve the quality of her cafe shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mrs. Savong Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank  groups consists of 17 members in Stueng village in Kandal province, Cambodia. The members plan to use their loan for various purposes. Mrs. Savong H. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. She sells vegetables in the village market. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Thean, is a construction worker and a fisherman, but he does not have enough fishnets to increase his catch. Thus, Mrs. Savong H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 48 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.            

Two members in this group loans will receive End-of-Term (EoT) loans and the rest will have monthly payment loans. In EoT loans, payment on principal is not required until the very end of the loan term but is allowed at any time that the borrower is able to make such a payment. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fishnets.

loans.name: Giang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Giang   năm nay 40  tuổi, chị đang ssóng cùng chồng và 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình htương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn và gà. Đến nay sau 4 năm tham gia  Quỹ  với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Giang đã  ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Giang Thi Ngo is a 40 years old woman. She is living with her husband and her three children in school age. In 2004, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to raise pigs and chickens. Now, the family’s income reaches 2,500,000 VND; their living condition has been much improved. Mrs. Ngo plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy breeding pigs and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa is a 54-year-old married woman with 6 children, living in Kitermaya-Al Chouf in Mount Lebanon. She opened her shop in 2005, and now she is serving her village in addition to the neighboring villages. Salwa wants to buy clothing at a very good price, so she can increase her profit; therefore she is asking for a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: Buy clothes in a good price

loans.name: Phuong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng    năm nay 27  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại thị trấn Quán Hành huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào của hàng ăn của gia đình. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh hàng ăn với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thực phẩm và một đồ dùng phục vụ cho công việc kinh daonh hàng ăn cảu gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong Thi N. is a 27 years old woman. She is living with her husband and three children in Quan Hanh town, Nghi Loc, Nghe An. In 2007, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to expand her family's street restaurant. At the moment, the couple only focus on this business, which generates income of 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy more food and some kitchen equipments.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food service

loans.name: Mrs. La Noun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Anlong Romeit Thbong village in Kandal province have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. La N. is the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Chan S. Mean, is employed in a garment factory and he earns a small salary to support his family. In order to increase the family income and improve their living conditions, Mrs. La N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 24 years old and the mother of a 1-year-old child.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Joyce L. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children aged 10 and 14. Joyce has been running a clothes business since 2006. Her business is to purchase clothes wholesale and sell them retail. She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Joyce currently earns about 400 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 775 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing. She plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. Joyce thanks you for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing

loans.name: Amirjon

texts.en:
Amirjon A. applied to MicroInvest for the first time in 2006 and since that time he has been an active client of our program. Amirjon trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and he is a reliable client. He started the business from scratch but today he has an outlet and business selling fabric.

Amirjon lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. He is a young father who works hard to ensure a good future for his children. Amirjon works with direct suppliers and sometimes he goes to buy goods to Uzbekistan. He has been in this business for 6 years. Mr. Amirjon A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 9 months to import popular fabrics to increase his business turnover.

loans.use: to import popular fabrics for re-sale

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary S. is a villager who lives in Kampong Por village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His field, however, is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Sary S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and purchase fuel for his irrigation pump.
