His wife, Mrs. Yem Sokha, helps him in the plantation. Mr. Sary S. is 55 years old and the father of two children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mr. Sokhon K. is a farmer in Kampong Por village in Kandal province, Cambodia. It is now the dry season and so he wants to cultivate rice, but he does not have enough money to buy rice seed. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Sokhon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Chhuon Sokung, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Sokhon K. is 27 years old and the father of two children, one of whom attends the local school while the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophia T.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Sophia M. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children, between the ages of 16 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Sophia has been running a clothing business since 2000. She purchases clothes wholesale and sells them on a retail basis.She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Sophia currently earns about 300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn S. is a villager in Kampong Por village in Kandal province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns 1.6 hectares of land that is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Thorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Phoung Phai, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Thorn S. is 46 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Osioda - 1 Group

texts.en:
Immaculate O. (center) is 34 years old. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling wheat in Kumi. Her customers are mainly local brewers who use the wheat to make ajong (a local brew). The proceeds from this loan will enable Immaculate to purchase more sacks of wheat to meet increased demand from her customers.

Immaculate dreams of opening a shop outlet in town because at the moment, she transacts her business at her residence. She hopes to see her three children go through all levels of education.

The other members of her group will use the loan to expand their businesses selling fish, mulokoni (a local delicacy), groundnuts, and poultry.

loans.use: Purchase more sacks of wheat

loans.name: Sal

texts.en: Mrs. Sal B. is a farmer who owns 0.6-hectare of land to cultivate rice in Trapaing Lvea village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Morn Chhum, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Although they work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. To improve their situation, Mrs. Sal B. decided to ask for a loan to buy timber to build a house for the family. Her husband is presented on the left of photo.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Zein Alabidine

texts.en: Zein Alabidine is a 29-year-old married man with 2 small children, living in Al Housh-Tyre, southern Lebanon. He started working as a hairdresser 10 years ago, until he opened his own salon one year ago. Zein Alabidine wants to buy a coffee machine for his salon, in order for him to increase his income, therefore he is asking for $1000 to fulfill his project.

loans.use: Buy Coffee machine

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom S. is a villager in Trapaing Lvea village in Kandal province, Cambodia. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the villagers and others. Her husband, Mr. Tech Chum, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. He is also a farmer and he wants to cultivate rice during the dry season.  However, he does not have enough money to buy an ox to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Rom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox for her husband. Mrs. Rom S. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow a rice field.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mr. Heang P. was born in 1954 and he now lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Thy Mary, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Since their field is far from an irrigation system, Mr. Heang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water his field and fertilizer to make his crop more productive. Mr. Heang P. has four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is a 39-year-old married man with two children He lives in Jib Jennine in the Bekaa valley. Yasser has a mini-market in his village where he serves his community. Over the years, he has been able to attract a growing number of clients. Yasser is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more goods.

loans.use: Buy goods

loans.name: Sokh

texts.en: Mr. Sokh V. is a villager in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a blacksmith and his wife, Mrs. Dong Vin, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. They face a big problem because one of their three children needs an operation on a leg. Mr. Sokh V. decided to ask for a loan to pay for the hospital fees. He hopes his child will be well soon.

loans.use: To pay hospital fees.

loans.name: Osioda-Loi Adong Group

texts.en:
A. Loi (third from the left in the photo) is 25 years old and married with 2 children. When she acquired her certificate in tailoring seven years ago from Kumi training center, Loi began offering tailoring services in Kumi town. The fashionable ladies' outfits she sews have become quite popular. The income from her business enables her meet the needs of her family.

To boost her business, Loi will use this loan to purchase fabric like bitenge, silk, cotton and linen so she can meet the varying tastes and preferences of her customers. Her dream is to expand her business into offering bridal services and making school and company uniforms on a contract basis.

The other members of her group are involved in various businesses, including selling charcoal, second-hand clothes, and groceries, and local alcohol brewing.

loans.use: Purchase fabric like bitenge, silk, cotton and linen.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Mr. Son O. was born in 1955 and he now lives in Samroang Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Nu Soem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Because her field is infertile, Mr. Son O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump to water the field. Mr. Son O. has six children, one of whom is a motorbike repairer while another is a cleaner and the remaining four attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their seven children. Ali has been working as a taxi driver for 11 years. He requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Dinah E M. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with two children aged 15 and 20 years old. Dinah has been running an African traditional clothes business since 2008. She makes and sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Dinah currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase cloth and dye for making batik. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Dinah thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dye for making batik.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 51-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Husein has been working as a farmer for eight years. He plants vegetables, green beans, nuts and peaches. Husein requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase pesticides and seeds for his land. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan.

Husein is speciA. in his work because he has good quality vegetables. His clients are wholesalers. Husein decided to do this business because he inherited the land from his father and because he had learned the business since he was a kid. In the future, he plans to expand his farm.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and seeds for his land.

loans.name: Kiwedde-Amina Mohamad Group

texts.en:
N. Bageya (far left) is a 42 years old married of 4 children. Just like her group members, she is a hardworking hairdresser in Pallisa with skills  in plaiting, weaving, braiding, retouch and treatment. The loan proceeds are enabling Bageya boost her 7 years business by purchasing hair additions and treatments. 

Her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of the revenues. Her ambition is to open up a cereals store in her locality. It is the income from the business that pays for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Purchasing hair additions and treatments.

loans.name: Maemoun

texts.en:
Maemoun is a 22-year-old man who lives the Bekaa, Lebanon. Maemoun has been selling candies from a van for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase merchandise. This is the first time that Maemoun has requested a loan.

His clients are grocery shops in the Baalbeck area. When he first started his business, it was not very difficult for him because his father owns a grocery store and he was able to learn the business through him. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his candy-selling business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 64-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mohamad has been working as taxi van driver for four years. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

His clients are passengers. Mohamad likes his work because he gets to meet people and his clients pay directly, which means no debts.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Kiwedde-Namoyo Beatrice Group

texts.en:
Beatrice N. (far right) and the rest of her group members are charcoal sellers in Pallisa. She is a 48 year old single mother of four. Beatrice has been in the charcoal business for a period of 10 years. She mainly targets clients with restaurants because they make bulk purchases.

The loan proceeds are enabling Beatrice to purchase tree trunks which she burns into charcoal. Her ambition is to open up a fast food restaurant. The income she earns from the business helps her to educate and care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase tree trunks and logs.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. Adel has been working as a plumber for 12 years. Adel requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his machines. This is the first time that Adel has requested a loan.

His clients are contractors with municipalities. Adel decided on doing this business because he knows his business and he also has a shop for sanitary items. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Mwajuma A. B. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is three years old. Mwajuma has been running a cosmetics business since 2004. Her business is to purchase cosmetics wholesale and sell them retail.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mwajuma currently earns about 250 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 550 USD in order to purchase additional stock of cosmetics. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of stock. Mwajuma thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en:
Rachid is a 24-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Rachid has been working as a barber for seven years. He requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase items for his salon. This is his third (loan) cycle, and he has always paid on time.

The loan will help Rachid have secure cash. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Rachid decided to do this business because he is talented and he is aware of hairstyle trends. In the future, he plans to improve his barbershop by buying new tools.

loans.use: To purchase items for his salon.

loans.name: Alem Qaleen Baf Group

texts.en:
M. Alem is the group leader of the Alem Qaleen Baf group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Shama and M. Alem want to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Palwasha wants to take a loan for her husband’s business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families and solve their problems 

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: They all want to see progress in their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife. Ali is has been working as a furniture painter for ten years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase new painting tools and have some cash. Ali has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time.

The previous loans influenced his life in a good way. His clients are carpenters. Ali decided to do this business because of his talent in color mixing.

loans.use: To purchase new painting tools and have some cash.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Rose I. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 18 and 28.  Rose has been running a  genge (grocery store) since 2004. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood and a tin roof where people can buy general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Rose works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She currently earns about $400 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $925 USD to purchase rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. Rose thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This situation leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize and beans

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 48-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their seven children. Hussein has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. He sells fruits, vegetables and gas for households. Hussein requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase merchandise for his shop and also pay school tuition fees. This is his second loan cycle, and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan has influenced his life in a good way by improving his shop and his production. Hussein is speciA. in his work because he has good quality merchandise. When he first started his business, he was still learning the business, which wasn’t easy for him. Hussein decided to do this business because although he has been receiving his retirement salary, it is not enough for him to meet his family needs; that’s why he decided on opening a shop. In the future, he plans to improve and expand the gas business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop and also to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Kiwedde- Nandutu Aidat Group

texts.en:
N. Aidat (far right) represents her  small group of restaurant operators. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of 4. This hardworking lady owns continental services restaurant in Pallisa. She has 5 years experience in preparing both local and international dishes. Aidat has 2 lady employees who help her put with serving the customers. 

A plate of a local dish ranges between Ush100- Ush3000 whereas that of international  dishes costs betweenUsh5000-Ush10,000. Basing on her price list, her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of sales. Aidat is using the loan to purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals. Aidat has great ambitions! She dreams of opening up a catering institution and a chain of restaurants in various towns. From her income, she takes care of her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals.

loans.name: Sovin

texts.en:
Mr. Sovin P., 50, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Din, 44, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1979 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house. One son is a mechanician and one daughter is in grade 12.

Sovin and his wife have been selling dessert for many years. They sell their products at Olympic market in Phnom Penh. They make a profit of about $7.50 a day. Sovin is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Kiwedde-Grace Tukeya Group

texts.en:
Grace T. (2nd left) is 39 years old. She is hardworking and friendly. Like her group members, Grace sells fish in the Pallisa market. She generally purchases tilapia and Nile perch from nearby fish ponds, which she later dries in the sun and smokes. Her profit margin is approximately 20% of sales.

Grace is using the loan proceeds to purchase more fish to meet the increasing customer demand. She is a married mother of 4. Her ambition is to expand her fish selling business to neighboring districts. Grace supports her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 22-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Abbas has been working as a painter for eight years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase a car that will help him commute to his work more easily and give him more time to work. This is the first time that Abbas has requested a loan.

Abbas is special in his work because he has a new way of painting. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he had difficulty finding clients. He decided to do this business because he likes being independent. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car to get to work.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn E., 49, and her husband, Mr. Korn Kim, 52, live in a small village along National Road Number 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1969 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two sons are married and live outside the family home. Their daughter is a garment factory worker, one son is a farmer and the other son attends school. They also have two grandchildren who are living with them.

Torn is a rice farmer. Her husband has been a fisherman since 1979. He catches fish in the river near his house and sells the fish in his village. Torn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and diesel and to pay the rice-planting fee for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and diesel, and to pay the rice-planting fee

loans.name: Shebib

texts.en:
Shebib is a 39 year old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. 

Shebib has been working as a car mechanic for 25 years. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase spare parts for the cars. This is the first time that Shebib has applied for a loan.

Shebib is successful in his work because he is punctual and does high quality work. When he first started his business, he had difficulties getting known by clients. His clients can be anybody. Shebib decided to go into this business because he wanted to provide more income for his family. In the future, he plans to expand his business in order to be able to sell spare parts.

loans.use: Shebib will use the loan to purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Kararaka-Acom Sofia Group

texts.en:
Sofia A. (far right) represents the kararaka group of cereal sellers. She is 29 years old, married, with 2 children. Sofia has 7 years of experience selling cereals. She is therefore using the loan to replenish her stock of millet, rice and maize. Millet is highly demanded by the local brewers who use it as a primary ingredient in preparing ajong (a local brew). Her profit margin lies at approximately 20% of sales.

Sofia and her fellow group members purchase their stock from local farmers and millers. Sofia is hardworking and hopes to open up a grains outlet in the district. Her income enables her to support her husband in caring for the family. When she achieves her business dream, she wishes to build a modern home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase millet, rice and maize.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy U., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Thoeurn Sam, 29, live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children; one son who attends school and one daughter who is too young for school. They also have one niece is living with them. 

Vuthy is an English teacher at both Prek Phnao College and a private school in the village. He used to teach at his own house as well. His wife learned to sew from a neighbor and started her tailoring business in 2001. Vuthy is requesting a loan of $900 to pay for his master's degree fee and to replace his old motorbike.

loans.use: To pay for his master's degree fee and a motorbike

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Srey, 54, and her husband, Mr. Morn Tem, 45, married in 1979 and have eleven children: seven sons and four daughters. One of their children is a monk, two children are married and live outside the family home; one child is a garment factory worker, another child assists his father in their fishing business. Four children attend school and the other children are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Five about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

C. and her husband have been farming and fishing since 1980. They sell the fish they catch from the river in the village and Prek Phnao market about five kilometers from their home. They also grow rice on their farmland, a bit far from their house. C. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cows to use for growing rice and to buy a boat and a boat motor for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase cows and to buy a boat and a motor for fishing

loans.name: Khatera Ahmad Reshad Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Reshad is the group leader of the Khatera Ahmad Reshad group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Khatera and M. Zaref want to take a loan for their businesses. And Najeeba wants to take a loan for her tailoring shop in her house. They all want to see expansion and progress in their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families better. And make a better future for themselves and for their families. They are really happy with this loan process in this poor country.

loans.use: to expand  their businesses

loans.name: Kimsreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreng Pel, 50, and her husband married in 1980 and have four sons. Two of them attend school and assist their mother in their silk weaving business, and another child is a disabled person. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kimsreng has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman. Kimsreng is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Mr. Chhea A., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Sun Leng, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1980 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other children attend school and help their parents in their farming business when they are free from school.

Chhea and his wife have been growing rice for 29 years. Beside farming, they also buy mangoes from their villagers on contract for re-sale in their village. Chhea is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a rice-milling machine.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-milling machine

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame N. Mariam est une femme âgée de 38 ans qui a pour l’activité la vente de divers à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle a une fois bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES, et elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour reconstituer son stock.  Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter 6 tas de bois, 8 sacs de charbon, et 7 pièces de bazins [un type de pagne].  Elle a commencé son commerce depuis dix ans et elle est bien expérimentée. 
Madame N. est mariée avec monsieur OURO-DJOBO Kondo, qui est aussi un revendeur.  Ils ont 5 enfants à leur charge.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam N. is a 38 year old woman whose business is the retail of various goods in Agoè, a neighborhood north of Lomé. She once received a loan from WAGES, and she is requesting this second loan to reconstitute her stock. With this loan, she will buy 6 piles of wood, 8 bags of coal, and 7 pieces of bazin ( a type of pagne [wrap around fabric]). She started her business ten years ago and she is well experienced. Mrs. N. is married to Mr. Kondo OURO-DJOBO, who is also aretailer. Together they are responsible for five children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, coal, and bazins

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Theara Thuy, 34, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2000 and have three children: two daughters and one son. Two of their children attend school and the other one is still young.

Vanny has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason ever since he got married. Vanny is requesting her first loan of US$ 1000 to add to her own money to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Madame M. Yawa vend des pagnes et des produits de beauté à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis 1999, et le commerce va bien parce qu’il y a toujours une demande pour ces choses.  Avec ce premier crédit,  Madame M. va acheter 11 pièces de pagnes afin de mieux servir ses clients.  

Elle a 38 ans, elle est célibataire et elle a une enfant qui elle soutient avec le revenu de son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Yawa M. sell "pagnes" and beauty products in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She started this business in 1999, and it is doing well because there is always a demand for these things. With this initial loan, she is going to buy 11 lengths of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to serve her customers better. Ms. M. is 38 years old, unmarried, and has a child who she support with the income from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Mahkamjon

texts.en:
B. Mahkamjon is running a taxi services business in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married with three children. Mahkamjon has been in this business for 4 years. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals.

In order to expand his business Mahkamjon wants to buy a bigger car. For this reason he requests $1000 USD for the term of 12 months. We believe Mahkamjon's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: Purchasing new car to expand his business.

loans.name: Adjo Celestine

texts.fr:
Agée de 35 ans, Madame O. Adjo Celestine est une revendeuse de charbon qui sollicite son premier crédit au près de WAGES.  Avec ce crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock de charbon qu’elle vend au domicile à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis dix ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée.  

Nee a Lomé, Madame O. est mariée avec ISSA Iladji, un électricien.  Avec le revenu de son commerce, elle aide son mari de soutenir leurs 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms.Adjo Celestine O., age 35, is a retailer of charcoal who is requesting her first WAGES loan. She is going to use it to replenish her stock of charcoal, which she sells out of her home in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She started this commerce 10 years ago, so she has a lot of experience.

Born in Lomé, Ms. O. is married to Iladji ISSA, an electrician. With the income from her commerce, she helps her husband support their four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en:
Saifullo is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children. From a young age, he has helped his parents on their farm. Now, he is the father of his own family, which represents a deeper commitment to sustain the family through this activity independently. He mainly cultivates onions, potatoes and carrots. 

Saifullo wants to see his children prosper and become professionals. He is seeking this loan to invest in  mineral fertilizer and other supplies necessary for the preparation of his farmland.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Amama

texts.fr:
Madame T. Amama est une revendeuse des céréales à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de haricot et 6 sacs de maïs.  Avec ce nouveau stock elle peut mieux vendre et servir ses clients.
Madame TCHADODOMOU est née à Wahala, une des villes de Togo, et elle est mariée avec monsieur BRAIMA Arimiyawu, un chauffeur.  Ils ont 5 enfants ensemble, et le revenue que Madame TCHADODOMOU peut gagner avec ce prêt va les aider dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Amama T. is a retailer of grain in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan, and she is requesting this initial loan to buy 10 sacks of beans and 6 sacks of corn. With this new stock, she can do better in her sales and server her customers.

Ms. T. was born in Wahala, a city in Togo. She is married to Mr. Arimiyawu BRAIMA, a chauffeur. Together they have five children. The income she can earn with this loan is going to help them cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and corn

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
S. Azamjon has been farming from a young age. He supports four children, two of whom are studying in school.

Sarurov is seeking a loan to invest in crops. He has applied to IMON International to obtain a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy mineral fertilizer in order to prepare his land for upcoming season. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna D. sells food supplies such as beans, maize, and groundnuts in Nsuakye. She has been selling food supplies since 2000.  The loan she is requesting will be used as an additional capital to enable her to purchase more food to sell. She hopes to save the profit from her business for a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

Anna has received up to a junior high school education. She is married and has three children.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell

loans.name: Mirzohamdam

texts.en:
S. Mirzohamdam is 52 years old and married with four children. He is a farmer, tending crops and raising animals.

He is seeking a loan through IMON International to buy onion seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, and to continue investing in his crops. His dream is to improve his economic activity and for this he looks to the support of Kiva.

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel, and lubricants

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Z. Abdusattor is married and the father of four children. He works as a farmer. Educated until secondary school, he had to leave early because he couldn't afford to attend. Bestowed with a good work ethic, he has wholeheartedly committed himself to agriculture. 

He is growing vegetables: potato, onion, carrot and others. He is now seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1175 USD) to buy fertilizer for his crop to be prepared for the upcoming season and to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
