To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah C. sells clothing and fabric in Elmina. She has been engaged in this business since 2005.  The loan she requests will be used to purchase of clothing and fabric for resale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to reinvest back into the business and increase her capital base.

Hannah has received up to a junior high school education.  She is married and has one child.   She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and fabric for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth W. sells food supplies at the Elmina new market. She has received junior high education, is married and has 6 dependants. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth has been selling food supplies since 2000. She is responsible for meeting the family's financial needs as well as paying the children's school fees. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her purchases of food items for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house which she wants to build, with her husband, for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her supplies of food items for resale.

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en:
Doniyor is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children.

He is a humble person dedicated to growing crops. For the last 10 years, he has grown different types of agricultural products, which has helped him cover his home expenses. He enjoys being in contact with nature, although it’s hard to work with difficult weather conditions that affect his production. For Doniyor, having a healthy wife and happy children gives him strength to keep working hard.

Doniyor is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve his land. Doniyor thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan without any violations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Mary sells fish which she buys from the fishermen then brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them to be sold at the Liverpool street market in Elmina. She has done this since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to care for the family's financial needs as well as paying the children's school fees. Mary will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards a house which she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq R. is 42 years old and is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many other foodstuffs in his grocery store, which he built over 15 years ago. Natiq is requesting this loan to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food stocks for his store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes T. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Agnes sells charcoal, groceries and other food supplies like maize and groundnut at Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Agnes uses her income to support her husband with paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses. Agnes will use the loan as additional capital to purchase food items and charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase her purchases of food stuffs and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en: Zaman K. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his wife and three children. He owns and manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as tea, candies, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. He built his own store nine years ago, and he is proud that he does not need to spend money for space rental. Zaman has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. Zaman is requesting this loan to purchase more foodstuffs for his store and thus increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventories for his store

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en: Bismarck N. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Bismarck is a carpenter who is specialized in making room furniture at Elmina, which he has done since 2003. His wife has a small business as a trader. Bismarck uses his income to pay for housekeeping and other family expenses. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of wood, tools and equipment to enhance efficiency in his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Bismarck plans to reinvest back into the business to increase his capital base.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of wood, tools and equipment to enhance efficiency in his work.

loans.name: Switberitha K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Switberitha M. from Tukuyu. She is divorced with 2 children, aged 5 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent because he is an orphan. Switberitha has been running a bar since 1992. Her business is selling drinks such as beer and soft drinks.

Switberitha works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by 1 employee. Switberitha currently earns about 540 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1175 USD in order to purchase additional stock of drinks for her bar. In the future, she plans to sell drinks on a wholesale basis. Switberitha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of drinks for her bar

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama W. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Ama buys from the fishermen, then brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them for resale at the River side market near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Ama uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses. Ama will use the loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to assist her husband with building a canoe so that he can provide the fish for her to sell. This will allow her to buy less fish from other fishermen and cut down costs.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: Akbar K., age 39, is married and has three children. His mother and father are also living with him, and he is responsible for their expenses. He has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for eight years. Akbar is requesting a loan to increase his business, which he is qualified to receive due to his experience and determination, and his success so far. Akbar is counting on your help and support.

loans.use: Purchase more meat for sale and increase his isncome

loans.name: Azizali

texts.en: Azizali N. is a 56-year-old cattleman who is married and has four children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Azizali has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then raises and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Azizali gets up early in the morning to feed the animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. Azizali says that he works with only one aim in mind: to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Azizali would like to expand his business by purchasing two more calves. With your help, he hopes to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Ezberaga

texts.en: Ezberaga E. is 54 years old and was born in Sabirabad, Azerbaijan. He is the father of six children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a barn to house them in order to ensure their safety. AqroInvest provided a first loan to Ezberaga  and he completed it successfully. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of US $1,200 for the realization of this project. He promises to repay the loan in 15 months. When his dream is carried out, he will have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz Z. is 58 years old and is married with four children. Sixteen years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local bazaar traders and restaurants. Also, apart his main activity Chingiz is working half-time in a local private firm as an accountant, but his salary is just not enough to cover basic family needs.  Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Chingiz would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Chingiz is asking for a loan of US $1,200 in order to buy more calves to raise. Chingiz and his big family thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha M. is married and has 4 dependants. She has no formal education. Martha sells clothing and fabric. She is a seamstress by profession at Elmina new market and has been in this business since 1999. Martha uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Martha will use the loan as   increase her inventory of clothing and fabric to meet the increase in demand made by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Martha plans to help her husband in giving quality education to their children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing and fabric to meet the increase in costumer demands

loans.name: Mirzakhan

texts.en: Mirzakhan I. is 49 years old. He is married with four children. After finishing welding school in 1988, he started working in the local factory. But when the factory closed, Mirzakhan had to start his own business. With his faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little. He purchased the necessary tools and began accepting clients in his business. During the last 10 years, he became one of the best welders in the city. He gained respect among people as a hardworking and very punctual man. Now, Mirzakhan is finding that the tools that he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of US $1,200 that he will pay back over the course of 15 months. This loan will be used to buy modern tools and materials. With your help, Mirzakhan will be able to provide for his children's education and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To purchase modern  tools

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. sells food supplies at Akotobisin in Elmina. Comfort has received no formal education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a commercial driver. Comfort has been selling food supplies since 1994. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used toadditional increase her inventory of food products for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to add to her husband's savings and acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her inventory of food products for sale.

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.en: Ikhtiyar M. is 23 years old and lives in the small village of Sabirabad. He is married with four children. He supports his children and wife as well as his parents. His main source of income is farming and raising livestock. Ikhtiyar is an experienced livestock breeder. In order to better manage his herds and increase productivity, he needs to build an enclosure for them. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US $1,200 for the term of 15 months. This will allow him to make his livestock business more profitable so that he can better support his family.

loans.use: To build an enclosure for cattle

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla A. is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the small village of Sabirabad. Leyla breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her father also helps with this business. Leyla works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family. Now, Leyla is planning to purchase three calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan. Leyla would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Café businesses are a flourishing business in Azerbaijan for the simple reasons that all people have lunch out of their offices and men of Azerbaijan like to spend time in cafés in the evenings. Azad has been running his cafe in the small village of Sabirabad for the past five years. He is a cook and finished a special cookery college course.  He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings, as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Slowly, he began to understand what people want to eat and now his menu consists of only five meals but they are most popular. Azad is a father of three young children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing all he can in order to ensure his children the best future and make them well educated. Now he needs a loan of US $1,200 in order to make improvements in his cafe. He promises to repay the loan and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To make improvements to his cafe

loans.name: Kararaka- Mudondo Faisi Group

texts.en:
Faisi M. (far right) represents a kararaka group of local brewers. She is 44 years old. Faisi brews kasese and ajong which she sells to bartenders. She has 20 years of experience in brewing ajong from millet and kasese from extremely ripe bananas. From her sales, she earns a profit of roughly 30%.

The loan proceeds are enabling Faisi to purchase millet and sweet bananas, the major ingredients for her brew.  She is a guardian to 10 of her late brother’s children. Faisi dreams of opening up a bar in Pallisa. Her desire is to see her children complete school.

loans.use: To purchase millet and sweet banana.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and other items at Bronyibima in Elmina. Maame has received no formal education.  She is not yet married. Maame has been selling groceries products since 1999. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

What she is carrying are examples of what she trades in. She was out of inventory and was in the process of restocking when this picture was taken.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Kararaka-Okurut Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty O. (far left) represents kararaka poultry keepers. She is 30 years old with 4 years of experience in poultry keeping. She basically rears local chickens, which earn her a profit margin of 25% of sales. Betty works with her group members to ensure they vaccinate their poultry and feed them well. 

The loan funds are therefore enabling these women to purchase feed and vaccines for their poultry so as to increase production. Betty in particular dreams of rearing broilers and layers. She is a loving single mother of 4 and her income helps her provide for the basic needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward M. sells soft drinks on Liverpool Street in Elmina. Edward has received junior high school education.  He is married with 1 child and is wife is a secretary. Edward has been selling soft drinks since 1999. He is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. His loan will be used to increase his inventory of soft drinks for resale. He hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into his business and improve his capital base.

loans.use: His loan will be used to increase his supplies of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Kararaka- Asiyo Colostine Group

texts.en:
Colostine A. (2nd right) is 32 years old. She and her group members are involved in the selling of fruits and vegetables. A. is married with 5 children who attend school. She has 10 years of experience in the business. 

Colostine purchases her stock from local farmers and sells it in various markets. She is using the loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, cabbages and fruits like watermelon. She dreams of opening a retail shop. She also wants her children to study successfully.

loans.use: To purchase onions, tomatoes, cabbages and fruits like watermelon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Grace sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the sea side in Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save towards a house which she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel B. sells groceries and soft drinks at the Marin Park in Elmina. Samuel has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a fishmonger. Samuel has been selling groceries and soft drinks since 2006. He is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. His loan will be used as additional capital to increase his purchase of groceries and soft drinks to sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards a house which he wants to build for the family.

loans.use: His loan will be used to increase his inventory of groceries and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina A. is married and has 2 children. He has a primary school education. Kwamina sells fish which he buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation. He then sends them to the market for sale at the sea shore in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a trader. Kwamina uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Kwamina will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase his purchases of fish for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamina plans to save towards a house which he wants to build, with his wife, for the family.

loans.use: Kwamina will use the loan as an additional capital to increase his purchases of fish for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace P. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Grace sells fish which she buys from the fishermen and then brings them home for processing and preservation. She sends them to the market for sale at Cape Coast, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Grace plans to reinvest the new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to increase her capital and buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many group members. Freddy is 29 years old and is married, with one child. He sells different kinds of machinery for carpentry, locksmiths, and bakeries. Freddy buys the machines in the city of Lima, using a combination of loan money and his own savings. Each machine costs 2000 to 3000 soles. His customers pay him in cash. He works alone, seven days per week, and has had his business for the past six years. His store is located in a rented space near Puente Nueva, near the San Juan Bautista neighborhood of the city of Ayacucho. 

Freddy is requesting a loan to buy tools for his business. His goal for the future is to own his own store.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 29 years old and is the single mother of three children. Marcelina sells sweets from a cart near a large park in the city of Ayacucho. She has had this business for the past three years. Previously, she sold different kinds of merchandise. She works alone each day from 9am to 8pm. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan to restock her candy cart with a few things she’s missing. Her goal for the future is to improve and expand her business, and eventually establish her own juice stand or restaurant.

loans.use: Buy candy

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. Celestino is 40 years old and is married with four children. Celestino sells lumber to carpenters and contractors. He has had this business for the past eight years. Prior to that, he was in college to get his degree in Education. Celestino doesn’t have a set daily schedule, but he usually works from 6am to 12pm. 

Celestino is requesting a loan to buy tornillo and cedar wood. Celestino’s goal for the future is to have his own airplane.

loans.use: Buy tornillo and cedar wood

loans.name: Debora R.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Debora M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child aged 10. Debora has been running a crop-selling business since 2006. Her business is purchasing crops from villages on a wholesale basis and selling them on a retail basis.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Debora currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 550 USD in order to purchase more maize, rice, and sunflower seeds in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the business inventory. Debora thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, rice and sunflower seeds in bulk

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro tiene una movilidad que trabaja como taxi. Esta actividad es la que le genera ingresos ya que él es independiente y tiene que trabajar para solventar sus gastos de alimentación, educación y otros.
Vive en la zona de Las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus abuelos.
El crédito será destinado para compra de llantas y reparación de motor de su taxi.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Álvaro has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi. This is the work that generates his income as he is independent and has to work to meet his food, education and other expenses. He lives in the Las Lomas neighborhood of La Paz city, in his grandparent’s home. This loan will be used to buy tires and repair the engine of his taxi. This is the second time seeking a loan with Impro, his history qualifies him as a “1 client” which means he has a good payment history on his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and repair the engine of his taxi

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. 

Ahmad has been working as a contractor for 16 years. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase construction equipment. This is the first time that Ahmad has applied for a loan.

Ahmad is successful in his work because of his long experience in the construction business.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase construction machinery.

loans.name: Carmen Vilma Sofía

texts.en:
Carmen Vilma is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 43 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Carmen offers decorations and cakes for parties, weddings and other social occasions. She has had this business for five years, and works mostly on weekends, with the help of her children. She doesn’t have a car of her own, so she has to hire taxis to transport her decorations to each event. 

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy fabric, chairs and cake ingredients. Her goal for the future is to open her own bridal shop using the money from her savings account. She’s currently looking for an appropriate rental space to open her store.

loans.use: Buy fabric, chairs and cake ingredients

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This 51-year-old Neema M. from Mbeya. She is married with 6 children, between the ages of 26 and 32. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Neema has been running a “machinga” business selling used clothing, mitumba (cheap second-hand clothing), vitenge (traditional Tanzanian clothing) and shoes since 2006. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These second-hand clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

Neema works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 20 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 475 USD in order to purchase more shoes and clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to to increase the quantity and quality of her clothing inventory. Neema thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes and clothes for her business

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 49 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their four children.

Husein has been working as a taxi van driver for seven years. He has requested a loan 800 USD from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work and paint his van. This is the first time that Husein has applied for a loan.

Husein's clients are passengers from different areas. He decided on driving a taxi because he knows all the regions in Lebanon, as well as in Syria. In the future, he plans to purchase a bus in order to transport more passengers.

loans.use: Maintenance and a paint job for his taxi van.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa propia que ellos poseen. Ella administra su propio negocio de transporte desde hace 8 meses, le costó mucho esfuerzo poder tener su propio bus, la ruta que cubre abarca casi toda la ciudad, por lo que asegura la afluencia de pasajeros, el trabajo es todos los días, durante todo el día, para ello ha contratado a un chofer y en ocasiones ella misma es quien cobra los pasajes. La responsabilidad de Ana es mantener su carro en perfectas condiciones, para lo cual, lo lleva constantemente al taller mecánico para un mantenimiento periódico. Esta actividad le ha permitido ser un sostén más en su casa y ayudar a su mamá en la economía, además que considera que esta actividad es rentable y no tiene pierde, puesto que siempre existen personas que necesitan de este servicio. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque han visto en ella la responsabilidad con que maneja sus propios ingresos en beneficio de su casa. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en el mantenimiento mecánico que le harán a su movilidad para que trabaje en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Ana is 28-years-old, single and lives with her mother and siblings in the home that they own. She has run her own transportation business for 8 months, which requires a lot of effort to be able to have her own bus. The route that she covers spans almost the entire city so that she can ensure a large number of passengers. The job is all day, everyday. For that reason she has hired a driver and on occasion she she covers the routes herself. Ana’s responsibility is to maintain her bus in the perfect condition. For this she consistently takes it to a mechanic for periodic maintenance.

This activity has permitted Ana to be more of a support in her home and to help her mother economically. Additionally she considers this activity to be profitable and to have low risk for money loss because there are always people who will need her service. It is the first time that she asks for a loan with MFP. She was invited to form part of her communal bank because they had seen in her the responsibility with which she conducts her own business to benefit her home. The solicited loan will be invested in the maintenance of her bus so that she may work in perfect conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of her bus

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
A. is a 49 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. 

A. has been a diesel mechanic since 1982. He has now requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new kits for his garage. This is the first time that A. has requested a loan.

A. is successful in his work because he is the only one in his area to repair diesel motors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase new kits for his garage.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su propia casa. Hace año y medio que trabaja en la venta de comida, inicialmente tenía un restaurante, pero por el alza de los precios de alquiler de local tuvo que cerrar, ya que no le generaba las ganancias, es así que sigue vendiendo comida, pero prepara los alimentos en su misma casa y lo lleva en por porciones a los trabajadores de una institución pública cercana a su casa, de esa manera, Rosa se genere ingresos y lo sigue haciendo con la esperanza de reabrir su restaurante, meta que se ha propuesto y desea cumplir a corto plazo. Su negocio le es rentable, y además le agrada cocinar y siempre habrá comida disponible para su familia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y en el anterior ciclo ha cumplido con todos sus pagos, siendo muy responsable en las tareas de grupo que realizan en su banco comunal. Rosa está solicitando esta cantidad para alquilar un nuevo local para su restaurante y también para la compra de muebles para su ambientación.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children in her own house. She has worked in food sales for a year and a half, first owning a restaurant which had to close due to the rise in rental prices in the area as it was not making money and then she continued to sell food, preparing it in her own house and taking it in portions to the workers of a public institution near her home. This way Rosa generates income and continues to do so with the hope of reopening her restaurant, a goal she has proposed and wishes to accomplish in the short term.

This is her second loan with MFP and in her last cycle she completed all her repayments, being very responsible in the group tasks which are carried out at her communal bank. Rosa is asking for this loan amount in order to rent a new location for her restaurant and also to purchase furniture to create its atmosphere.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting of a location for her restaurant

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. Celestina is 56 years old and is married, with six children, two of whom she still supports. Celestina sells different kinds of lumber to builders. She employs several workers, who cut the wood to size. 

Celestina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy a truckload of tornillo and eucalyptus wood. Each truckload costs between 2800 and 3000 soles, so this loan will pay for most of the wood she needs. Her goal for the future is to proviD. well for her two youngest children, who are still dependent on her.

loans.use: Buy a truckload tornillo and eucalyptus wood

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. He has been working as a farmer for ten years. He sells potatoes, beans, nuts, and barley. 

Ali has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to settle his debts. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to settle his debts.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.en:
Rosa Maribel is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 33 years old and is married, with two children who are 4 and 3 years old. Rosa Maribel sells “cancha,” a popular local snack made of salted, toasted corn or pasta, and "cocoliche," a sweet snack made of sweetened, inflated pasta. Rosa sells cancha and cocoliche both wholesale and by the kilo. Together with her husband and several workers, Rosa takes the corn off the husk and toasts it in a large oven. She has had this business for the past three years. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy corn, pasta, and sugar. Her goal for the future is to own her own home. She currently lives in a rental house.

loans.use: Buy corn, pasta and sugar

loans.name: Margina

texts.es: Margina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultora, cultiva los productos nativos de su región, como la papa y el maíz, con esta actividad económica ha podido sostener a su familia, ya que con la cosecha la vende en el mercado. Años anteriores le ha traído buenas ganancias dedicarse a esta actividad, pero últimamente, debido a las condiciones climáticas, ha notado que sus ingresos han bajado considerablemente, por lo que recientemente Margina ha optado por sembrar alfalfa, que es el alimento para los animales, que le resulta más rentable cosecharla a menudo y venderla por paquetes. Dentro de sus planes está la implementación de su propia granja de animales menores en su casa. Es la primera vez que Margina tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, que es la razón predominante por la cual fue aceptada a ser una integrante más de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de animales menores; como pollos y cuyes, los comprará por docenas para iniciarse en la crianza y venta de animales.
texts.en:
Margina is 53 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has been a farmer for 20 years, growing crops native to her area, such as potato and corn. This has sustained her family as she sells her harvest at market. In previous years, this was a good way to make a living but lately, because of weather conditions, she has noticed a sharp drop in her revenues. Margina has therefore decided to sow alfalfa, which is used to feed animals as it is more profitable to harvest it often and sell by bales. As part of her plans, she intends to start a business raising small animals at home. This is the first time Margina is getting a loan from MFP. She is committed to pay on time, which is why she has been accepted as a member of her community bank. She will invest the loan in the purchase of small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs which she will buy by the dozen in order to start up her animal-raising and sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a business raising small animals.

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones M. sells fish which he buys from the fishermen. He brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the sea shore in Elmina. Jones has received a senior high education.  He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. Jones has been selling fish since 1998. He is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards a house he wants to put up for the family.

loans.use: His loan will be used to increase his capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.
